loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.en:
Hermenejildo is taking a loan of a $600 to improve his house; the house is old.

So he is taking out a loan to buy wood, stone, sand and also woven fiber.

loans.use: To buy  wood, stone, sand and also woven fiber

loans.name: Racha

texts.en:
Racha is a 33-year-old single lady, who has been working as a hairdresser and makeup artist from her house for nine years. She started this after she decided to quit her job as an employee in a tobacco company to start her own business and develop her living.

She developed her skills through vocational training she got when registering in a specialized beauty academy.

Racha is working hard to develop her business. She dreams of opening her private beauty salon in the future, and will work hard to save the requested capital for this step forward.

Today, Racha is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her necessary dental surgery and for the requested specialized device she must use.

Racha is very optimistic and a good standing borrower. This is her second loan cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower, where her first loan was invested in developing her living.

loans.use: To pay for her necessary dental surgery and for the requested specialized device she must use

loans.name: Alexis Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Alexis Argentina de 53  años de edad, es casada y vive con su esposo y sus hijos que no dependen de ella en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de Abarrotería, Medicinas  Papelería y Útiles Escolares, ella vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta familiar, medicamentos populares y otros, y también cuenta con cuadernos y demás útiles escolares,  Radica en la aldea de Esquimai de Pespire  al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Alexis esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de Abarrotería en general porque necesita surtir su negocio con manteca, pan, café, refrescos, papel higiénico, jabón, cloro, papel bond, lápices y otros, también necesita hacer algunas mejoras en su local o negocio tales como repellar, cambiar una parte del techo y el corredor también, para que su negocio tenga una mejor presentación, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y KIVA.
Doña Alexis su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido, y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - SEPTIEMBRE  2015
texts.en:
Alexis Argentina is 53 years old, married and lives in her own home with her husband and children who are no longer dependent on her. For the last 10 years she has worked at a store selling groceries, medicine, stationery and school supplies. She sells everything related to a family's basic needs, popular medication and other items, as well as exercise books and other school supplies.

Alexis is based in the community of Esquimai de Pespire in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman who wants to move forward with her life and strives day after day to improve her quality of life.

Alexis is applying for a loan to buy groceries in general because she needs to stock up her store with butter, bread, coffee, soft drink, toilet paper, soap, bleach, bond paper, pencils and other items. She also needs to do some improvements to her store and business such as plastering and also replacing part of the roof and the hall so that her store is better presented.

With the help of this loan Alexis would like to improve her income and her quality of life as well. She is a returning client who likes to work with Prisma and Kiva.

Alexis' dream is to have a good and well stocked business and at the same time she would like to improve her and her family's future.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - SEPTEMBER 2015

loans.use: to buy butter, bread, coffee, soft drink, toilet paper, soap, bleach, bond paper, pencils and cement, sand, etc. for her house/business.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is a 40-year-old married father of five children. Almost two years ago, he started selling cars to better cover his family's needs and expenses. He is a hard worker who deprives himself for the sake of his children.

Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees. He believes that education is the only way to guarantee his children's future.

Habib hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Del Mirador Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS GAVIOTAS DEL MIRADOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia ella es casada y tiene 68 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Las Gaviotas del Miradora community bank, which is located in the Santa Ana district in the La Convencion province of the department of Cusco.

Antonia, one of the members, is 68 years old, married and has seven children. This member runs a business growing fruit. She has a plot of land where she grows bananas, coffee, mandarins and oranges. She works from 6am until 5pm. She has been running this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to extend her plot of land. She is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertiliser.

The other members run businesses selling animals, farming, running a grocery store and selling food.

Antonia is thankful to those who are part of her dream through this platform and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser

loans.name: Deysi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Deysi, de 43 años de edad, es ama de casa, está casada, tiene cinco hijos, ella estudio hasta noveno grado, se casó hace 23 años, su esposo trabaja como empleado en un negocio de materiales eléctricos, cuatro de sus hijos viven con ella, los dos mayores ya trabajan.

Deysi, se dedica a la crianza de gallinas para vender, ella tiene sus gallinas en su casa y las engorda para venderlas a un mejor precio. 

Ella, necesita el préstamo para construir una galera para mantener sus gallinas resguardadas, de esta manera espera incrementar su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.

Deysi, sueña con que sus hijos estudien el próximo año y que tengan la oportunidad de estudiar en la universidad para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Deysi a 43 years old married housewife with five children. She studied up until ninth grade and married at 23. Her husband works for a store selling electrical goods. Four of her children live with her and the two eldest already work.

Deysi works raising chickens to sell. She keeps them in her house and fattens them up so she can sell them at the best price.

Deysi needs this loan to build a pen to keep her chickens safe so that she can expand her business and obtain a better income.

Deysi's dream is that her children will study next year. She hopes they will have the opportunity to go to university so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to build a pen to keep her chickens safe

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Friends of Jesus Convent School was recently founded on 11th May 2015 by the Catholic Sisters and is located in woodlands area of Lusaka Zambia. Friends of Jesus is run and directed by Sister Ruth. The sisters of Friends of Jesus Convent School as well as Sr.Ruth believe that securing a child’s foundation will help secure a child’s future holistically. Sr.Ruth prides herself in educating children and teaching them how to live and learn from others in society.

The mission of Friends of Jesus Convent School is to bring up a child that will be able to live for others in order to give life. They believe in order to produce individuals like this, a good holistic education has to be one of the elements in their foundation. Sister Ruth says ICT educational resources will be a great help in providing quality education to the children at her school.

Sr.Ruth is looking to get a loan to purchase ICT educational tablets called the ZeduPad tablets. The Zedupad tablet is a modern educational tablets pre-loaded with educational material mapped to the Zambia national curriculum. It is written voiced and animated and caters for primary school children.

loans.use: to purchase Zedupad tablets. An e-learning educational resource, pre-loaded with lessons in all subjects and mapped to the national primary school curriculum.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria is 48 years old and she lives with her husband, six children and mother-in-law in rural Lyantonde-westernn Uganda.

Joweria had only a basic education and does agriculture, raising animals and growing crops for both home consumption and to sell when the season is good. She sells mainly beans and corn to get income for her livelihood. She also has cows, pigs and chickens.

Joweria strives hard to ensure that she educates all her children, because she wants a bright future for them.

Joweria is now asking for this Kiva loan to an amount of UGX 4,000,000 in order to buy more piglets, and also goats for rearing and later trade.

loans.use: to buy piglets and goats to raise and sell later.

loans.name: Duharanirimbereheza Group

texts.en:
Emile is 35 years old and married. He has four children, ages 6 to 11. Emile is the president of the group Duharanirimbereheza, composed of 16 people, but one person has left because he realized that it is not a good time for him to take a loan. Emile is behind where there are three men and he is the first person on the right side.

He runs a boutique. Emile has been in this business for four years and sells soap, cooking oil, rice, and sugar in his store.

He requested this loan through Vision Finance Company to buy more soap, cooking oil, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

Emile says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his family status and increase his business level.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, cooking oil, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is the age of 40, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family as she is the mother of four children. Her one son has gotten married and lives separately. She is living with her children and spouse.

To manage her household expenses, she owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at home. Najma and her daughters have been stitching clothes for many years. Her younger daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work with her, and now she has gotten a lot of experience.

Najma wants to buy a new Juki machine for her daughter so that she could contribute in her income by sewing clothes. Therefore, Najma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can buy a new Juki machine for her younger daughter.

Najma wants to make some savings so that she could arrange the marriage ceremonies of her daughters. Najma thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new Juki sewing machine for her daughter's tailoring business.

loans.name: Angels Group

texts.en:
Elena is the featured borrower of Angels Group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Elena is a 56-year-old married mother of four children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved children and improve their living conditions.

Today, and in order to support her family's increasing living costs in the Philippines, and to cover her children increasing educational expenses, her acquired Al Majmoua Kiva loan will be invested in paying for her children's school tuition fees in her hometown in the Philippines.

The same is the case for the other two group members. April is a 26-year-old married mother of one child, and Mary Jean is a 36-year-old married mother of two children. They both want to send the money to their families in the Philippines to cover their children's increasing school tuition fees.

Elena is on the left, April is on the right and Mary Jean is the lady standing in the middle of the photo.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees in her hometown in the Philippines.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Vilma De Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Vilma de Buena Vista la encargada de este grupo es la señora Vilma quien tiene 41 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposo y tiene tres hijos menores de edad.  Su venta es productos comestibles(tienda)  la cual está en la calle principal de la aldea donde vive, y lleva 25 años vendiendo.  Su sueño es seguir agrandando la venta y darles lo mejor a sus hijos en estudio ya que ella no conto con el apoyo de sus padres y solo estudio dos grados de primaria.  Hay varias cosas que necesita comprar como granos básicos, embutidos en general, gaseosas en ofertas, jabones por caja  y mas,  pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por eso ella pide un préstamo para poder comprar lo que sus clientes le están pidiendo.
texts.en:
This is the Solidario Vilma de Buena Vista group. The member who runs this group is Vilma. She is 41 years old, lives with her husband and has three young children. She sells food in a store on the main street of the town where she lives. She has spent the last 25 years in this business.

Vilma's dream is to continue making bigger sales and to give her children the very best in their studies since she did not have the help of her parents and only studied up to grade two in primary school.

There are certain items that Vilma needs to buy such as staple grains, general packaged items, soft drinks on special, boxes of soap and more, however she does not have enough money to pay for these items. This is why she is applying for a loan so she can buy what her customers are asking for.

loans.use: to buy food to sell in her store

loans.name: Esperanza Del Progreso Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ESPERANZA DEL PROGRESO, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de La Convencion  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Lizbeth tiene 35 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus  actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día as su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma segur apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas entre otros.
Los socios en general de sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a  cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Esperanza del Progreso community bank which is located in the province of La Convencion in the department of Cusco.

This member, Lizbeth, is 35 years old, has two children and is single. She arranges her daily activities around her business of farming. This member is a responsible and diligent person who has spent a long time in this business. It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. At the same time, Lizbeth also raises small animals and she wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

This member is applying for a loan to buy fertiliser, seeds and other items.

In general, the group's members are grateful for the loans they have been given and they promise to make their repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, seeds and other items.

loans.name: Los Amigos De Alejuyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS AMIGOS DE ALEJUYOC, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de La Convencion  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Demecia tiene 51 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus  actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día as su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma segur apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas  entre otros.
Los socios en general de sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a  cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Los Amigos De Alejuyoc communal bank. The bank is located in the Convencion province in the Cusco department. Demecia, age 51, has three children and is in a common-law marriage. She alternates her daily activities with the business of growing fruit. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She has been in her business for a good amount of time. It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business each day.

She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, among others.

The general membership is grateful for the loan that was granted, and they pledge to make their established payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, among others.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 25 years old, single, and has one child. She operates a retail business, which she has been doing for six years. She currently earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES.  

Zipporah requested her third loan from VisionFund Kenya for 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase knitting threads and new supplies of cloth. With the anticipated profits from the expanded business, she will be able to repay her loan and provide for the basic needs of her family. She hopes to have a well established business and enjoy a better live with her family.

loans.use: to purchase knitting threads and new supplies of cloth

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis con 27 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia, junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona rural.

Jorge Luis se dedica a brindar servicio de chofer- camión; hace 01 año, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su Oyotún chiclayo y chiclayo Oyotún. Solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; construcción de su vivienda compra de calamina, adobe, y vigas, etc.

Socio recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 27 years old and lives in his own home together with his wife and children in a rural area of the Oyotún district in the Chiclayo province located in the department of Lambayeque, Peru.

Jorge Luis has worked as a truck driver for one year. He drives back and forth between Oyotún and Chiclayo for his job.

Jorge Luis is applying for a loan to invest in capital assets, build his home and buy corrugated iron, adobe and beams, etc.

This member is a regular client of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in capital assets, build his home and buy corrugated iron, adobe and beams, etc.

loans.name: El Naranjito De Tirijuay Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL NARANJITO DE TIRIJUAY, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de La Convencion  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Victoria  tiene 40 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus  actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día as su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma segur apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas  entre otros.
Los socios en general de sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a  cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the El Naranjito De Tirijuay communal bank. The bank is located in the Convencion province in the Cusco department. Victoria, age 40, is married and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of growing fruit. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She has been in her business for a good amount of time. It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business each day.

She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, among others.

The general membership is grateful for the loan that was granted, and they pledge to make their established payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, among others.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una mujer de 47 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 21 y 25 años, y su negocio es la sastrería.
Ella es emprendedora, independi4ente y muy trabajadora. Su neogcio lo realiza en el barrio ‘terrado’ caracterizado por estar alejado de la ciudad, la mayoría de los pobladores son migrantes de otras ciudades.
Catalina es de baja estatua, físico robusto y piel morena, su lengua materna es el Guraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como electricista y con sus hijos que estudian y trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la sastrería, ella se encarga de arreglar largo de pantalones, ancho de cintura y también realiza vestido s de niña a pedido, “tengo el deseo de confeccionar mi propia ropa para vender por mayor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas constantes y pedidos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de una máquina de coser collareta. Su sueño es vender su propia producción, ella desea comprar una máquina de coser collareta para producir ropa por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que lleva con esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Cartalina solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser collareta para vender ropa por mayor.
texts.en:
Catalina is a 47-year-old woman, is married, has two children aged 21 and 25, and sewing is her business. She is entrepreneurial, independent and hard-working. She does her work in the ‘terrado’ neighbourhood, which is located away from the city. Most of its inhabitants are migrants from other cities.

Catalina is short, broad and has brown skin. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, who works as an electrician, and her children, who study and work. They live in their own home, which is built from wood and has all basic services.

Her business is sewing. She hems and takes in the waist of pants, and also makes girl's dresses on request. She comments: "I wish to make my own clothes to sell them wholesale...". The advantage of her business is that she has constant sales and receives constant requests. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy an overlock sewing machine. Her dream is to sell her own products. She wishes to buy an overlock sewing machine to produce clothing wholesale.

This is the first loan with the institution in the 10 years that she has been doing this activity. It is because of these motives that Catalina requests a loan to purchase an overlock sewing machine to sell clothing wholesale.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine to sell clothing wholesale

loans.name: Musyoki

texts.en: Musyoki, 44, is married and has one child. He has been a farmer for 12 years. He earns a monthly income of 16,000 KES. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer, chemicals, and seeds.  He will use the profits from the harvest to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Cilos

texts.es:
Cilos con 43 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Callayuc, provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Cilos se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de café de la variedad Catimor. Cuenta con más de 12 años de experiencia en el rubro. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de abonos y pagos de peones para su aplicación del mismo en su cultivo de café.

Cilos es socio recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa, a manejado un crédito el cuál lo a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Cilos is 43 years old and lives together with his wife and his youngest son. They live in a home made out of rustic materials in the district of Callayuc in the Jaén province, located in the department of Cajamarca, Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the locals in his community.

Cilos works as a farmer growing Catimor coffee. He has had over 12 years of experience in this field. He is applying for a loan to buy fertiliser and pay workers to apply this fertiliser to his coffee crop.

Cilos is a regular client of Edpyme Alternativa. He has managed his loans and and made his repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and pay workers to apply this fertiliser to his coffee crop.

loans.name: Asmat's Group

texts.en:
Asmat is 32 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a kid.

She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time, her beauty products have been diminishing, and at this time, she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon.

Therefore, Asmat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so she will be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.

She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town because she wants to enhance her income. Asmat thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color and lotion for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en:
Ruqiya, age 50, lives in a rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession.

He has been constructing building and houses for many years. He is very expert in his art. He has constructed a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. He uses tools such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer and level, which have been wearing out. He wants to buy new tools to continue his construction services, but he does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy these tools.

Therefore, Ruqiya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can be empowered to buy tools for construction.

Ruqiya thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy construction tools for her husband's mason services.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 30-year-old woman living with her four children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw that does not belong to him. With the help of savings, he wants to buy a new rickshaw. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new rickshaw. He wants to start driving, but is looking for a lump sum amount.

Therefore, Fozia has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a new rickshaw and can drive the rickshaw happily. She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate a constant income.

Fozia is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband so he can generate a constant income.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en: Salah is a 28-year-old, married father of two children. He is a Palestinian refugee who works hard to improve and develop his family's living. Salah was working in a hospital when he decided to start his own business because his family's needs were increasing and the limited monthly salary wasn't enough to cover these increasing needs. Because Palestinians have limited access to the working sector, he decided to work as a taxi driver in 2011 providing transportation services to nearby villagers, students and employees. Salah's current low income limits him from accomplishing several necessary things. Thus an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be used to pay for necessary maintenance expenses in his house, especially the bathroom, to make necessary ceiling and wall repairs to stop leakage before the coming winter season. He hopes to develop his working sector in the future and at the same time improve his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for necessary maintenance expenses in his house.

loans.name: Gs Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
El Señor Abel tiene 34 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos habita en el municipio de trojes, al oriente Honduras, convive con su esposa y sus hijos, Su actividad principal es la Caficultura, desde hace 8 años.
Don Abel esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, y así obtener mejor cosecha de Café para tener un mejor precio en su temporada de cosecha y con esto tener mejores recursos.
Don Abel  su sueño es tener una buena producción para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos y su esposa, ademas de dejarles unas buenas tierras a sus hijos de herencia.
El grupo Villa Nueva lo integran.
Juven, Eliazar y Denis, tambien se dedican a la caficultura, y su sueños son obtener una buena cosecha y mejorar sus cultivos.

Trojes, Honduras - Septiembre 2015
texts.en:
Abel, age 34, has two children. He lives in the Trojes municipality in eastern Honduras. He lives with his wife and their children. His primary business activity for the past eight years has been growing coffee.

Abel is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers. This way he will get a better coffee harvest in order to get a better price for the season's harvest. With this he will have better resources. Abel's dream is to have a good production in order to give his children and his wife a better life in addition to leaving his children good land as an inheritance.

The Villa Nueva group is comprised Juven, Eliazar y Denis. They also grow coffee. Their dreams are to get a good harvest and to improve their crops.

Trojes, Honduras - September, 2015

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen, 37, is married and the mother of four children. She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloth in her community. Perveen has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to buy a supply of different cloth for resale. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving her children a good education through all her hard efforts in her business. Perveen is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for resale.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José Fernando con 19 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en casa de familiares junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales.

José Fernando se dedica al servicio de carga y servicio de construcción. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar en la mototaxi de su padre por las tardes. Se solicita préstamo para la compra de piezas para arreglo de furgón, con ello tendrá mejor servicio y atención a clientes y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en calidad de vida.

Socio nuevo para nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Jose Fernando is 19 years old, single, and lives at the home of some relatives, together with his parents. They live in the Cayalti district, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region of Perú. He has very good personal as well as professional references.

Jose Fernando makes a living in freight and construction services. Additionally he is engaged in work with his father's motorcycle taxi in the evenings. He is asking for this loan to purchase parts needed to fix his van, in order to provide better service and attention to customers, and thus to generate revenue for a better quality of life.

He is a new member for Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy parts to fix his van.

loans.name: Dúo Peña De Oro Group

texts.es:
Dúo Peña de Oro
Elva es casada tiene 2 hijas de (7,3 años de edad)  inicio su negocio hace tres años para apoyar a su esposo en los ingresos del hogar ella solicita el crédito para invertir en la mini tienda que tiene necesita comprar más arroz, frijol, azúcar, café, jabón, etc. Ya que su comunidad está muy retirada y ella quiere satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Elva is married and has two children who are seven and three years old. She started her business three years ago to support her husband with the household income.

She is requesting a loan in order to invest in her small store. She needs to buy more rice, beans, sugar, coffee, soap, etc. Her community is quite isolated, and she hopes to satisfy the needs of her customers. She hopes that you can help her with her requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase food products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Esperance is 31 years old and is married. She has three children between the ages of 4 and 9. She is a farmer and works from 6 a.m. until 12 a.m. every day.

Esperance is the third person on the first line from right side. Other members in the group have different businesses like a boutique and local drinks. She is the leader of the group, which is called "Twisungane," and she has two years of experience.

Esperance has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy many goats, cows and chickens for sale. With the profit from the loan, she will expand her business by buying different animals and selling them to the different districts of the country, and pay medical insurance for her children.

loans.use: to buy many goats, cows and chickens for resale.

loans.name: Fortaleza De Ollantaytambo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FORTALEZA DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes ella es conviviente  y tiene 26 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Fortaleza De Ollantaytambo communal bank. This bank is located in the Paucartambo district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department. Lourdes, age 26, is in a common-law marriage and has one son. She works in her business of selling clothes. She sells pants, blouses, and polo style shirts. She has been engaged in this business for several years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store.

She is requesting the loan to buy shoes, polo style shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

Her picture is attached to to group photo. Her picture was taking after the meeting. She asked permission to do so because of work.

The other members have businesses selling animals, selling grains, a grocery store, and selling food.

She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through these means. She pledges to make her payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo style shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Gs Dios Nos Guia Group

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos provienen de su negocio que es la venta de verduras, leche y cuajada, este negocio lo atiende de manera personal y se levanta muy temprano para poder atender a sus clientes, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, sus principales clientes son vecinos de su comunidad y comunidades vecinas ya que sale a vender de manera ambulante.
Doña Antonia solicita el apoyo del Préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de la cuajada y verduras como ser: leche, pastilla de cuajo, sal y de las verduras, tomate, chile, cebolla, yuca, papas, patastes y aguacates.
Doña Antonia Sueña con poder extender su negocio y convertirlo en un pequeño mercado de verduras y frutas de esta forma mejorara su fuente de ingresos y nivel de vida, ella solicita el préstamo de forma grupal con las siguientes personas:
Eva se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 17 años.
Fanny se dedica a la venta de tortillas, verduras, leche y cuajada, desde hace 7 años.
y Evangelina se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 6 años, ellas solicitan el préstamo porque no cuentan con el capital suficiente para mejorar sus negocios y abastecerlos de productos para la venta.  


Honduras - Agosto 2015
texts.en:
Antonia is an enterprising woman who works as a merchant. Her main source of income is her business, which is selling vegetables, milk and homemade cheese. She runs this business personally, and she gets up very early to serve her customers. She has done this work for 12 years. Her business is located in her home, and her main customers are neighbors in her community and also in nearby communities, since she goes out to sell as a mobile vendor.

Antonia is requesting support through a loan to buy raw materials to make cheese, as well as vegetables to sell, including milk, rennet tablets, salt, and vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, yuca, potatoes, chayote squash and avocados.

Antonia dreams of expanding her business and turning it into a small vegetable and fruit market. In this way she would improve her source of income and her living conditions. She is requesting the loan along with her group, with the following people:

Eva has sold tortillas for 17 years;
Fanny has worked for 7 years selling tortillas, vegetables, milk and homemade cheese;
and Evangelina has sold tortillas for 6 years.

They are requesting the loan because they lack sufficient capital to improve their businesses and stock up on products for sale. .

Honduras - August 2015

loans.use: to buy milk, rennet tablets, salt, and vegetables including tomatoes, peppers, onions, yuca, potatoes, chayote squash, and avocados for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old. She is married and has 3 children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay her children's school fees.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 42 years old. She is married and has four children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 11 years.

She earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds for crop production.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds for crop production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old. She is married and has three children.

Mary's business is farming. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Waeni

texts.en:
Waeni is 25 years old. She is married and has two children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hope and dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Brenda Yaneth

texts.es:
Brenda, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltera y vive con su hermano y una hermana en la casa de su mamá.

Brenda, se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en la casa de una señora que requiere cuidados especiales, pero aparte de eso se involucra en las actividades de comercio junto con su hermana y en la agricultura también.

Brenda, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, este cultivo es para el consumo familiar.

A futuro desea ampliar la casa y tener su propio cuarto y tener un negocio estable junto con su hermana.
texts.en:
Brenda is 30 years old and studied up to sixth grade. She is single and lives with her brother and a sister in her mother's house. Brenda takes care of the household chores in the home of a woman who requires special care, but she also is involved in some commercial endeavors with her sister, as well as in agriculture.

Brenda needs the loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides in order to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn. This crop is for family consumption. In the future, she hopes to increase the size of her house, have her own room, and have a stable business alongside her sister.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn for family consumption.

loans.name: Tres Barrios De Ccoricancha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES BARRIOS DE CCORICANCHA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly ella es soltera y tiene 27 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de granos secos, la socia vende maiz,trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Tres Barrios De Coricancha” (The Three Neighborhoods of Coricancha). This bank is located in the district of Chinchero which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

One member is Ms. Nelly. She is single, twenty-seven years old, and has one son. She works in her dry grain business. She sells corn, wheat, and quinoa. She works from 8 A.M. to 5 P.M. She already has four years of experience in this business, and it’s going very well. Her dream is to have a business location where she can sell cereals. She’s requesting a loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The other members have businesses in animal sales, cereal sales, food sales, and a grocery store.

Nelly is thankful for all of those who are a part of her dream through this, and she promises to complete the payment of her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 9 years. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, etc.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, etc

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 45 and living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by trade; he sells milk in the market.

His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk from his shop. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market, and the customers as well. Due to his quality and low reasonable rates, many of the customers like to buy milk from him.

He wants to increase the stock of milk on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in a large quantity, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in a large quantity.

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy more milk in bulk to sell.

Razia is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk in bulk for her husband's milk shop.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 40-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motorcars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles and renews the turbine and radiators.

He has been doing this business for many years and till this time his business is much settled. Due to continuously working over lathe machine, some important parts have torn off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of the affected parts, it affects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.

Her husband does not have a sufficient amount to buy spare parts to fix the problem of the lathe machine and buy cutting tools. Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy spare parts for his lathe machine.

Rehana hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business, as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy cast iron for her husband's lathe machine shop so he can manufacture more spare parts.

loans.name: Marta Patricia

texts.es: Marta Patricia: ella tiene 53 años de edad, se dedica a la venta y a la elaboración de costuras desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de telas para elaborar sus costuras ya que sus clientes le han pedido y no tiene para satisfacer sus necesidades, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado desde ya gradece su ayuda en el negocio.
texts.en: Marta Patricia: She is 53 years old. She has been dedicated to selling and making clothing for many years. At this time, she is requesting this loan to buy fabric to make her clothing since her customers have ordered from her and she doesn't have enough to satisfy her needs. Hoping that you can help her with the loan requested, she is  thankful for your help with her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing to sell.

loans.name: Olinda Del Carmen

texts.es: Olinda es una comerciante que en sus inicios aperturó una tienda de víveres en un barrio ubicado en Cartagena de Indias, pero como este negocio requería de mucho capital, al no tener acceso al sistema financiero optaba por solicitarle dinero a personas agiotistas que le cobraban unas tasas de interés muy elevadas, sin embargo poco a poco su tienda fue creciendo y denotando un nicho en el sector, lo que permitió que ingresara la competencia y ella por no contar con mucho capital tuviese que dejar este negocio y dedicarse exclusivamente a comercializar bebidas.  Hoy en día ella ofrece un variado surtido de gaseosas, jugos naturales, bolis de frutas, cubetas de hielo y cervezas a los residentes del sector y colegios cercanos. Olinda es madre de cuatro hijos y reside con su cónyuge que la ha apoyado siempre en sus negocios, actividad que le han permitido brindar bienestar a su familia.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar bebidas al por mayor e insumos para la elaboración de bolis y avenas. Esta inversión minimiza sus costos y eleva sus utilidades.  Su meta a futuro son adecuar un local comercial en su vivienda para continuar cerca de sus hijos menores de edad.
texts.en:
Olinda is a vendor who was just getting started when she opened a store selling necessities in a neighborhood located in Cartagena de Indias, but as that business needed a lot of capital and she didn’t have access to banks, she chose to borrow money from loan sharks who charged her very high interest rates.  Nevertheless, little by little her store was growing and finding its niche in the market.  This allowed her to get into the fray, but since she didn’t have much capital she had to leave that business and dedicate herself just to selling drinks.  

These days she sells a varied stock of soda, natural juices, fruit freezer pops, ice cubes, and beer to the residents of the neighborhood and to the nearby schools.  Olinda is the mother of four children.  She lives with her partner, who has always supported her in her business endeavors—something that has allowed her to ensure her family’s well-being.  

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy drinks in bulk, as well as ingredients to make freezer pops and oatmeal drinks.  This investment keeps her costs down and increases her profits.  Her goal in the future is to create a sales space in her home so that she can be near her young children.

loans.use: to buy drinks in bulk as well as ingredients to make freezer pops and oatmeal-based drinks.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Carlos Arnoldo

texts.es:
Carlos, de 20 años de edad, está soltero, vive con su madre y no tiene hijos, solo sus padres dependen económicamente de él.

Carlos, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, desde que era niño le gustaba esta actividad y siempre la ha realizado, la pequeña granja la tiene en su casa y ya tiene 8 cerdos para la venta.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar concentrado y harinilla para los cerdos y para comprar un lote de 10 cerdos pequeños, para engordarlos y luego venderlos.

Carlos, sueña con tener una granja de cerdos más grande y dedicarse a la producción y venta de carne.
texts.en:
Carlos is 20 years old, single, and lives with his mother. He does not have children, but his parents depend on him economically. Carlos works in pig raising. Since he was a child he has always liked and worked in this field. He has a small farm at their home and already has eight pigs for sale.

He needs the loan to purchase concentrated animal feed and cornflour for the pigs, and to purchase a group of 10 small pigs, in order to fatten them up and then sell them. Carlos' dream is to have a bigger pig farm and work in meat production and sales.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated animal feed and cornflour for his pigs, and to purchase a group of 10 small pigs, fatten them up, and then sell them.

loans.name: Dominiko

texts.en:
Dominiko is a 40-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda.The task of looking after his family rests solely on him.

He is a farmer who mainly grows maize and rice specifically for commercial purposes. With the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children, start construction of his residential house and look after his extended family. He owns a motorcycle transport business which has facilitated him with daily income since farming is seasonal.

His personal dream is to educate his children up to the university level. His business dream is to buy another motorcycle for his transport business and to expand his farming activities.

Dominiko intends to use this loan to buy windows and doors for his house.

loans.use: to buy windows and doors for his house.

loans.name: Onjarison

texts.fr:
Onjarison est un agriculteur très actif en zèle de 30 ans. Il est marié et sa femme est couturière et confectionne et vend des vêtements en série. Le couple a un adorable petit garçon de 2 ans pas encore scolarisé.
Il se spécialise dans la culture des oignons depuis 2004 et désire la développer de plus en plus. Actuellement, la culture s'étend sur un champ de environ 1/4 d'hectare et il voudrait l'étendre dans plusieurs hectares et suivre la technique moderne selon les normes. Rappelons que les oignons font parties des produits  exportés à Madagascar.
texts.en:
Onjarison is a very active and zealous 30-year-old farmer. He is married, and his wife is a seamstress. She makes and sells sets of clothing. The couple has an adorable 2-year-old boy who is not yet in school.

Since 2004, he has been specializing in farming onions and would like to develop his farming more and more. Currently, his farm is on about a 1/4 hectare field, and he would like to expand it to be many hectares and to follow modern farming techniques. We note that onions are one of the exported products from Madagascar.

loans.use: to buy various fertilizers, medicines.

loans.name: Lilian Iveth

texts.es:
Lilian, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y la albañilería, vive junto a sus dos hermanos. 

Lilian, no tiene hijos pero tiene 5 meses de embarazo, se dedica a la venta de meriendas (empanadas, tamales de pollo, elote, pasteles y enchiladas), este negocio lo realiza junto a la esposa de su hermano y también trabajan en la agricultura. 

Lilian, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para aplicarlo al cultivo de maíz y para comprar algunas herramientas de trabajo para su esposo como (nivel, pala, cuchara, cinta y una carretilla de mano). 

Lilian, desea tener estabilidad económica para cuando nazca su hijo y darle todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Lilian, 25 years old, finished ninth grade. She is married. Her spouse works in farming and masonry. She lives alongside her two brothers.

Lilian does not have children but she is five months pregnant. She is dedicated to selling snacks (empanadas, chicken tamales, corn, cakes and enchiladas). She started this business with her sister-in-law and they also work in agriculture.

Lilian needs the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to apply to her maize crop and to buy some tools for her husband like a level, shovel, trowel, tape measure and a wheelbarrow.

Lilian wishes to have economic stability in time for the birth of her baby and to give her baby everything it needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her maize crops and to buy tools for her husband like a level, shovel, trowel, tape measure and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair her stable.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 54 years old and married with three children.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Leah has been farming rice for nine years now and has borrowed 28 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Rosaura

texts.es:
María, de 77 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que ya están casados, ella vive solo con un nieto, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, esta actividad siempre la realizo con su esposo que falleció hace 13 años.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento del cultivo de maíz.

María, sueña con tener una buena cosecha debido a que perdió 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz por los fenómenos naturales o clima que azotaron la zona oriental.
texts.en:
María is 77 years old and has two children who are married. She lives alone with a grandson, and works in agriculture and livestock. She has always worked in this field with her husband, who passed away 13 years ago.

María needs this loan to purchase agricultural supplies for the maintenance of her corn crop. María's dream is to have a good harvest, due to the fact that she lost 14,000 square meters of her corn crops due to natural phenomena and weather that devastated the eastern region.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for the maintenance of her corn crop.

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: Rolando es un hombre trabajador de 35 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de frazadas y pan francés, ya que muy temprano por la mañana sale a vender el pan francés y al regresar a su casa toma las frazadas para llevarlas a vender de forma ambulante en los mercados y calles principales lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Rolando vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijas de 17 y 11 años de edad. Rolando desea invertir en su negocio de venta de frazadas, ya que no logra cumplir con todos los pedidos que tiene por falta de liquidez económica, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en frazadas por mayoreo y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: 35-year-old Rolando is a hardworking man who sells blankets and French bread. He gets up very early in the morning to go out and sell French bread and, when he gets back home, he collects his blankets and goes to sell them at markets or on the main streets. This enables him to support his family. Rolando lives in his own home, with his wife and 2 daughters, aged 17 and 11. Rolando wants to invest in his blanket-selling business, as he cannot meet all his orders due to insufficient cash-flow. Therefore, he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy blankets in bulk and, as a result, boost his income.

loans.use: to buy blankets in bulk so he can boost his income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia Elsa se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elsa works in the business of artisan crafts. She sells woven textiles, sweaters, and blankets. She works from 8:00am until 7:00pm. She has been working in this business for eight years and it's going very well.

Her dream is to expand her textile sales business. She is requesting the loan to purchase woven textiles and sweaters. She is happy to receive the loan and is committed to fulfilling all the payments.

loans.use: to purchase woven textiles and sweaters.

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es:
La socia Rosalva se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es comprarse un carro nuevo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosalva continues to be dedicated to her transportation business. She already has many years with this business and it's going very well. Her dream is to buy herself a new car. She is requesting the loan to buy tires for her car.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy tires for her car.

loans.name: Margaritta

texts.en:
Margaritta sells dried fish to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She and her husband work hard to support their family.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fish and other necessary ingredients for her business.

Margaritta would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and other necessary ingredients for her business

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business direct selling Personal Collection products in the Philippines. Emely has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products from Personal Collection to sell to her customers.

In the future, Emely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more products from Personal Collection, a direct selling company, to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen, age 40, lives in Lahore with her husband and three of her four children. Her husband supports the family by operating a restaurant business. He has run his business for many years, and it provides the sole income for supporting the family.

He would like to expand his menu so that he can offer more options to his valuable customers. This will allow him to grow his income and better support his family. To that end, Yasmeen is requesting a loan for the restaurant establishment. With the loan funds, her husband will buy such ingredients as chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, and yogurt.

She is hopeful that this loan will help the restaurant generate more profit, as she hopes to build savings to ensure the family's well-being.

Yasmeen thanks her Kiva lenders and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy such ingredients as chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, and yogurt

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 36 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos, es mecánico, estudio hasta cuarto grado y sus hijos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.

José, se dedica a la agricultura y tiene dos vacas, actualmente tiene cultivados 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y está produciendo 28 botellas de leche, además trabaja como mecánico en un pequeño taller que posee.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una vaca lechera, para aumentar la producción de leche y obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

Sueña con tener una ganadería y procesar todos los derivados de la leche como crema, cuajada, queso y requesón para tener una fuente de ingreso fija, para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and married with two children. He is a mechanic, and he went to school up to fourth grade. His children are studying in the school in their community.

José works in agriculture, and he has two cows. He has 14,000 square meters planted with corn, and he is producing 28 bottles of milk. He also works as a mechanic in a small workshop he owns.

He needs the loan to buy a milk cow, in order to increase his milk production and obtain a better income to improve his family's quality of life.

He dreams of having a livestock operation and processing all of the various milk products such as cream, cheese, curds and ricotta-style cheese, in order to have a fixed source of income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE COPACABANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina ella es casada y tiene 65 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de  fotocopiadora y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes, la socia realiza servicios de tipeos  y fotocopias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de multiservicios.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papeles y tintas para la fotocopiadora.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de madera, negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de carros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Virgin of Copacabana community bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Paulina. She is married and is 65 years old and has three children. She works in her photocopier business and also is dedicated to a business selling beauty products such as lipsticks, creams and perfumes. She performs typing and photocopy services. She works from 8AM until 5PM. She has had this business for five years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand the multi-service business. The member is requesting the loan to buy paper and ink for the photocopier.

The other members are dedicated to the business selling wood, a photocopier business, a grocery store and a business selling cars.

The member is thankful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy paper and ink for the photocopier.

loans.name: Gestrudes

texts.en:
Gestrudes catches and sells fish to earn her living. She has been engaged in her fishing business for 20 years. She and her husband work hard to support their family.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase new fish nets, as well as materials with which to repair her fishing boat.

In the future, Gestrudes would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new fish nets, as well as materials with which to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia, age 64, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. In her store, she sells grocery items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, and candies, as well as household goods such as detergent and soap.

Verginia and her husband have two children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store.

In the future, Verginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina lives in a town in Timor-Leste with her family. She is married and opened her own sales kiosk in 2011. She generates a good income from selling.

She requested a $1500 loan to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy more stock to keep in her store like shoes, bags, and toys.

After years of doing business, Celina dreams of turning her kiosk into a big business.

loans.use: buy shoes, bags, toys, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Yohanny

texts.es: Nelson es un técnico en mantenimiento de impresoras y computadores, que emprendió su propio negocio en el año 2012, luego de haber laborado con un contratista ejerciendo esta labor y tiempo después decidió cerrar su negocio. Nelson aprovecho la base de clientes a la que había ofrecido sus servicios para empezar a funcionar como trabajador independiente, obteniendo excelentes resultados con los que ha logrado solventar a su familia; él es padre de dos hijos menores de edad y vive con su cónyuge en un barrio de Bogotá.  Diariamente el realiza servicios en cualquier localidad de la capital y necesita tener un stock de repuestos para realizar más ágilmente sus servicios, es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en discos duros, memorias, fuentes de poder, boart, entre otros.  De este modo sus servicios de diagnósticos podrán ser cotizados e incluso realizados inmediatamente. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su base de clientes y poder comprar su casa propia.
texts.en: Nelson is a computer and printer maintenance technician. He was employed by a contractor who worked in this area and, when the contractor decided to give up, Nelson set up his own business. He inherited the client base he had worked for previously and began to work freelance, achieving excellent results which enabled him to cover all his family's needs. he is the father of two small children and he lives with his wife in a district of Bogotá. He works daily, in any part of the city and he needs to have a stock of spare parts so he can provide his services more efficiently. It is for this reason that he is applying for a Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy hard disks, memories, power supply units, motherboards, etc. This means that he will be able to provide instant quotes for his diagnostic services and even do the work immediately. His ambition for the future is to widen his client base and be able to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy hard disks, memories, power supply units, motherboards, etc.

loans.name: Dona Group

texts.en:
Sobhiye (above, right) is the featured borrower for Dona Group. She and her other group members have always been neighbors and friends so they decided to take this Al Majmoua loan. They work hard to develop their businesses. The other group members are Rasha (middle) and Dona (left).

Sobhiye is a 53-year-old married mother of three. Five years ago she started selling clothes from her house to cover the needs and expenses of her children. She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is working hard to develop her business.

She is taking out a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise for sale with a new collection of fashionable clothes to satisfy her customers' needs in the upcoming winter season.

loans.use: increase her merchandise with a new collection of fashionable clothes to satisfy her customers' needs in the upcoming winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Alto Rosaspata -Riobamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ALTO ROSASPATA-RIOBAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Yanatile, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Encatnacion ella es conviviente y tiene 53 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Alto Rosaspata-Riobamba Communal Bank, located in the district of Yanatile, belonging to the province of Calca and the department of Cusco. Member Encarnación is 53 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children. She has a fruit business and a plot of land where she grows plantains, coffee, tangerines, and oranges. She works from 6:00am until 5:00pm.

She is a hardworking and enterprising person, and through her business she is able to help her family move forward. She has been working in this business for several years, and it's going very well. Her dream is to expand the plot of land where her crops are. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

The other members have businesses in animal sales, clothing sales, grocery stores, and food sales. Encarnación is thankful to those who have been part of her dream through Kiva, and she is committed to fulfilling the repayment of her loan within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Andino Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ANDINO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ivone Roxana ella es soltera y tiene 52 años; La socia trabaja como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio para vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the "ANDINO" communal bank, which is situated in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name. The featured member is Ivone Roxana, a single woman of 52. She works from 8am to 2pm as a primary teacher. She has been a teacher for 8 years and is doing very well. Her dream is to run a business selling clothing. She is applying for the loan to buy a TV for her home. The other group members have businesses involving the internet, selling clothing, selling groceries and selling books. The member is grateful to those who are helping her achieve her ambition in this way and she promises to make all her repayments in the set time period.

loans.use: to buy a TV for her home.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 37 years old and is married with three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Charito requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Charito would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rubilla

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rubilla works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Rubilla is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Rubilla has sustained her business activities through 11 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 38 years old and married with four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising ducks in the Philippines. Rhodora requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed for her ducks.

She has been raising ducks for 11 years now and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rhodora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional sacks of feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Elsy De La Paz

texts.es:
Elsy, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora, estudió hasta bachillerato con especialidad en técnico en computación, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y al cuido de animales bovinos y viven en armonía junto con sus dos hijos, los cuales son estudiantes de secundaria y primaria respectivamente.

Elsy, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sin embargo también debe de estar pendiente de darle alimentación y mantenimiento a sus aves de corral, de las cuales obtienen huevos, alimento y dinero con la venta de ellas. 

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar cerdos para criarlos enfrente de su casa y así de esa manera poder tener otras fuentes de ingreso con la venta de la carne.

Elsy, sueña con tener muchos animales en su casa, para criarlos y obtener ganancias con los productos y subproductos que éstos generen.- También desea que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales y tengan un futuro de éxito.
texts.en:
Elsy, 30 years of age, is a very determined woman. She studied through high school, with a technical specialty in information technology. She is in a relationship, and her partner makes his living in agriculture, raising cattle. The live in harmony with their two children, who are in secondary and primary school, respectively.
