Elsy spends her time on household chores, but she also has to look after and feed her poultry, from which she gets eggs, food, and money from selling them.

The loan for which she has applied is to buy pigs to raise them in front of her house, so that she can have another source of money with the sale of the meat.

Elsy dreams of having a lot of animals at her house, to raise and earn money from the products and sub-products that they generate. She would also like her children to become professionals and to have a successful future.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es: Ana es una mujer trabajadora de 39 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder sacar adelante a su familia apoyada en este pequeño negocio. Ana habita desde hace ya 7 años en su vivienda que aunque es muy humilde ella se siente feliz ya que vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos una niña de 2 años y un varón de 4 años de edad. Ana desea invertir en más productos para su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pescado, cangrejos, camarones y langostas para su venta de mariscos y así mejorar sus ganancias, ya que su vivienda logro mejorar con el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Ana is a hard working, 39 year old woman, who works selling fish and seafood. She has worked at this job for several years, and is happy that she has been able to move her family forward, supported by her small business. Ana has lived for 7 years in a house that, although humble, brings her happiness as she lives there with her husband and their two children, a two year old girl and a four your old boy.

Ana wants to invest in more products for her business. For that reason she seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in fish, crab, shrimp and lobster for her business selling seafood, in order to increase her earnings. With her prior loan she was able to improve her home.

loans.use: to invest in fish, crab, shrimp and lobster for her business selling seafood, in order to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Dúo Fortaleza Mía Group

texts.es: Dúo Fortaleza Mía La señora Karina de 33 años de edad, es la encargada del dúo Fortaleza Mía, tiene un bebe de año y medio;  se dedica a atender su tienda  para estar cerca de su bebe y cuidarlo ahora porque es pequeño, necesita ampliar su negocio con productos novedosos como bolsas y carteras para damas y señoritas; su sueño es seguir creciendo y tener una tienda bien surtida y poder incrementar sus ventas y así apoyar a su esposo económicamente.  Siempre busca ofertas porque ella siempre compra en efectivo en las tiendas.  Es por ello que necesita un préstamo para comprar su mercadería y mantener a sus clientes que siempre la visitan, le da gracias a Dios y a los que brindan apoyo con préstamos para mejorar su calidad de vida. Les desea bendiciones a todos por el apoyo que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Duo Fortaleza Mía (My Strength) 

Karina, 33 years old, is in charge of the Fortaleza Mía duo. She has a baby that is one and half years old. 

She works in her store so she can be close to and take care of her young baby. She needs to expand her store with new products such as bags and wallets for women and girls. Her dream is to keep expanding so she can have a well-stocked store and increase her sales, and in this way help her husband to provide for the family. 

She is always looking for good deals because she buys things in cash in other stores. For this reason she needs a loan to buy merchandise and maintain her clients, who are always stopping by her store. She thanks God and all those who offer her support through loans so she can improve her quality of life. 

She sends blessing to all for the support they offer.

loans.use: To buy products for personal use to sell.

loans.name: Rusbel

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE FATIMA DE LAMAY .
El socio Rusbel tiene 33 años de edad  y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a brindar el servicio de transporte, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rusbel belongs to the "Virgen de Fatima de Lamay" community bank. He is 33 years old and single. He alternates his daily activities, making a living by providing transportation services. He has had his business for a good while, and it is going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into it everyday.

Rusbel would like to continue working so that he can continue supporting his family in this way. He is applying for the loan to perform maintenance on his car.

Rusbel is grateful and values the loan, and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia Gregoria se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de jugos, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de jugos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar manzanas,mandarinas, naranjas y uvas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria continues to work in her business of selling juice. She hopes that through this business, she will be able to progress.

Her dream is to expand her juice sales business. She is requesting a loan to purchase apples, tangerines, oranges, and grapes. She is happy to have the loan and is committed to fulfilling all of the payments.

loans.use: to purchase apples, tangerines, oranges, and grapes.

loans.name: Gnip

texts.en:
Gnip, 60 years old, sells prohok (traditional Khmer fish paste). She lives in Santuk district, Kampong Thom Province. She is a hard-working mother of six children, one of whom is married. She can make a net profit of approximately USD 7 a day.

At this time, Gnip is facing a financial issue in her family. She needs money to buy prohok that she can sell at the market. But she doesn't have the money. After learning that HKL provides Kiva loans with lower interest rates than its normal loan, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan. She would like to thank all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy prohok (traditional Khmer fish paste) to sell at the market.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de preparacion de tortas,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de preparacion de tortas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para preparar la torta como huevos,mantequilla y harina.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to dedicate herself to her business preparing cakes. Through this business, she wants to help her family get ahead. Her dream is to expand her cake preparation business. She is requesting the loan to buy supplies to prepare cakes, such as eggs, butter and flour.

The borrower is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare cakes, such as eggs, butter and flour.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El socio Adrian se sigue dedicando al negocio de bazar y tambien el socio vende artesania,,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de bazar.El socio solicita el credito para comprar adornos,regalos y peluches.

El socio se siente agradecido  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Adrian still runs a houseware business and he also sells handicrafts. He wants to use his business to support himself and his dream is to extend his houseware business. He is applying for the loan to buy ornaments, gifts and stuffed toys. He is grateful for the loan and promises to repay it in full.

loans.use: to buy ornaments, gifts and stuffed toys.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 33 years old, married, and blessed with two children.

He is a wholesale distributor of household goods, a profitable business that he has run for several years.

He requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase additional supplies of goods for wholesale.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be able to provide for his children's education.

loans.use: purchase additional supplies of household goods for wholesale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, age 61, is a farmer. He earns an additional income by offering motorcycle taxi services. He has operated these businesses for seven years, and earns a monthly income of about 25,000 Kenya shillings.

He and his wife have one child.

David has requested a loan in order to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. This will help him with this planting and with enhancing crop production. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his child.

His dream is to have a happy family and a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 34 years old. She is married and has three children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds. She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Adona

texts.en:
Adona is 37 years old and married with two children. She lives in Tukuran and owns and operates a rickshaw transport business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in business for over six years and earns PHP 4,000 every month.

She has been borrowing from GDMPC since 2013 and is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to repair her rickshaw and purchase spare parts. She dreams of helping her children complete their education.

loans.use: repair her rickshaw and purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married mother of three children. She is 48 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Letecia has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Jungeline

texts.en:
Jungeline is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jungeline is 33 years old. She has one child, who attends school.

Jungeline has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell in her general store.

Jungeline has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en: Edelyn works hard to support her family. Edelyn is married and has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Edelyn has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Edelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Manuel Concepcion

texts.es:
El socio  Manuel Concepcion se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, el socio es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar verduras,aceite, pollo y carne.

El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Manuel Concepcion continues to be dedicated to selling food. The member is an entrepreneurial and hard working person who, through this business, has got his family ahead. The member is requesting the loan to buy vegetables, oil, chicken and meat.

He feels thankful for the loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, oil, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Dora Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Dora Angelica se sigue dedicando al negocio de brosteria, la socipor medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de brosteria. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar pollo,aceite y papas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower, Dora Angelica, continues to dedicate herself to her business, a food stall selling roast chicken. Through this business, she wants to get ahead in life. She is requesting the loan to buy products to cook, such as chicken, oil and potatoes.

The borrower is happy about the loan and committed to making her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking such as chicken, oil and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de brosteria,el socioe es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de brosteria. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar papas y verduras.

 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to work in his roasted chicken restaurant business. He is a hardworking and enterprising person who, through his business, hopes to move forward. His dream is to expand his roasted chicken restaurant business.

He is requesting a loan to purchase potatoes and vegetables. He feels grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling all of the payments.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, canned goods, etc. Estrella has been in this business for 6 years. In the future Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Jean Caryl

texts.en: Jean Caryl is 27 years old and married with one child. Jean Caryl is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jean Caryl requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Jean Caryl has been in the pig fattening business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Jean Caryl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Norma is 45 years old and has six children who are currently in school. Norma has a dried fish business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish for her business. Norma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Nasren

texts.en: Nasren is the age of 40, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son just set up a mobile shop nearby his home. He offers various types of mobile phones and accessories, and provides a recharge facility. He has attained a list of customers in only a few days. Nowadays, he is facing problems due to the lack of available funds -- he wants to increase his inventory of mobile accessories, which are very famous and costly nowadays. He just started this business and does not have more cash in hand to purchase the desired inventories. This is the reason Nasren contacted Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and requested a loan for her son. With the help of the loan, he can easily purchase mobiles accessories and extra recharge from various networks. In this way, he can easily attract more customers and can generate more income to cherish his family. Nasren is very thankful to lenders who take an active part in loan raising.

loans.use: to buy mobiles accessories and extra recharge for her son's newly set up mobile shop.

loans.name: Haidilita

texts.en:
Haidilita is 33 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Haidilita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Haidilita has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed twelve times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Haidilita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Dora Aracely

texts.es: Dora muy ordenada y trabajadora, tiene cuarenta y dos años, es madre soltera tiene un hijo de siete años, él estudia en una escuela gratuita del sector ella empezó su negocio vendiendo una sudadera ya que no tenía capital de trabajo, poco a poco fue incrementando su mercadería hoy vende cosméticos y ropa por catálogo la ventaja de este negocio es que nunca descuida a su pequeño hijo ya que en las tardes salen juntos a vender. Dora necesita el dinero para comprar productos que están de promoción, así ganaría  más dinero que le serviría para la alimentación y educación a su hijo, también le gusta ahorrar  para que en un futuro pueda llegar a comprar una casa propia y bridarle estabilidad a su hijo.
texts.en:
Dora is very organized and hardworking. She is 42 years old, a single mother, and has one son who is seven years old. He studies in a free local school.

Dora began her business by selling a sweater, since she didn't have working capital. Little by little she increased her inventory, and today she sells cosmetics and clothing through a catalog. The advantage of this business is that she doesn't have to leave her small son alone; in the afternoons they go out together to sell.

Dora needs the loan to purchase products that are on sale. This will allow her to earn more money, which will go towards food and education for her son. She also likes to save, so that in the future she might be able to buy her own house and provide stability for her son.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise that is on sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dress-making material

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El señor es un joven de 29 años, trabaja como empleado en carga de Chofer en una institución publica, paralelamente se dedica a la agricultura por las labores de labranza agrícola que aprendió desde su niñez con sus padres es por esta razón produce cereales trigo y maíz, y también se dedica a la producción de papa. 
El señor es una persona trabajadora, construyo su casa en una zona rural, por mejorar y brindar mejores comodidades a su familia, mismos que tienen un hijo, recientemente gasto todos sus recursos en una construcción de infraestructura que se encuentra en media construccion, esta construyendo su casa en un lote de terreno que se compró en una zona más poblada. 
sin embargo el señor atraviesa una situación critica porque su conyugue adolece de una enfermedad de parálisis de su cuerpo y no puede mover parte de su cuerpo, acudió a un hospital cercano para su atención pero sugirieron trasladar a un hospital de la ciudad con condiciones de atención mejor, por tal razón acude buscando ayuda para llevar a un hospital que brinde la atención que su conyugue necesita y brindarle el tratamiento respectivo.
texts.en:
This young man is 29 years old and works as a driver for a public institution. He also works in agriculture, performing farm work that he learned in his childhood from his parents. For this reason, he grows grains like wheat and corn, as well as potato.

He is a hardworking person, and built his house in a rural area in order to provide a more comfortable life for his family, including a son. He recently used all of his resources in constructing a building that is currently half-built. He's building this house on a plot of land that he purchased in a more populated area.

However, he is going through a critical situation because his partner is suffering from paralysis and cannot move part of her body. They went to a nearby hospital so she could receive medical attention, but the hospital staff suggested that they transport her to a different hospital with better quality care. For this reason, he is seeking help to bring his partner to a hospital that can give her the care she needs and provide the necessary treatment.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatments and expenses for his partner who is paralyzed, in order to recuperate.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina works hard to support her family. Felina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Felina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Felina has been in this business for 30 years now. Felina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cyntia Mercedes

texts.es: Cyntia es una joven de 27 años que encontró en el comercio la oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos; ella comercializa productos por intermedio de catálogos a sus amigos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo, actividad en la que lleva cuatro años con óptimos resultados.  Ella es soltera y reside con su familia en un barrio de Madrid municipio de Cundinamarca. Como se está acercando una época del año en el que sus clientes se interesan mucho más por los productos que oferta,  Cyntia realizó una solicitud de su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para mantener un stock de colonias, splash, bisutería, cosméticos y otros productos de belleza, que le permitirán incrementar sus ventas y contar con excelentes ganancias que aportará para sus gastos de estudio. Su meta es graduarse como profesional y continuar en el comercio de productos y artículos.
texts.en: 27-year-old Cyntia found an opportunity to boost her income by running a business. She has been selling catalogue products to her friends, family and work colleagues for four years and has been very successful. She is single and lives with her family in a district in Madrid in the town of Cundinamarca. As it is getting close to a time of year when her customers are more interested in her products, Cyntia has applied, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, for her first Kiva loan. She will use it to maintain a stock of perfumes, body sprays, jewellery, cosmetics and other beauty products which will enable her to boost her sales and achieve an excellent income which she will use to cover her study costs. Her ambition is to pursue a professional career and continue selling products and articles.

loans.use: maintain a stock of perfumes, body sprays, jewellery, cosmetics and other beauty products

loans.name: Genevev

texts.en: Genevev works hard to support her family. Genevev is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Genevev requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Genevev has been in this business for 9 years now. Genevev would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 40 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Arlyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Arlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 61 años de edad, está casado, vive con su esposa, sus 3 nietos Aldair de 12, Gregory de 7 que estudian en una escuela estatal gratuita del sector donde viven y Salome de 2 años que aún no ha empezado su vida estudiantil, Jesús está comprometido con el cuidado de sus pequeños nietos ya que sus padres no lo pueden hacer. Él es muy responsable,todos los dias se levanta a las cinco de la mañana a sacar la leche de sus dos vacas luego espera al comprador,con el pasar del tiempo a trasformado este negocio es su sustento diario ya que con la edad que tiene es complicado trabajar en otro lugar. El necesita el crédito para comprar otra vaca de leche, aumentaría así sus ventas y podría seguir pagando los gastos de alimentación y educación de los niños.
texts.en:
Jesús is 61 years old. He is married. He lives with his wife and his three grandchildren. Aldair, who is 12, and Gregory, who is 7, go to a free state school in the sector where they live, and Salome, who is 2 years old, has not yet begun her student life. Jesús is dedicated to the care of his little grandchildren, since their parents cannot do it. He is very responsible. Every day he gets up at five o'clock in the morning to milk his two cows. Then he waits for the buyer. With the passing of time, he has transformed this business, which is their daily sustenance, since at his age it is complicated to work in another place.

He needs the loan to buy another milk cow. He would thus increase his sales and be able to continue paying the costs for the sustenance and education of the children.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Luis Alejandro

texts.es: Luis es un comerciante residente en una urbanización de Barranquilla que encontró en el comercio una oportunidad de salir adelante con su familia; él vive con su cónyuge y es padre de cinco hijos, todos mayores de edad y ante la falta de un empleo para lograr solventar los gastos de su hogar, decidió emprender una actividad en la que a sus 73 años de edad, pudiese realizar sin contratiempos, fue entonces que consideró que el expendio de carne de res, cerdo, queso y suero, se adaptarían muy bien a su estilo de vida.  Consiguió todas las herramientas necesarias; una báscula y cuchillos que estableció en un espacio en su hogar, así mismo en su refrigerador conserva los alimentos para que no pierdan la cadena de frio. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en carnes de vacuno y cerdo, queso y suero, para continuar con su labor sin inconvenientes, cuya finalidad es incrementar sus ingresos y así seguir ofreciendo bienestar a su familia. Su meta a largo plazo es realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda y así poder tener mejores condiciones de habitabilidad.
texts.en:
Luis is a business man who lives in a neighborhood of Barranquilla who found in business an opportunity to get ahead with his family. He lives with his spouse and is the father of five children, all of them adults.

Facing the lack of employment he decided to start a business that at 73 years old he could run without setbacks in order to pay the household expenses. He then considered that a shop selling beef, pork, cheese and whey would suit his life style. He obtained all the necessary equipment; a scale and knives that he set up in a part of his house and his refrigerator to give the food an unbroken cold chain.

He currently is applying for his first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which he will invest in beef and pork meat, cheese and whey to continue his work without inconvenience. His goal is to increase his income and there by providing well-being for his family. His long term goal is to undertake improvements to his house to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in beef and pork, cheese and whey.

loans.name: Martha Deysi

texts.es: Martha es una mujer de 21 años de edad que se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos para sacar adelante a su familia y de esta manera brindar lo mejor a su familia. Ella habita desde hace muchos años en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar, por lo que es muy reconocida por ser una mujer muy trabajadora. La vivienda en la que vive Martha tiene en la parte de atrás un talud de tierra y ella teme que en esta época de lluvia pueda causar algún accidente, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillo para construir muro de contención atrás de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Martha is a 21-year-old woman who works in domestic services to help her family move forward and provide the best for them. She has lived for many years in her family's house, and is well known for being a very hardworking woman.

The house that Martha lives in has a dirt slope behind it, and she fears that in this rainy season, it could cause an accident. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, iron, and brick to build a retaining wall behind her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, iron, and brick to construct a retaining wall behind her house.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras San Juan Group

texts.en: Trust bank Mujeres Trabajadoras, or "worker women," is a group of seven ladies who live in the beautiful city of San Lucas Tolimán, located on Lake Atitlán, one of the world's most gorgeous volcanic lakes. Most of these women, who are between 25 and 50 years of age, were unable to study and now have children of their own in primary and secondary school. The Mujeres Trabajadoras run a variety of businesses in the town of San Lucas Tolimán, selling ice cream, chicken and artisan wear, such as traditional blouses and skirts, “huipiles” and “cortes.” Lesbia, a 43-year-old member of the group, was not able to study at all. As a young girl, she had to help her family with chores and bringing in income. Lesbia´s business is in trade, buying and selling chickens, and she also sells ice cream to workers and owners of the “fincas,” large estate-farms and agricultural businesses, near her city. On the weekends, her work doesn't stop; Lesbia continues to sell from her home. With this loan from Kiva, this sharp businesswoman will buy more chicken and materials for her ice cream stand, such as sugar and cups for smoothies and icees. Lesbia has a family of her own, with her husband, and thanks to her efforts in improving her business, she has been able to provide her three children with the opportunity to go to school. Her two daughters have already finished their degrees in teaching, and her 15-year-old son is still studying. The women of this group are very happy to be a part of Friendship Bridge, with monthly workshops that give them the tools to save money in their businesses and use their investments wisely.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and materials for her ice cream stand, such as sugar and cups for smoothies and icees.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, age 42, keeps poultry to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for two years, and she has a monthly income of about 8,000 Kenya shillings.

She and her husband have four children.

This is Agnes's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use her loan funds to purchase chicken feed. She intends to use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to see her business continue to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Glorisa dries and sells fish to earn her living. This hard-working entrepreneur has successfully repaid her previous loan, and is requesting a new one in the amount of PhP 18,000 through NWTF.

She will use her loan funds to build her business by purchasing fish and bamboo with which to prepare dried fish to offer for sale.

NWTF is relisting Glorisa's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and bamboo with which to prepare dried fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Betzaida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Betzaida es una mujer de 54 años de edad que vive sola, no tiene hijos ni pareja, básicamente se dedica al hogar y para generar recursos se vale de sus conocimientos en cocina para la elaboración de alimentos.
Ella genera el dinero suficiente para mantenerse y cubrir sus necesidades básicas y no le sobra capital para tratar de invertir en su negocio y mejorar sus ventas, por ello quiere acudir a la ayuda de un crédito para la compra de insumos, ponchera, caldero y leña.
Este impulso económico ayudara a una mujer ya con edad a valerse por sí misma y generar sus propios recursos para no pasar necesidades y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Betzaida is a 54-year old woman who lives alone without any children or a partner. She basically takes care of her home, and to generate income, she takes advantage of her kitchen skills to prepare meals. 

She generates enough income to take care of herself and cover her basic needs, but there is no additional capital for her to invest into her business and increase her sales. She therefore wants to turn to the help of a loan for the purchase of consumable goods, a bowl to make punch, a cooking pot, and firewood. 

This economic boost will help an older woman to be self-sufficient and generate her own means so as to not be in need and continue forward.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods, a punch bowl, a cooking pot, and firewood.

loans.name: Ester Lina

texts.es: Ester es una confeccionista residente en un barrio del municipio de Soledad ubicado en el Departamento del Atlántico, desde muy joven sintió una gran inclinación por esta profesión y aprendió empíricamente a elaborar sus primeras creaciones, en el año 1995 aperturó su taller de confecciones en su vivienda y hoy en día cuenta con treinta años de funcionamiento, ofreciendo todo tipo de prenda de vestir para damas y caballeros: camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes de colegios, entre otros y realiza todas las operaciones de la confección. Ester desearía dar un mejor acabado a sus prendas por lo que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de una máquina recubridora que se utiliza para estas hacer puntos, costuras pespuntes y centradas.  De modo que sus prendas estarán más a la vanguardia. Su meta a futuro es crear su propia marca.
texts.en:
Ester is a clothing maker who lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad, located in the Atlántico department. Ever since she was young, she has felt a great inclination for this profession, and she learned through experience to make her first pieces of clothing. In 1995, she opened her clothing workshop in her home, and today she has been in the field for 30 years.

She offers all types of clothing for women and men, including shirts, pants, dresses, school uniforms, and other products, and she makes them all herself. Ester hopes to add an even better finishing touch to her clothing, and thus is requesting a Kiva loan, which will be her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of a specialty sewing machine used to make stitches, backstitches, and centered designs. With these new techniques, her clothing will be more modern. Her goal for the future is to create her own brand.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a specialty sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish her daughter's dental office

loans.name: Luis Alirio

texts.en:
Luis is 57 years old and lives in the municipality of La Dorada. He has four children, two boys and two girls, whom he loves very much and for whom he works really hard. For ten years he’s been running his own business, a butcher shop that he inherited from his family.

He wants to invest in his business in order to increase his clients, and also his profits, so he can keep providing for his family. He has a big commitment to his family, so he’s asking for a loan so he can repair his refrigerator, make some improvements to the location, and buy inputs.

Luis dreams of improving the conditions of his house that are not at their best, and he wants his family to be safe and comfortable. You can help Luis to accomplish all his dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: to repair his refrigerator, make some improvements to the location, and buy inputs.

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.en: Lurdes has been doing business since 2011 with her own working capital of 80 USD. Lurdes is requesting a loan of 800 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her own working capital and buy additional supplies to keep in her store such as coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, water, eggs, pens, slippers, as well as other items like soft drinks and hard drinks.Lurdes wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve the management of her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, water, eggs, pens, slippers, soft drinks, and hard drinks.

loans.name: La Misión Group

texts.es:
Veracruz es uno de los estados principales en materia de agricultura; en su territorio se produce la caña de azúcar, limón, maíz, sorgo, fríjol, arroz, chile verde, mango, papaya, plátano, sólo por nombrar algunos. La fertilidad de la tierra es pues única dentro del territorio nacional.
   En uno de sus municipios se formó un grupo el cual lleva por nombre La Misión que expresa el objetivo que sus integrantes tienen para brindar lo mejor a sus familias. Ellos son: Magdalena, Guillermina, Martha y Blanca quienes se dedican a vender comida; María de Lourdes y Marisol, cosméticos; Juliana, ropa; Juana, frutas y legumbres; Elizandra, zapatos, lencería y cosméticos; Asunción, abarrotes y costuras; Santa, bisutería y bolsas y Flor, zapatos y cosméticos. 
   Doña María Lourdes es una mujer muy emprendedora, sus amistades y familiares le llaman Lulú de cariño. Con el único objetivo de brindar mayores oportunidades a sus 3 hijos, decidió iniciar con la venta de cosméticos por catálogo de una prestigiada marca. Gracias a su esfuerzo arduo pasó de ser una vendedora minoritaria a ser líder de un grupo con 23 vendedoras bajo su cargo. No obstante, aprovecha cualquier situación para ofrecer su producto pues conoce que los mejores beneficios no llegan solos sino que se tienen que buscar. Ella comenta contenta, “continuare invitando a más mujeres emprendedoras que deseen ser su propia fuente de ingresos”.
   El éxito de su actividad se puede notar sobre todo en que anteriormente recorría las calles a pie para poder ofrecer su mercancía y ahora lo hace a bordo de un automóvil el cual compro con parte de las ganancias y el apoyo de VF México. Con el préstamo anterior compró labiales, delineadores, rímel, sombras, talcos, desodorantes y lociones corporales, mientras que el préstamo actual lo invertirá en la compra de cremas, lociones, labiales, delineadores y sombras  que le han solicitado sus clientes.
   Todos los integrantes del grupo agradecen a VF México y KIVA por los préstamos que les han permitido enriquecer sus actividades notablemente.
*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la casa de Magdalena, doña Lulú viste blusa negra con estampado blanco y un pantalón azul.
texts.en: Veracruz is one of the main states for agriculture and it produces sugar-cane, lemons, corn, sorghum, beans, rice, green chillies, mangoes, papayas, bananas, among many other things. It is the most fertile area in the country. In one of the towns in the state, a number of people got together to form a group which was given the name La Misión to reflect the members' aim of doing their best for their families. The members of the group are: Magdalena, Guillermina, Martha and Blanca who sell food; María de Lourdes and Marisol, cosmetics; Juliana, clothing; Juana, fruit and vegetables; Elizandra, shoes, lingerie and cosmetics; Asunción, groceries and sewing; Santa, jewellery and bags and Flor, shoes and cosmetics. María Lourdes is a very enterprising woman who has been given the pet name Lulú by her friends and family. With the sole objective of providing better opportunities for her 3 children, she decided to start selling cosmetics through the catalogue of a prestigious brand. Thanks to her hard work, she progressed from a small trader to the leader of a group in which she is responsible for 23 saleswomen. However, she takes advantage of any opportunity to sell her product as she knows that the highest profits don't come happen automatically but have to be looked for. She comments, happily, "I'll continue inviting more female entrepreneurs who want to earn their own incomes". The most obvious sign of her business's success is that, previously, she walked around in the streets to sell her goods whereas she now does it from a car which she bought with some of her earnings and support from VF México. She used her previous loan to buy lipsticks, eyeliners, mascara, talcum powder, deodorants and body lotions and she will use this loan to buy creams, lotions, lipsticks, eyeliners and eye shadows which her customers have asked for. All the members of the group are grateful to VF México and KIVA for the loans which have enabled them to develop their businesses considerably. *The photo was taken outside Magdalena's house. Lulú is the lady wearing a black blouse with a white pattern and blue trousers.

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, lipsticks, eyeliners, eye shadows

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, who is in her early 40's, is married with two kids who are still at school. She has been running two projects, stationary services and selling rice, for eight years now. She works from 08am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Agnes's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stationary stock, started selling rice and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for supporting her.

She used the profit to pay school fees, make loan repayments, took care of her family and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase the stationary stock and the rice stock.

She dreams of owning a big business.

Agnes will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan scheduled time. *To clarify from the previous loan description: She had a stationary business and then started selling rice. That means in that seven years, she decided to start selling rice as well

loans.use: to increase on the stationary stock and on the rice stock as well.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, age 39, runs a general store to earn her living. This hard-working entrepreneur has been engaged in her business for three years. She and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her general store.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Onywak Can Group

texts.en:
Mildren is a single mother with three school-going kids. She is a resident of Kampswahili Cell in Lira district. She lost her husband during the Northern Uganda Insurgence and has since operated a restaurant along a bus stage in Lira municipality, from which she derives school fees for her children and self sustenance.

She has applied for a loan through the group to help her buy restuarant furniture to accommodate her clients, who have increased in number due to the prevailing peace.

She is grateful to Ugafode Microfinance Ltd and Kiva funders for the support given.

loans.use: to buy restaurant furniture.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba catches and sells fish to earn her living. She has been engaged in her fishing business for eight years now. She and her husband work hard to support their family.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 30,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fish nets, as well as materials for repairing her fishing boat.

Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, as well as materials for repairing her fishing boat

loans.name: Altaf

texts.en: Altaf is a 48-year-old married mother of seven children. Due to the low financial conditions of her husband, two years ago, she started planting Corchorus and Okra, and preparing and selling "Mouneh" to help her husband in covering the increasing expenses of their family. She is now well known among her region and has her loyal customers. Today, Altaf is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to develop her business by buying necessary inputs to increase her production and to satisfy her customers' requests in the upcoming winter season. Altaf hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and provide her family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary inputs to increase her production

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu, who is in her early 30s, is married with three kids who are still in school. She has been running two projects: a food vendor and a retail shop for six years now. She works from 6:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
  
This will be Saumu’s 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a deep freezer for selling soft drinks, to increase her mamalishe stock, and to restock the out-of-stock items in the food shop. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit for school fees, loan repayment, a plot of land, and household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase her mamalishe stock and to buy the fast-selling items in her shop inventory. She dreams of expanding her business and  to build her own house.

Saumu will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to increase her mamalishe stock and to buy the fast-selling items in her shop inventory.

loans.name: Katei

texts.en:
Katei is 42 years old. He is married and has eight children. His business is farming. He has been in the business for 6 years. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase friendly spray chemicals to prevent fruit distortion among his mango trees.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to improve the standard of living of his family. His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and successful business.

loans.use: to purchase friendly spray chemicals to prevent fruit distortion among his mango trees.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 43 years old. He is married and has four children. His business is growing watermelons. He has been in the business for 20 years. He earns a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase pipes for drip irrigation and spraying chemicals on his watermelons.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams are to become a large producer of watermelons and to own a pick-up truck to transport them to the market conveniently.

loans.use: to purchase pipes for drip irrigation and spraying chemicals on his watermelons.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gina is 33 years old and has one child who is currently in school. Gina has a dried fish business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish and ingredients for her business. Gina has been in this business for 5 years. Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Rossini Irish

texts.en:
Rossini Irish is 27 years old and married with one child who is in school.

Rossini Irish has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rossini Irish has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future, Rossini Irish would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 58 years old and has six children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Dionesia is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Dionesia has been in fattening pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Keiner David

texts.es:
Keiner es un joven empresario de 21 años de edad, que con esfuerzo y ahorros consolido un negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, con el objetivo de apoyar económicamente a su familia y pagar sus estudios de educación superior.
Keiner no tiene hijos ni pareja, está muy concentrado en su futuro, por ello hoy solicita tu ayuda, necesita crecer y vender mayor cantidad de productos, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para aumentar su mercancía, por ello solicita un crético que invertirá en la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar.
Vamos Anímate!, apoya a las jóvenes promesas que quieren cambiar la realidad de su familia trabajando con humildad y honestidad.
texts.en:
Keiner is a young 21 year old entrepreneur who set up a business selling household goods with his hard work and savings, with the objective of financially assisting his family and paying for his continuing education. 

Keiner is childless and not in a relationship, he's very focused on his future and that's why he's asking for your help. He needs to expand and sell more products but he doesn't have the capital necessary to increase his merchandise, so he's applying for a loan that he'll invest in purchasing an assortment of household staples.

C'mon, go for it! Help out young people with potential that want to change their family's life with hard, honest work.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of products that are household staples, to have extra income for school.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 31-year-old, business-oriented youth and a resident of Wandegeya-Katale, Kampala.

He is a third time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance and a responsible young man whose reputation and repayment records are good.

He owns a liquor shop with various forms of wines and spirits and a well established bar, both located in Wandegeya town, Kampala, where he earns his living in order to take care of his young sister and for his own needs. He has been operating these two businesses for 4 years, and its through such hard work that he has managed to pay school fees for his young sister and advance his life.

He has applied for a 3,000,000 UGX loan facility at Ugafode Microfinance in order to expand his business, and he is confident that he will perfectly meet his obligations.

loans.use: to buy wines and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a repeat client of UGAFODE Microfinance and is 23 years old. He is a very active and hardworking person involved in agriculture, especially cattle that is reared on zero-grazing and is where he gets milk for sale.

He has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Two million shillings) to buy more cows for zero grazing.

He works for 10 hours daily, and he also works as a sales representative in a water bottling company where he earns additional income. He started his business in 2009.

He is still single, but he is taking care of his young siblings. He carries out his agriculture in the rural area of Katungu, Nyakabirizi, Bushenyi district.

He began the business to earn more income in addition to his salary. When he gets the loan, he will use it to buy more cows to increase milk production. His clients are all kinds of people but majorly dairies.

Mr. Daniel hopes to increase and boost his agricultural business and to construct a bigger and better house for ]his family. He is faced with limited capital to buy more cows and feeds for his cows to boost his milk production.

Daniel is so grateful for the financial boost and support.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Florephis

texts.en: Florephis is 40 years old and married. Florephis works very hard to provide for them. Florephis runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like eggs, noodles, shampoo, soft-drinks, candies, snack foods, etc. to sell. Florephis has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soft-drinks, candies, snack foods, etc. Florephis would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like eggs, noodles, shampoo, soft drinks, candies, snack foods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elcita

texts.en: Elcita works hard to support her family. Elcita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets. Elcita has been in this business for 10 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. In the future, Elcita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 55 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell. Erlinda has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy more materials for her fishing/fish vending business. Gloria has been in this business for 10 years. Gloria also earns income from raising pigs. Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her fish business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 54 years old and has five children. Angelita is married and has one child who is still in school. Angelita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Angelita has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Angelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is the age of 42. Her husband owns a garments shop. This shop is the only source of income for her family. For this reason, she devotes all her efforts and time to the garment shop. Her husband's shop is situated under the garments market and there is a lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a high price. This competition becomes the cause for low sales and more efforts as well. Her husband has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delightful colors of garments for the shop so that he can maintain the rate of sales. Now the major problem is that the winter season is about to start and he does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy garments related to the winter season. If he cannot replace the summer season's stuff with winter season's garments, it might highly affect his sales. He does not want to reduce his sales and his monthly income. Therefore, Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can be empowered to buy winter season's garments. Zahida hopes that her husband will purchase inventories according to his desire at the right time so he can cope with the market competition and could grow his income as well. She thanks Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: to buy winter season's garments for her husband so he can replace summer season's garments with winter season's stuff.

loans.name: Marisa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marisa es una orgullosa campesina, trabajadora, humilde, una persona sonriente que ama al campo, ama su hogar y ama a su familia, es madre de 4 hijos, los cuales levantó y crío con la ayuda de su negocio de cultivo, el cual inicio por necesidad económica y espera a que sus hijos continúen y hagan de esta profesión una tradición familiar.
Su intención es siempre mejorar, tener un cultivo estable, velar por el bien de los suyos y aprovechar cada oportunidad de crecimiento que se le presente.
Marisa busca un apoyo económico el cual desea invertir en el pago de mano de obra para la recolección de sus cultivos y la compra de insumos agrícolas (matamalesa), el cual es un veneno.
texts.en:
Marisa is a proud, hardworking, humble farmer who's always smiling and loves the field. She loves her home and her family, and is a mother of 4 children that she raised and nurtured with the help of the crop farming that she began due to financial need. Her hope is that her children keep it going and make this profession a family tradition.

Her objective is to always make things better, to have stable crops, take care of her loved ones and take advantage of every opportunity for growth that comes her way. Marisa is looking for financial support that she wants to invest in hiring laborers to harvest her crops and purchase agricultural supplies (weed-killer), namely an herbicide.

loans.use: To invest in hiring laborers for harvesting her crops and purchasing agricultural supplies (weed-killer), namely an herbicide.

loans.name: Prossie

texts.en:
Prossie is a resident of Kitende, along Entebbe highway. She owns a home utensils shop in a market in Kampala city. She is a married woman with two children and a consistent saver with UGAFODE Micro-finance.

Her shop is the source of livelihood and is the major business being done to earn money to take care of her household and educate the children.

Prossie intends to add more stock of kitchen utencils to sell in her shop, hence the application for UGX 5,000,000. She believes that the financial boost will help her to buy in bulk and at a cheap price, and this will increase her sales and profit. He dream is to expand the business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of home products to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 28-year-old married mother of one child who has been working as a store manager in a clothing store since 1995 to support her husband in improving their family's living. Fatima is a hard-working woman that is very supportive and reliable. She can manage to distribute her monthly income combined with her husband's to cover her family's daily needs. Unfortunately, due to unexpected issues they need external support. For this reason, Fatima is requesting an Islamic loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, which is provided to customers upon request, in order to buy a kitchen wash basin for her kitchen since she is doing necessary maintenance before the coming winter season.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen wash basin for her kitchen since she is doing necessary maintenance before the coming winter season

loans.name: Las Colibrí Group

texts.es:
La comunidad conocida como “la novia del sol” se encuentra rodeada por los ríos Estanzuela, Moreno, Hondo y el Amapa el cual divide al estado de Veracruz del de Oaxaca. Todos los anteriores confluyen con el río Papaloapan cuya derivación da pie al Yale, Julieta y el Nanche en donde, en temporadas de sequía y de Semana Santa, se da cita la gente de la ciudad para disfrutar de sus refrescantes aguas. De dicha región son originarias nueve mujeres trabajadoras y comprometidas con su familia que decidieron formar el grupo Las Colibrí para enriquecer sus actividades. Ellas son: Susana quien vende cosméticos; Vianey y María, ropa; Nadia, recipientes; María del Rocío, servicios de estética e internet; Patricia, ropa y cosméticos; Carol, bisutería; Samantha, estética y Perla, bisutería y bolsos.
   Doña Vianey  ha formado una familia muy unida junto con su esposo Abraham y sus dos hijas de las cuales una recientemente tuvo una hija, por lo que “la güera”, como conocen a  Vianey, se encuentra muy contenta de ser abuela.  Durante tres años se dedicó a recorrer las calles de su comunidad para ofrecer ropa  de distintos modelos y tamaños pues su principal objetivo era ganar clientes. Dicha actividad obedecía a la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia y brindar lo mejor de lo posible a sus hijas.
    Las ganancias obtenidas durante esos tres años le permitieron establecer su negocio dentro de un local a un costado de su hogar lo que le ha permitido dedicar más tiempo a su familia. “Soy feliz pues mi familia es feliz y eso me motiva para continuar con mi actividad”  comenta satisfecha ya que además de vender ropa elabora pasteles, gelatinas, flan, y todo tipo de postres; otra de sus metas es abrir una pastelería.
   En esta ocasión con el préstamo comprará blusas, faldas, vestidos y pantalones para continuar con su crecimiento. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de doña Nadia, doña Vianey viste blusa de tirantes color café con blanco y short azul.
texts.en:
The community known as "the Sun's Girlfriend" is surrounded by the Estanzuela, Moreno, Hondo and el Amapa rivers which divide the state of Veracruz from Oaxaca. They all converge in the Papaloapan river whose diversion gives rise to the Yale, Julieta y el Nanche passes. During the dry season and Easter week people from the cities meet to enjoy these refreshing waters.

These nine hard-working women who are committed to their families are native to this area. They decided to form the "Las Colibrí' group to enrichen their businesses. They are: Susana who sells cosmetics; Vianey and María, clothing; Nadia, containers; María del Rocío, a beauty salon and internet; Patricia, clothing and cosmetics; Carol, jewellery; Samantha, a beauty salon y Perla, jewellery and bags.

Vianey has formed a very close family together with her husband Abraham and her two daughters, one of whom recently had a child. So “la güera” (light haired woman) as Vianey is known, finds herself very happy to be a grandmother. For three years she has been traveling the streets of her community offering clothing of different styles and sizes as her main objective is to gain clients. This business stems from the need to help her husband with the household expenses and provide the best possible for her daughters.

The profits from these three years allowed her to establish her business in a shop beside her house which allows her to dedicate more time to her family. "I am happy so my family is happy. And this motivates me to continue with my business", She commented with satisfaction. Besides selling clothing she makes cakes, jelly, flan and all kinds of dessert. One of her goals is to open a pastry shop.

At this time she will buy blouses, skirts, dresses and pants with the loan to continue with her growth.

The photograph was taken on Nadia's patio. Vianey is wearing a brown and white blouse and blue shorts.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses and pants for women.

loans.name: Miujiza Group

texts.fr: Yvonne est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Miujiza», cliente de l’IMF Hekima,  mariée, âgée de 36 ans, mère de 7 enfants dont 3 étudient et 4 n’étudient pas. Elle est vendeuse des friperies au marché de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en un ballon de friperies. Elle commença son business avec le  capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Yvonne is a trader and a member of the Miujiza credit group, which works with IMF Hekima. She is a 36-year-old married mother to seven children, three of whom are currently receiving an education. She has been earning a living through selling second-hand clothing at market for the past two years.

Yvonne wants to purchase more second-hand clothing. She started her business which capital received from her husband. She would like to purchase a plot of land and see her children well-educated and well-fed. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support they give to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 48 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is farming. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase seeds, a water tank, and pipes.  She will use the profits from the expanded business to open a grocery shop. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, a water tank, and pipes

loans.name: Heriniaina

texts.fr: Heriniaina a 35 ans. Il est marié et le couple a trois  petits enfants dont l'ainé seulement qui a 5 ans est actuellement scolarisés. Les seconds jumeaux n'atteignent pas encore l'âge requise pour aller à l'école. Sa femme reste à la maison pour s'occuper de leur ménage et ainsi de leurs enfants. C'est lui seul qui assure l'activité génératrice de revenu de la famille. Il exerce une vente ambulante des marchandises générales comme nous pouvons voir sur sa photo. Ses parents exerçaient le même type d'activité et il avait l'habitude de les accompagner et les aider donc il n'a pas eu de difficulté à diriger son propre commerce. C'est un père de famille débrouillard et responsable, il commençait à gérer seul l'activité depuis 2009.
texts.en:
Heriniaina, age 35, is married with 3 small children. The eldest is 5 years old and goes to school, but the twins are still too young. His wife is a homemaker who stays home to take care of their household and their children.

Heriniaina practices the family's income-generating activity alone. He is an itinerant vendor of various goods as shown in the photo. Since his parents were engaged in a similar activity and he used to tag along to help them, he had no difficulty running his own business. He has been doing this by himself since 2009. He is a resourceful and reliable family man.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, hair care products, soap, baby diapers, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 22years old. He is single and his business is motorcycle transport business. He has been in this business for 4 years. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and he will use the loan to buy a motorcycle and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income.. He will use the generated profits to save and buy another motorcycle. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his transport business and have a better business and a good family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Demirhan

texts.en:
Demirhan has one cow at the moment that is getting old, thus it hasn't been producing milk lately. This is why Demirhan needs to invest on another young dairy cow

" We need milk and dairy not only for our family but to sell as well. In the land we own, we plant fodder for the animals, so, why not having another dairy cow and feeding it with the fodder we produce," said Demirhan during the loan officer's visitation at her residence.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow to the existing one

loans.name: Nefie

texts.en:
Nefie is 39 years old and has five children. Nefie is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Nefie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Nefie requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nefie has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nefie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr:
Florence a 41 ans, elle est veuve depuis 2013. Depuis cette date, c’est elle  seule qui s’occupe  et éleve ses 4 enfants.  Deux de ses enfants sont encore scolarisés ,  l’un est à la recherche d’un emploi, l’autre l'aide dans l'exercice de son activité. C’est une femme courageuse et battante malgré le décès de son  mari.
L’activité est la confection et vente de rideaux  depuis 2004. Mais avant cette date elle vendait déjà des rideaux au marché. Florence dispose deux points de vente. Le premier point de vente est géré par son fils,  chaque semaine, du Lundi au Samedi.
Son objectif est d’augmenter l’épargne , et de pouvoir continuer à financer les études de ses enfants
texts.en:
Florence is 41 years old. She has been a widow since 2013. Since then, she is the only one looking out for and raising her four children. Two of her children are still attending school. One is looking for a job, and the other helps Florence in her business.

This woman is courageous and a fighter, despite the death of her husband. Since 2004, her business has been making and selling curtains. Before that date, she already sold curtains at the market.

Florence has two sales points. The first one is run by her son, every week, Monday through Saturday. Her goal is to grow her savings and be able to continue to finance the studies of her children.

loans.use: to buy rolls of curtain fabric.

loans.name: Eatidal

texts.en:
Eatidal is a 27-year-old married woman who started five years ago working in her grocery shop to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has a good reputation in her area.

Eatidal is working on developing her business, thus today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate her business and transporting goods.
Eatidal hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car which will facilitate her business and transporting goods

loans.name: Marina Haydee

texts.es: Marina es una mujer que a sus 45 años de edad demuestra su tenacidad, ya que hace 3 años se dedica  a la elaboración de piñatas en su casa de habitación, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia y brindar lo mejor que está en sus manos. Marina logro hace 9 años hacerse de su propia vivienda en la que habita junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 15 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando. Marina desea continuar mejorando su vivienda ya que con un crédito que solicito anteriormente mejoro el techo y parte de las paredes, pero ella junto a su compañero de vida han adquirido un terreno propio al cual desean trasladar su vivienda de lámina y mejorar las paredes que están deterioradas a la vez, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para mejorar las otras paredes y trasladar su vivienda a terreno propio.
texts.en:
Marina is a 45-year-old woman who has proved her determination. For the last 3 years she has been making piñatas in the house where she lives, which allows her to help support her family and offer the best work she can do with her hands. 

Nine years ago, Marina succeeded in building her own house where she lives with her life partner and her 15 year-old son, who is going to school. Marina would like to continue improving her house, since she already redid her roof and some of the walls with a previous loan. 

Also, with her life partner, they have acquired their own piece of land and would like to move the house and at the same time improve parts of the walls that have deteriorated. She is requesting a FUSAI loan to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails and wires to improve the remaining walls and move her house to her own land.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails and wires to improve the remaining walls and move her house to her own land.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE HUAYLLABAMBA .
La socia Carmen Rosa tiene 06 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de cereales, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de trigo, quinua entre otros.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
La socia al momento de tomarle la foto se agacho ya que la socia es tímida.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE HUAYLLABAMBA".

Member Carmen Rosa is married and has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities, and works selling grains. She has been doing this work for a long while, and it is going well for her because of her daily efforts. She would like to continue working and in this way continue to help support her family. 

The member is requesting this loan to buy wheat and quinoa, among others.

She appreciates the loan and offers her thanks, also, she commits to making her monthly payments. 

She lowered her head as the photo was taken because she is shy.

loans.use: to buy wheat and quinoa, among others.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Juanita is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is 43 years old and widowed with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Agripina is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Agripina has been raising livestock for 3 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Josephine is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional bundle of fishing nets for her fishing business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundle of fishing nest.

loans.name: Maryury Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Maryuri es una mujer que dijo basta, que se cansó, una mujer decidida a cambiar su realidad, empeñada a sacar a su familia adelante, de no tener que seguir viviendo de la misma manera, por ello quiere iniciar un negocio, una venta de productos de la canasta familiar, pero para ello necesita de tu apoyo, pues necesita completar el dinero con el que comprara estanterías, una nevera y surtido de productos.
Su mayor anhelo es salir de la pobreza y ofrecer a sus dos hijos una vida digna.
texts.en:
This is Maryuri, a woman who said "Enough", who got fed up, a woman set on changing her life and working to get her family ahead to avoid living the same kind of life. That's why she wants to start a business, selling household staples, but for that she needs your help. She needs to finish coming up with the money to buy shelving, a refrigerator, and an assortment of products.

Her biggest dream is to break free of poverty and provide a decent life for her two children.

loans.use: to have enough money to buy shelving, a refrigerator and an assortment of products

loans.name: Johan Camilo

texts.es:
Johan es un hombre de 25 años de edad que inicio un negocio con la ilusión de algún día tener el capital suficiente para comprar una vivienda propia, un enorme reto que está dispuesto a cumplir y en el cual debe sortear múltiples adversidades para alcanzar sus objetivos. Una de ellas es la falta de recursos, Johan necesita un capital para inyectarle a su empresa, buscando que esta crezca, por ello quiere acudir a una ayuda financiera para la compra de cerdos, alimento de engorde y materiales para la construcción de porquerizas. 
Este préstamo ayuda a tener una mayor capacidad y más cerdos que seguro serán vendidos puesto que se aproxima la época navideña donde se presentan mayor ventas de cerdos que en cualquier otro mes.
texts.en:
Johan is a 25 year old man who started a business with the dream of one day having enough capital to buy his own home, a huge challenge that he's willing to undertake and one in which he'll have to overcome multiple obstacles to achieve his goals. One of them is the lack of resources, Johan needs a capital injection for his business, in pursuit of growth. That's why he wants to obtain financial help to purchase pigs, fattening feed and materials to build pigpens.
