This loan helps to increase capacity and the number of pigs, which will surely sell due to the approaching Christmas season when pig sales are higher than any other month.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, fattening feed and materials to build pigpens.

loans.name: Kotognonkotala  ) Group

texts.fr: Yaya  est emboucheur ovins, âgé de 42 ans il  habite au Mali, marié et père  de huit  enfants âgé de 2 à 16 ans dont trois scolarisés. Il est celui qui a la main sur le bélier sur photo, sa femme est ménagère. IL exerce ce métier il y a 7 ans de cela, il s’approvisionne et vend ses animaux aux  marchés de sa localité. IL  sollicite  au près du RMCR un prêt   accroitre ses activités ovines, le bénéfice servira à  subvenir aux charges familiale soins sanitaire, habillement et autres. Après les ventes il peut réaliser un bénéfice de 40000FCFA. IL rêve d’être un grand emboucher dans la zone et être utile pour la communauté.
texts.en:
Yaya earns a living through raising sheep. He lives in Mali. He is a 42-year-old married father to eight children aged between two and 16 years old. Three of them are currently receiving an education. Yaya is the man in the photo who is holding the ram. His partner is a housewife.

Yaya has been carrying out this activity for seven years. He purchases and sells his animals at local markets. He is requesting this loan from RMCR so he can grow his sheep business. The profits will be used to meet his family's needs, such as a healthcare fees and clothing. After selling his animals, he can earn a profit of around 400,000 FCFA. His dream is to become a successful local rearer and to be of use to his community.

IL exerce ce métier il y a 7 ans de cela, il s’approvisionne et vend ses animaux aux marchés de sa localité. IL sollicite au près du RMCR un prêt accroitre ses activités ovines, le bénéfice servira à subvenir aux charges familiale soins sanitaire, habillement et autres. Après les ventes il peut réaliser un bénéfice de 40000FCFA. IL rêve d’être un grand emboucher dans la zone et être utile pour la communauté.

loans.use: to purchase sheep which will later be resold.

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre serio, comprometido, muy centrado en sus objetivos, es padre de un hija de 3 años de edad, la cual es su adoración y representa todo para él, por ello se empeña tanto en su profesión de cría de ganado pues desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Con su profesión de ganado busca generar mayor número de recursos, tanto para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, como para dinamizar y ampliar su cultivo.
Javier necesita de un apoyo económico para la compra de 3 terneras e insumos agrícolas para su cultivo, solo busca ser un mejor empresario, ampliar su cultivo, tener sostenibilidad del negocio, incrementar su utilidad y ser mejor padre para su hija.
texts.en:
Javier is a serious, committed man who's very focused on his goals. He's the father of a 3 year old daughter who he adores and she's everything to him. That's why he works so hard at his profession raising cattle, because he wants to improve his family's standard of living.

Through his profession of raising cattle he's seeking to generate more revenue, both to provide a better standard of living as well as to revitalize and expand his crops. Javier needs financial support to purchase 3 calves and agricultural supplies, he just wants to become a better businessman, expand his crop, have a sustainable business, increase his revenue and be a better father to his daughter.

loans.use: To purchase 3 calves and agricultural supplies for his crop.

loans.name: Akou Adonam

texts.fr: Akou est une femme mariée âgée de 22 ans qui vit à Agoè. Ayant quatre enfants à charge, Akou  s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant de la farine de manioc appelé « Gari ». Pour s’approvisionner, Akou se rend trois fois par mois au marché. Akou sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de farines de manioc en vue de financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Akou va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akou is a married woman aged 22 who lives in Agoè. Since she is raising four children, Akou tries hard to earn a living by reselling manioc flour known as « Gari ». In order to stock up, Akou goes to the market three times per month.

Akou is asking for this loan to order some sacks of manioc flour; she needs to finance her provision. With the profit margin that will result from this, Akou is going to help her husband with daily expenses for the family and with the education costs of her children.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of manioc flour.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 24 years old. He is married to Gladys and they have no children yet. He has had a Mpesa business for 4 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000. 

He has borrowed KES. 60,000 as his second loan, after successfully paying his previous loan. And he will be using the loan to purchase business float and mobile phones. 

Henceforth he hopes this will help him to buy food for his family, cater for medical care,  save savings in his personal account, expanding his current business and repay his loan too. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established business and enjoy a better life with his wife and kids.

loans.use: to purchase business float for his Mpesa store and also mobile phones. .

loans.name: Gedeon

texts.en: Gedeon is a retailer and at the same time growing and trading in cocoa that add him more income. He is 49 years and married, he lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. He started the retail shop out of the savings made from cocoa sales although he faces challenges of inadequate capital that hinder progress of his business. However, he has hopes of expanding cocoa business and also building a permanent house by working extra harder with the support of his family and children.Gedeon is requesting for a loan to add capital in his retail business such as rice, maize flour,cooking oil and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy more general merchandise for resale in his store

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una mujer de 50 años de edad, una persona carismática y humilde que trabaja diariamente en sus cultivos junto con su esposo, una actividad que disfruta mucho realizar, ya que desde pequeña estuvo rodeada del campo y ha aprendido a amar y valorar estos cultivos que han significado el sustento de su familia.
Ella trabaja con un objetivo, el cual es, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y estar cerca de su esposo.
Para seguir trabajando y hacer crecer su cultivo la señora Luz Marina quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de insumos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a 50 year old woman who has a charismatic personality, is humble and works every day on her crops alongside her husband. It's an activity she really enjoys doing, since she's been on the field since she was a little girl and has learned to love and appreciate these crops that have sustained her family.

She works with a purpose, which is to improve her home's living conditions and be close to her husband. In order to continue working and make her crop grow, Luz Marina wants to apply for financial help to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
SAKINA is the age of 39, mother of four children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She is very hard work, gracious and honest ; her husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods two times in a day. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earning good profit from restaurant business. She helps her husband by cooking various foods at home and her husband sale it out over his restaurant. He offers tea to his customers also, now he wants to establish his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture, utensils, cauldron etc. Due to household expenses his savings are not enough to buy desired things.
Therefore, SAKINA requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils, cauldron etc. SAKINA thanks to kiva and appreciates for the warmth support to her.

loans.use: To buy furniture, utensils, cauldron, spices etc for restaurant.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreenis 40-years old lady; she is living with her spouse, two daughters and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband is a turner by profession and manufactures spare parts for vehicles. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture spare parts of various vehicles. His lathe machine has become out of order and some tools have become wearing out due to continuously working, which are need to be replaced. He has spent his all savings to buy cast iron for manufacturing spare parts and does not have money to fix the lathe machine.

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan for her husband so that he could fix the deficiencies of lathe machine. She is relaxed now because she hopes that her husband could easily operate his lathe machine again. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cast iron for her husband's lathe machine shop so he can manufacture further spare parts.

loans.name: Chicken Little - N02Qhưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phức is 63 years old and married. She lives in Thanh Hoa City, a town in Thanh Hoa province, and she has been raising poultry for more than 10 years. Her family is low-income. Moreover, market demand is low in this region, and income from this business is unstable because if the chickens get a disease, they can die and leave her nothing to sell. And she will be in financial trouble.The main hardship that Phức faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future.

In 2012, Phức joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid many loans from this institution. She is the group leader of "Chicken Little - N02QHưng," which has six members.

In the future, Phức hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: To purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 51 years old. He is married and has 4 children. 

His business is farming. He has been in the business for 19 years. He earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase spraying chemicals for his mango trees to prevent fruit diseases.  

He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to be a great export or of mangoes.

loans.use: to purchase spraying chemicals for his mango trees to prevent fruit diseases

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
This is Rosalie’s tailoring shop located inside her house in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. In her 10 years of operation, she has gained the trust of her clients due to her quality products. She sews school and office uniforms, customized clothing, curtains, blankets and pillow cases. Sometimes she receives volume orders from schools and offices but her capital for raw materials doesn’t suffice. She appeals for PHP 15,000 supplementary capital to buy more cloths and fabrics, threads, and accessories. She hopes to increase her production, and for sure her earnings will follow. 

Rosalie has another source of livelihood. She gives massage therapy service to her friends, neighbors and relatives. They are also her captured customers in her tailoring business.

Rosalie is doing all these undertakings for the sake of her two children who are studying in college. Joey, her husband, is doing his part by nurturing their small farm. It’s their desire to see their children with stable career after finishing their college degree.

Rosalie draws strength and inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share their experiences and reflect on the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and fabrics, threads, and accessories.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married and the mother of 3. For 15 years, she has operated a general store in her village. Jocelyn needs to add inventory capital to increase her sales because her business is the main source of income that absolutely supports her children's needs. Jocelyn joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods for sale. She hopes that, in the future, her business will prosper. She wants to settle down, having a complete and happy family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Yolesa

texts.en:
Yolesa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

Yolesa has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Amanda Ines

texts.es:
Amanda es toda una guerrera, una mujer que junto con su esposo sacaron a sus hijos adelante, eran dos personas sin empleo, a los cuales les cerraron las puertas, pero no se rindieron, continuaron su camino y encontraron en el emprendimiento la manera para salir adelante y generar los recursos para mantenerse.
Amanda inicio con la venta de alimentos, los cuales continúa elaborándolos en la comodidad de su cocina.
Su labor está llegando a más personas, tiene un mayor pedido lo que en el momento resulta una bendición pero de igual manera un problema ya que no tiene los recursos para comprar los insumos necesarios para abastecer la demanda actual, es por este motivo que quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar, con los cuales hará almuerzos y fiambres.
Su principal sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, apoyar incondicionalmente a sus hijos y asegurar un futuro para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Amanda is a real fighter, a woman who alongside her husband got her kids ahead. They were two unemployed people, who had doors shut in their faces, but they didn't give up. They kept on going and in starting their own business discovered a way out and also how to generate the means to support themselves.

Amanda started her business by selling food, which she continues to prepare from the comfort of her kitchen. Her work is reaching more people and she has more demand, which is a blessing but also a problem because the lacks the resources to purchase the supplies necessary to satisfy the current demand. This is why she wants to apply for financial help to purchase an assortment of household staple goods, with which she'll prepare lunches and cold cuts.

Her main dream is to improve her famliy's standard of living, support her children unconditionally and secure a future for she and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of household staple goods, with which she'll prepare lunches and cold cuts.

loans.name: Jamela

texts.en:
Jamela is 39 years old and married with six children, who are in school, Jamela works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jamela has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Jamela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 54 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Betty works very hard to provide for them.

Betty runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like biscuits, noodles, soy sauce, canned goods, candies, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

Betty has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, noodles, soy sauce, canned goods, candies, toothpaste, etc. 

Betty would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like biscuits, noodles, soy sauce, canned goods, candies, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en:
FOUZIA, aged 29, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities for her children, and this is the reason for her working extremely hard to keep her children smiling.

She started sewing clothes after the birth of her two children, when she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them. Then she decided to start tailoring work at home and since then she has been sewing clothes for her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her craft so she would like to buy a Juki sewing machine. The professionals use this machine for tailoring because of its speed and fine performance.

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community. She has requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

FOUZIA is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki machine and some additional items for her cloth sewing business so she can enhance her profession.

loans.name: Sath

texts.en:
Sath is 65 years old and married woman who lives in remote village of Kampong Thom Province. Sath and her spouse help each other in farming activities in order to put the family in better living conditions. She has been engaged in this field for 30 years with the average income is USD 2.5 per day.

At the moment, Sath would like to order a set of solar home system to install at her home. This will allow her family members to gain access to clean energy, helping them with light at night. They also can use radio or TV for their entertainment. Due to the shortage of funds, she has requested a loan from Kiva to buy a set of solar home system. She is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate than its general loan. Sath awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a set of solar home system

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Sari-sari stores (general stores) are small retail outlets that can be found in almost all neighborhoods, sometimes even on every street corner, in the Philippines. Most sari-sari stores are privately owned shops and are operated inside the store owner’s house. Angelina, a woman who is 57 years old, is engaged in this kind of business. She is the mother of 10 children. Together with her husband, a farmer, she works hard to make their business successful so they can provide for the needs of their big family. 

She is thinking of a strategy to attract more customers so that her sales will increase. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more commodities to sell, like canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, candies, chips, biscuits, salt, and sugar.  She also plans to buy piglets and medicinal oil. She hopes that this increase in commodities will help her to enhance her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, candies, chips, biscuits, salt, sugar, piglets, and medicinal oil

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa is 55 years old and she is married.
She has had a retail business selling shoes for 6 years. Hoa lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
In 2014, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Kaini

texts.en:
Kaini is 41 years old. She is married and a mother of 5 children.

Her business is farming mostly mangoes and cow peas. She has been in the business for 3 years.

She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to purchase spraying chemicals for her mango trees.

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and have at least 1,000 mango trees.

loans.use: to purchase spraying chemicals for her mango trees.

loans.name: Ma. Roselyn

texts.en:
Ma. Roselyn is 48 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Ma. Roselyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like snack foods, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

Ma. Roselyn has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, sanitary pads, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Roselyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like snack foods, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, sanitary pads, etc. to sell

loans.name: Welyn

texts.en:
Welyn is 39 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, bread, canned goods, chips, etc.

Welyn has been in this business for six years.

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, bread, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 54 years old and married with four children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Constancia has been in pig fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Constancia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Cionela

texts.en:
Cionela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a native bags weaving business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for nine years. She earns additional income from operating a general store. 

Cionela requested a loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more raw materials for her business. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 35 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marilyn has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is 51 years old and has two children. Jelyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Jelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jelyn requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Jelyn has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Ricardo Ferney

texts.es:
Ricardo es un joven de 26 años de edad, un padre responsable, trabajador que quiere brindarles a sus tres hijos de 3, 5, 8 años de edad, el mejor futuro posible, trabaja como productor agropecuario, su especialidad es el ordeño de vacas, una actividad que conoce muy bien gracias a que desde pequeño le fue inculcada por sus padres.
Su sueño es pagar la educación de sus muchachos y se forjen un excelente futuro, tengan un vida digna y prospera. 
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una vaca lechera, para aumentar su producción. 
Una vaca de más en su pasto significara un aumento significativo de ingresos, ayudara a tener un equilibrio económico, el cual se vio afectado por la reducción del precio de leche.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a young 26 year old man, a responsible father, and a hard worker who wants to provide his kids, ages 3, 5, and 8, the best future possible. He's employed as an agricultural producer and his specialty is milking cows, a task that he's very familiar with thanks to the fact that his parents taught him when he was a little boy.

His dream is to pay for his kids' schooling so they can have a bright future and a respectable and prosperous life. He's applying for a loan to purchase a dairy cow, to increase his production. An extra cow on his pasture would mean a substantial increase in income, and help him have financial stability, which was compromised by the drop in the price of milk.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow, to increase his production.

loans.name: Gjergj

texts.en:
Gjergj, a father of five daughters, wants this loan to pay for the education fees of his two older daughters.

The family's income comes from agriculture and a sort of monthly compensation in an amount of $150 for Gjergj who was forced to live and grow in concentration camps and prisons due to his family's political views until the collapse.

loans.use: to pay the education fees for his two out of five daughters.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old. She is married and a mother of 3 children. 

Her business is a green grocery shop. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of four thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase oranges, tomatoes, onions, bananas and cabbages for sale.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, tomatoes, onions, bananas and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a visionary.

She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are factories and individuals. She says her biggest business challenge is price fluctuation.

She will use the PHP 8,000 loan to pay for farm labor and buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to invest in business.

loans.use: to pay for labor and purchase fertilizer for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 53 years old, married, and has children. He is from Santa Barbara, Iloilo. He drives his tricycle for income. He earns enough to support his family’s basic needs such as food, utilities, and school allowances for his children. When it comes to their tuition fees, Ronald has serious anxiety on where to get it. This is especially true if his tricycle encounters mechanical problems and he does not have enough spare parts and tools necessary for repairs.

In the future, Ronald wants to expand his business by buying another unit that he can rent out to augment his income. For now, he is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which he will use to buy spare parts and tools for repairs. He wants to prepare for sudden mechanical problems and avoid damage to his tricycle that will make it idle for days. He is determined to enhance his business and operate more tricycles someday. This will ensure the future and education of his children.

Ronald meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a married woman with five children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old.

She has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products from avon like lotion, deodorant, lipstick, etc., to sell.

Lea has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon like lotion, deodorant, lipstick, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 53 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jacinta has a general store business in the Philippines. Jacinta requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jacinta has been in this business for 11 years. Jacinta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer emprendedora, una mujer con mente abierta y dispuesta al progreso, una persona que lucha por sus ideales, es una campesina a mucho a honor y se dedica al cultivo, dicha profesión la cual práctica junto con su esposo.
Es madre de 5 hijos 3 de ellos menores de edad, su propósito es capacitarlos y brindarles una excelente educación y que elijan que destino o que camino quieren seguir.
Para continuar generando ingresos y ante todo mantener su campo en óptimas condiciones, la señora Beatriz quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como abonos, riegos y pesticidas.
texts.en:
Beatriz is an enterprising woman with an open mind and willing to move forward. She's somebody who fights for her principles, a farmer with a sense of honor whose work is tending her crops. She engages in this profession alongside her husband.

She's the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom are minors. Her goal is to train them and provide them with an excellent education so they can choose the path they wish to walk. To keep on generating income and above all maintain her fields in prime condition, Beatriz wants to apply for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, irrigation and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies, such as manure, irrigation and pesticides.

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama is a 28-year-old married mother with two children. For two years, she worked from her home, selling gifts and chocolates for special occasions. Then, in February 2015, she took an important step forward and opened a separate shop outside her house to attract more customers and promote her business.

Lama is well known in her region. Starting her own business was very expensive, and she works very hard to develop it and make it perfect. For this reason, Lama is currently acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. With the loan, she will decorate her shop to keep attracting customers and to increase her business capital.

She hopes that she can develop her business more in the future.

loans.use: To decorate her shop to keep attracting customers and to increase her business capital

loans.name: Victorious

texts.en: Victorious is 37 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She does farming and livestock keeping. She has been in the business for 13 years. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support her family. She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to grow more cash crops and be financially stable, and have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 19 years old and is 1st of four children in the family. Her mother Elena a member of NWTF, supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Mary Rose is studying Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently on her 2nd of this 4-year course.

Elena is borrowing PHP 4000 to pay tuition fees of her daughter Mary Rose for the second semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Mary Rose plans to be gainfully employed so she could help to improve the quality of life of her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for a BSc. in Elementary Education.

loans.name: Hermela

texts.en:
Hermela is 61 years old and widowed with five children.  

Hermela is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Hermela requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Hermela has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Hermela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 58 years old married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lolita has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonarda is 52 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Leonarda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Leonarda requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Leonarda has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gardenia

texts.en:
Gardenia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a banana farming business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gardenia has been in this business for 12 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, canned goods, eggs, fish, etc.

Susan has been in this business for seven years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, canned goods, eggs, fish, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Juanita has been in this business for seven years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Erica Maria

texts.es:
Erica es una joven de 24 años de edad, una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, madre cabeza de familia que se dedica a la fabricación de calzado, actividad que ejerce 6 días a la semana con una intensidad diaria de 6 horas.
SU hijo es su mayor inspiración, él tan solo tiene 7 años y se siente muy preocupada por el futuro que le puede deparar, pues como madre amorosa y sobreprotectora quiera lo mejor para su hijo, por ello trabaja y trabaja, pues busca mejorar su situación económica y darle muchos gustos a su bebe.
Entre sus sueños esta también comprar una vivienda propia, y esta trabajadora, respetuosa y entusiasta mujer pondrá todo su esfuerzo y empeño para alcanzar sus metas. 
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la fabricación de calzado, quiere aumentar su producción y tener una buena cantidad de calzado disponible para la venta puesto que se acerca la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Erica is a young 24 old woman, a determined, hardworking head of household whose job is manufacturing footwear. It's a task that she performs intensely 6 days a week, 6 hours a day.

Her son is her biggest source of motivation, he's only 7 years old and she's very worried about what the future has in store for him. As a loving, overprotective mother she wants the best for her son so she works and works, since she's seeking to improve their financial situation and give her baby lots to be happy about. One of her dreams is to purchase a home of her own, and this hardworking, responsible, enthusiastic woman will put all of her effort and determination into reaching her goals.

She's applying for a loan to purchase materials to make footwear, as she wants to increase her production and have a healthy amount of footwear available for sale because the Christmas season is approaching.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make footwear.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha  is 62 years old and married. She  works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from food vending.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as canned goods, coffee, biscuits, shampoo, detergent, soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

Editha  has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as canned goods, coffee, biscuits, shampoo, detergent, soap, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets, gasoline, wood, etc.

Rosie has been in this business for 5 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, gasoline, wood, etc

loans.name: Rubiel Esteban

texts.es:
Rubiel a sus 25 años de edad carga con una gran responsabilidad, mantiene un hogar conformado por su pareja y su hijo de tan solo 3 años, pero para este hombre su familia lo es todo, los ama con todo su corazón y trabaja muy duro en su negocio de ganadería.
Rubiel tiene 3 objetivos para su familia: el primero es pagar la educación de sus hijos, dejar la el negocio a su descendencia y pro ultimo comprar una vivienda propia.
Rubiel es muy consciente que, con la producción actual de su negocio le será muy difícil alcanzar sus sueños, por ello pide un apoyo económico para la compra de ganando para aumentar sus animales, vacunas y alimento de engorde.
Anímate!, apoya a este empresario que busca por todos los medios honestos alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
At the age of 25 Rubiel is carrying a huge responsibility, he's supporting a household that consists of his partner and his son of only 3 years of age. But for this man, family is everything and he loves them with all his heart and works very hard on his cattle business.

Rubiel has 3 goals for his family: the first is to pay for his children's education, pass on the business to his offspring, and lastly purchase a home of his own. He's very aware that, with his business' current production, it will be very difficult to make his dreams come true, so that's why he's requesting financial help to purchase cattle to increase his stock of animals, and vaccines and fattening feed.

C'mon! Help this young entrepreneur who's trying every honest way possible to make his dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to increase his stock of animals, and vaccines and fattening feed.

loans.name: Edmelinda

texts.en:
Edmelinda is a 56-year-old married woman with four children. Two of her children are still in school. 

She is a very hard working entrepreneur who runs a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers.

Edmelinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is married and works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling native mats in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more native mats to sell.

Emelita has been in this business for three years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more native mats to sell

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her store, including soap, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, and canned goods.

Rosenda has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store, including soap, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, and canned goods

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 53 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Annabelle is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Annabelle has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF nine times in the past to sustain her business.

Annabelle would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr: Drissa  est commerçant  de céréale, âgé de 42 ans il  habite au Mali, marié et père  de huit  enfants  4 garçons et 4 filles, âgé de 1 à 17 ans dont trois scolarisés deux filles et un garçon. Il est celui qui  tient  la balance en main et le mille est devant  sur photo, sa femme est ménagère. IL exerce ce métier il y a 6 ans de cela, il s’approvisionne et vend ses céréales dans sa localité. IL  sollicite  au près du RMCR un prêt   pour acheter beaucoup de sacs de céréale, le bénéfice  servira à  subvenir aux  soins sanitaire, habillement et condiments. IL peut réaliser un revenu mensuel de 50000FCFA. Les difficultés rencontrés par Drissa est souvent la chute du prix. IL rêve d’être un grand commerçant dans la zone et utile pour la communauté.
texts.en:
Drissa is a small-scale cereal retailer, aged 42. He lives in Mali, is married, and the father of eight children, four sons and four daughters, aged from 1 to 17 years; three are enrolled in school--two daughters and one son. He is the one who is holding the scales in his hand, and the millet is in front of him in the photo. His wife is a housewife. He has been in this business for six years; he buys and sells cereals in his locality.

Drissa is asking for a loan from RMCR to buy a lot of sacks of cereals. The profit will be useful to cover healthcare expenses, clothing, and food. He can make a monthly income of 50,000 f CFA. The difficulty encountered often by Drissa is a drop in prices. He dreams of being a large-scale retailer in his area and being useful for his community.

loans.use: to buy some sacks of cereals for resale.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 40-year-old married mother of three children who has been employed in a company for thirteen years, to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children.

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to pay her son's school tuition fees. She hopes to stay capable of providing her family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her son's school tuition fees

loans.name: Twisungane/gisovu Group

texts.en:
Clement is 42 years old and married with 5 children, ages 8 and 18. He is the president of the group TWISUNGANE/GISOVU, is the man who is on the second line and he runs a carpentry. Clement has been in this business for 20 years and sells chairs, doors etc at his store.

He requested this loan through Vision Finance Company to buy trees and wood to made chairs, windows etc to sell. Clement says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his family status and to pay school fees for children and increase his business level. In the future, he would like to buy a field to dig different products to help him to get more profit.

loans.use: to buy trees and wood to made chairs, windows to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and works hard to support her family. She has a coffee vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, coffee, etc. for her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, coffee, etc. for her business

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 35-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband runs a small boutique near his home; he sells garments at very reasonable rates. He purchases cloth from the market for a low price, sews it, and then sells it for a high price in his community. The ladies of the town like his garments a lot. The demand for garments has increased due to attractive designs and colors.

He wants to increase the variety of clothing he is able to sell on a daily basis. Shazia has requested a loan so that her husband can buy cloth to sew a greater variety of garments to fulfill the demand.

Shazia wishes for the bright future of her children. Her dream is to provide a better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cloth for her husband so he can sew a variety of garments to sell from his boutique.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is 37 years old. He is married and has one child.  His business is farming and livestock trade. He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of three thousand Kenya shillings. This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy goats for sale. He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy goats for sale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 28 years old. She is married and the mother of four children.

Her business is farming and poultry keeping. She has been in the business for three years.

She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to purchase additional chicken and poultry feed.

Juliana will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicken and poultry feed.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 42 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future Eleonor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
María, de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo 1 vive con ella y sus demás hijos ya tienen sus propias familias.

María, trabaja en un cafetin y en la agricultura, de esas dos actividades obtiene los ingresos necesario para suplir sus gastos, actualmente siembra maíz y frijol.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su tienda tales como: pan, café, detergentes, arroz, azúcar, entre otros, de esa manera ella podrá estar segura que generara más ingresos económicos para su familia.

Su principal sueño, es volver a ver a sus hijos, porque ellos se encuentran en el extranjero, también quiere reconstruir su casa, porque actualmente su vivienda es de adobe.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and studied up to second grade. She has 3 children, of which only 1 lives with her while the other children already have their own families.

Maria works in a small store and agriculture. These two activities give her the necessary income to pay her bills. She is currently growing corn and beans.

Maria needs a loan to buy more merchandise for her store such as bread, coffee, detergents, rice, sugar and other things. This way she can be sure that she will be able to generate more income for her family.

Her main dream is to see her children as they live abroad. She also wants to rebuild her house because her current home is made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store such as bread, coffee, detergents, rice, sugar and other things.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

She supplements her income with earnings from her pig fattening.

Maricel dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Emma Leonor

texts.es: Emma es una confeccionista residente en un barrio del municipio de Soledad ubicado en el Departamento del Atlántico que por tradición familiar, en el taller de una tía aprendió el arte, posteriormente laboro en una zona franca de la ciudad y con su liquidación compro las máquinas necesarias para iniciar su proyecto de negocio “su propio taller de confecciones” desde la comodidad de su hogar.  Ella cuenta con 29 años de experiencia ofreciendo todo tipo de prenda de vestir para damas y caballeros sobre medidas; camisas, pantalones, vestidos, entre otros y desearía dar un mejor acabado a sus prendas por lo que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de una máquina recubridora y telas.  Esta nueva adquisición permitirá que Emma haga puntos, costuras pespuntes y centradas de modo que sus prendas estarán mejor elaboradas. Su meta a futuro es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Emma is a clothing manufacturer in a neighborhood in the city of Soledad, located in the Department of the Atlantic. By family tradition, her aunt taught her the art of sewing. Later, she worked in a free-trade zone in the city and when that closed, she bought the machines necessary to start her own clothing shop from the comfort of her home.

She has 29 years of experience providing all types of clothing for women and men, including measurements, shirts, pants, dresses, among others. She would like to put a better finishing touch on her products, which is why she is applying for a CrediKiva loan, primary financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy a coverstitch machine and fabric.

This new purchase will allow Emma to do stitches, backstitch and central seams so that her garments can be made at a higher quality. Her goal for the future is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch machine and fabric.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 34 and is married with 4 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this for many years and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to her good reputation the demand for fine cloth has increased and she wants to buy pretty clothing to cope with the demand.

This is the reason Shaheen showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothing for her children.

loans.use: to buy pretty clothing for her clothing selling business, so she can  cope with the demand. .

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is 37-years old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her 4 sons and one daughter. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. For many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income.

He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. She is so much thankful to Kiva and filed pertner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 33, mother of three children, living with her children and spouse in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns a business of making packing boxes. He has been running this business for the last many years. At the beginning, it was not much profitable but with the passage of time, he has established it on grand level.

Now there are co-workers also working with him. He purchases raw material from market such as corn starch glue, cardboard, brightly colored inks and cutter machine etc. After manufacturing the packing boxes, he supplies them to the shop keepers. He manages his household necessities from his business as well.

So he wants to expand his business of box making. For this purpose he is in need of more raw material. Therefore, Asma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more raw material to enhance his packing box business. Asma hopes that lenders will support to her and this loan will prove productive for her husband's business as well. She is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system and is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's packing box making business.

loans.name: Karina Beatriz

texts.es: Karina es una joven de 18 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 3 meses de edad que es su mayor alegría y ella desea brindarle lo mejor que este en sus manos. Karina se desempeña prestando sus servicios domésticos desde hace varios años en comunidades cercanas, por lo que puede estar pendiente de su hija, además su compañero de vida le apoya con los gastos de su hogar. Karina desea encementar el piso de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda lo antes posible y evitar enfermedades respiratorias a su familia sobre todo a su pequeña.
texts.en:
Karina is a young woman, 18 years old, who lives in her own house with her life's companion and her little daughter. Her child, three months of age, is Karina's greatest delight, and she wishes to offer her the best that she possibly can.

Karina has worked at domestic services for several years in nearby communities, so that she can be available for her daughter, and her life's companion helps out with household expenses.

Karina wishes to construct a cement floor for her house, since the current floor is quite deteriorated. For that reason, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to provide the required cement as soon as possible and, thereby, avoid respiratory illnesses in her family, and especially to protect her little daughter.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and gravel in order to enlarge the floor of her home and avoid respiratory ailments in her family.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is 31 years old. He is married and has one child. His runs a retail shop and the business has been profitable. He has been in this business for one year. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for sell in the shop and make more income to support her family. He will use the profits from expanded business to reinvest into the business to expand the stock. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business to a wholesale level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for selling in his shop and to make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 45000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 4 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juliet is 50 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Juliet has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 27000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing nets, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Juliet has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets, gasoline, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Cerlita

texts.en:
Cerlita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling coconut palm leaf and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cerlita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Ep Nyamulagira Group

texts.fr: Nyaziro est enseignant (moniteur) dans un groupe EP Nyamulagira, qui bénéficie des crédits de l’IMF Hekima. Il est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 4 jeunes enfants dont 2 étudient et 2 autres sont gosses. Son crédit sera affecté dans le projet d’habitat. Avec ce nouveau crédit, il va acheter des carreaux, sables, ciments, clous, etc. pour la réalisation du projet de construction de sa maison. Ainsi, Il remercie Hekima pour son programme de microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en:
Nyaziro is a teacher (instructor) and belongs to this group called EP Nyamulagira, which has been receiving loans from microfinance institution Hekima. He is 39 years old, married, and the father of four young children, of whom two are attending school and two are still too young for school.

His loan falls under the Housing sector. With this new loan he is going to buy some tiles, sand, cement, nails, etc. to complete the planned construction project of his home. Thus, he thanks Hekima for its small loan program benefiting teachers.

loans.use: to buy tiles, sand, cement, nails, etc

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 37 years old married woman. She is mother of two sons and one daughter. She has been running a clothing business for the last six years. She wants to support her family through her business. She purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in the main market.
Presently she needs to purchase some clothes to sell. However due to lack of finance she is facing problem. For that she is requested for loan from Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more clothing stock from main clothing market for her own sale business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 40-year-old married mother of one child, who has been running her accessories, perfumes and cosmetics selling shop since 2012 to support her husband who works as a tutor to make their living.
Khadija is a hard working woman, she is well known in her region with her special products and encouraging prices she sets.
Her income is good enough to cover her family's daily living needs, but the increasing unexpected necessary living or educational needs, request and additional external financial support.
That's why, Khadija is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her child's school tuition fees.
She is working hard to develop her business and improve her family's living at the same time.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school tuition fees

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 28-year-old woman who lives in Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married and has three children ages six, four and two years old. Her husband is a driver while Florence is running a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this for five years to earn a living. She is asking a loan to buy powdered chocolate drink, powdered juice, coffee, sugar, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, eggs, spices, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and drinking liquor. In the future, Florence is determined to enhance their livelihood to have better means of living and for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy powdered chocolate drink, powdered juice, coffee, sugar, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, eggs, spices, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and drinking liquor

loans.name: Wanza

texts.en: Wanza is 54 years old, married and has 4 children. She does farming and has been in the business for 13 years. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell and support her family. She will use the generated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her farming by growing more cash crops, have a stable business and a healthy family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for selling and to support her family.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 43 years old. She is married and has one child. Her business is farming. 

She has been in the business for 14 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.  She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for 4 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Egna

texts.en:
Egna is 62 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming flowers in the Philippines. Egna is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy an additional variety of flowers, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Egna has been farming flowers for three years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and videoke rentals.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional variety of flowers, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en:
Helina is 48 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Helina requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Helina has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and married with one child. With one child still in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, cereals, sugar, etc. 

Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 40 years old and has six children.  Rose Marie is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Rose Marie requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rose Marie has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 46 years old, married and has five children, two of whom in school. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Sara requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Sara has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 28 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Twiyubakiricyizere Sub Group A

texts.en:
TWIYUBAKIRIKIZERE is a group led by Emmanuel, who is 23 years old and not yet married. The group name means “Build Our Hope” in English. Emmanuel owns a shop and has been doing this business for the past one year. The group members sell various items and they have the same idea for changing their lives.

With this loan, Emmanuel would like to buy more salt, sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside savings.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar, soap, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cassava, bananas and millet to sell.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea is 34 years old and married with three dependent children, two of whom attend school, while the youngest one is under the age of school. She lives with her family in Kampong Cham province, where she and her husband are earning their main source of income through growing dry- and rainy-season rice. She has been in this business for 16 years. In addition to the main income, Sophea works as a weaver too. However, drought, which causes her rice farm to produce a lower output, is the main challenge to her farming business.

In a group of three members, Sophea is the group leader and she will use her loan to support rainy-season rice by purchasing organic fertilizer and fuel to fill the pumping machine. She hopes that these can help her run her farming business smoothly and she can get more yields to upgrade the standard of living for the family.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe or 'white' in English is a married mother of four, 21 is the oldest and 16 is the youngest.
To earn a living for their family, Bardhe has been keeping livestock for the past ten years.

Currently, she has three cows, three sows and thirty chickens. Her family doesn't own much agricultural land, but some front and back yards, which she plants and she has some orchards for the family. Some relatives who have emigrated to neighboring countries have allowed her to graze her cows on their land. She sells about two calves a year and piglets as well. Her husband was working for some years as a prison guard nearby, but recently was laid off and has a struggle finding employment, as per his statement.

"Our house this year needs some basic renovations because children live with us and also elderly parents and soon will start the bitter winter," said Bardhe to the branch assistant.

loans.use: to do some basic renovations in their family home of 8 including four children and 2 elders

loans.name: Rajab

texts.ru:
53 летняя бизнес-леди Рачаб. Она занимается торговлей деятельности. У Рачаб имеется магазин, где она продает печенье, вафли, конфеты, шоколады и другие продукт питания. У нее 5 летный опыт работы. Ей нравится торговая деятельность, и общаться с новыми клиентами. 
Рачаб замужем и мать одного единственного сына. Сыну 24 года. Мужу 64 года. Ее невестка домохозяйка, следит за домашними делами. Рачаб в работе помогает ее сын. Рачаб мечтала о расширения торговлей деятельности. Она хочет перевозить продукт питания на продажу, но у нее не имеется денежных средств. И она решила взять кредит и расширить деятельность. Рачаб верит в Вас и на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Rajab is a 53-year-old businesswoman. She works in the retail sector. Rajab has a shop, where she sells pastries, waffles, sweets, chocolates, and food products. She has 5 years of work experience. She likes her retail business and communicating with new clients. 

Rajab is married, and is mother to a single son. Her son is 24 years old. Her husband is 64 years old. Her daughter-in-law is a homemaker, and sees to the domestic chores. Rajab's son helps her with her work. 

Rajab dreams of expanding her retail business. She wants to transport food products for sale, but she does not have the funds. Thus she has decided to take a loan and expand her business. Rajab believes in you and your kindness.

loans.use: to transport food products and expand her business.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea, 30 years old, is a vegetable seller at market who lives in Santuk district, Kampong Thom Province. She is a hard-working mother of three children. She can make a net profit approximately USD 3 a day.

During this time, Thea is facing with a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy wood to build her new house but yet she can’t afford. After getting to know that HKL provides Kiva loan with the lower interest rate than its normal loan, she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help them. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy wood to build her new house

loans.name: Erliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 35-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has three sons ages 15, 10 and three years old. She does a living by selling vegetables, noodles and spices in the market place. She has been doing this for 10 years and hoping to have more successful years to come to help them enhance their livelihood.

She uses her profit to sustain their daily expenses such as food, children’s school payments and other basic needs. Thus Eliza is asking a loan of PHP12000 to buy more vegetables, noodles and spices to sell. She dreams in the future to have her own capital to run their business so that she could provide their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, noodles and spices to sell

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is 33 years old. He is married and has one child. His business is farming. 

He has been in the business for 15 years. He earns a monthly income of thirty two thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds to improve production.  

He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable so as to take care of his family

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds to improve production.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fertilizer business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer to sell for her buy-and-sell fertilizer business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to sell for her business

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly is 29 years old and has five children. Felly is married and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Felly requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Felly has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felly would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jovelyn is 29 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jovelyn has a folding bed making business in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Jovelyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her folding bed business.

loans.name: Dilë

texts.en:
This is Dile who wants to buy a dairy cow with a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek that she is requesting from you.
Dila is a 36-year-old villager and a married mother of four who lives in the northern part of the country. While her husband has been working as a welder for a monthly pay of $120, her focus has been on raising the children and doing rural activity.

Her family owns only six dynym of agricultural land where she mainly plants fodder for the animals and also plants for the family veggies, grains, pulses and has some orchards as well.Currently, she has 1 dairy cow and sells about 8 liters of raw milk a day, 1 sow and 20 chickens; she doesn't sell neither piglets nor chickens or eggs as she uses them for family consumption.

"Adding another dairy cow, will allow me to sell 8 more liters of raw milk a day. Our income is extremely small for our family at the moment," said Dile in the interview.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, so that she sells more raw milk to increase the very little income her family currently generates

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 30-year-old mother of three children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renewing the turbine and radiators. He has been in this business for many years, and up to now his business has been very steady. Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts, the whole mechanism of the lathe machine is affected.
