Allah Rakhi's husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or buy cutting tools. Therefore, Allah Rakhi has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the lathe machine and can manufacture spare parts.

Allah Rakhi hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her husband's lathe machine so he can manufacture spare parts.

loans.name: Asya

texts.en:
Asya is 31 years old and she lives with her large family (she has two daughters and a son) in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Asya has higher pedagogical education, but she has no work experience in that field. Nonetheless, she is already very skilled in farming, in which she is engaged with her husband (he also works as a cook).

Asya takes care of cows, calves, a bull, a pig and chickens. Asya mentions that she likes her farm work, and with great pleasure she makes very tasty cheese and macun (national dairy product) from her farm milk. She also sells the milk, meat and eggs. On her plot of land Asya cultivates potatoes and sells them to re-sellers right from her farm. Now with this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, Asya would like to purchase of a cow, a calf and fodder for her cattle. She hopes to make her farm richer and hopes for richer income for her family also.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, a calf and fodder for her cattle.

loans.name: Al Ekhwa Group

texts.en:
Farah is the featured borrower of Al Ekhwa group. She came together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to improve their family's living situations.

Farah is the lady at the far left side of the picture; she is a 20-year-old single lady who has been working as a tutor to make a living and cover her education expenses since 2010.

Her acquired group loan will be invested in paying for her university teaching diploma and increasing tuition fees, since her income isn't enough to cover such increasing unexpected education needs.

As for the other group members, Malak is the lady at the center of the picture, while Zahra is the lady on the far right side of the picture.

loans.use: To pay for her teaching diploma and  increasing university tuition fees.

loans.name: Wendy Patricia

texts.es: Con 21 años de edad Wendy  desea invertir en su negocio de venta zapatos de forma ambulante recorriendo las principales calles de su municipio, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Wendy habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad al que trata de brindarle lo mejor. Wendy solicito un crédito anteriormente con el cual mejoro el techo de su vivienda, pero el piso del cuarto de la misma se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para mejorar el piso de su vivienda que está deteriorado.
texts.en:
Wendy, aged 21, wants to invest in her business, which is selling shoes itinerantly along the main streets of her town. This brings her an income with which to support her family.

Wendy lives in her own home with her partner and their two-year-old son, for whom she wants the best. Wendy has previously requested a loan, which she used to improve the roof of her home. The floor is in poor condition, and she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and gravel to repair it.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to repair the floor of her home which is in poor condition.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 49 years old, and she lives in Sevan city, in the Gegharkunik region. She has musical education, and she is proud to say that she is a master of playing an Armenian national musical instrument called a kanon. After graduation she started to work at the musical college as a teacher of kanon. She is happy that there are now a few children that are interested and greatly want to learn all the skills and techniques of playing on it. Marieta also works at the school as a teacher of music.

Marieta is married and lives with her husband and daughter. Her son lives abroad. Marieta asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy a new kanon since her instrument is too old and the typical pure and nice sound just cannot be heard while playing on it. She would like also to buy some professional literature since the theory in musical education is as important as the practice.

loans.use: to buy a new "kanon" (Armenian musical instrument) and some professional literature since the theory in musical education is as important as the practice.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is 48 years old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son who is also pictured with her. He also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop.

Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet their expenses. Currently, she requested a loan of 55000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Jane is 25 years old. She is married and a mother of 5 children. 

Jane operates a retail shop, a business she has done for 3 years and earns a monthly income of twelve thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase stock of rice, sugar, maize flour, detergents, bread, paraffin, tea leaves etc. for sale.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, sugar, maize flour, detergents, bread, paraffin, tea leaves etc. for sale.

loans.name: Husik

texts.en:
Husik is 49 years old. He lives with his family in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. He graduated from Yerevan State University chemical faculty. Husik lives with his daughter, son, daughter-in-law and granddaughter. For 10 years he works as an engineer- technologist at the private company. Now he is unemployed and he is busy with farming, agriculture, bee keeping and poultry.

On the farm he has cows, heifers, pigs, over 100 chickens and 20 bee colonies. With his farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat and a lot of eggs and also honey, which is very popular not only in his village but in the whole region. His grows vegetables (potato, cucumber, tomato, garlic, peppers and greens) are also sold very quickly and easily.

Husik is happy with his farming and he mentions he feels so happy to provide all his family with fresh farm products and healing honey. Now this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams he needs as his farm cattle has lack of fodder and he will buy it for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: as his farm cattle lack fodder and he will buy it for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 32-year-old woman living with her five children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily rent because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra-poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased. He has been worried for many days about how to avoid paying the daily rent and has decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Rukhsana has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing she did not have enough money. Therefore, she has requested a loan so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.

She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income because he will not have to pay daily rent to anyone. She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Fermin Jr.

texts.en:
Fermin supports his family through his fish-selling business. He sells in neighboring municipalities of Baybay, Leyte. He has been doing this for 10 years in spite of many obstacles.

Fermin is determined to do things right to provide for the needs of his family. He has five children to support: two school-aged children and two adult children. His wife stays home and takes good care of them.

He is in need of a bigger-amount loan to buy more fish to sell. At 47 years old, Fermin, aims to expand this business to increase his profitability so that he can continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Julio Ernesto

texts.es: Julio tiene 39 años  vive con su esposa y tiene 3 hijos Julio de 17, Mayerli de 15 y Cintia de 13 que están estudiando en un colegio gratuito. Julio trabajaba lejos de su familia, durante mucho tiempo, pero por estar con ellos decide desde hace un año emprender su propio negocio creando  una pequeña carpintería,   que le ha generado ingreso para la mantención de su hogar. El necesita el dinero para poder comprar una cierra circular y un taladro que facilitara la elaboración de puertas, mesas, camas sillas, etc. generando más ingresos para poder asegurar la  alimentación y educación a sus hijos y paulatinamente ir innovando maquinaria en su negocio.
texts.en: Julio is 39 and lives with his wife and they have three children: Julio, 17, Mayerli, 15, and Cintia, 13, who are studying in a free school. Julio worked far from his family for a long time, but to be with them he decided to start his own business a year ago, creating a small carpentry shop that has generated him income for maintaining his home. He needs the money to be able to buy a circular say and drill that will facilitate the making of doors, tables, beds, chairs, etc., generating more income to be able to assure the feeding and education of his children and gradually go innovating machinery in his business.

loans.use: to buy drill and circular saw machinery.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: In Kapan city of Syunik region lives Artur with his wife, son and his family. His daughter is married and she lives with her family. Artur many years used to work as a driver and now also he makes cargo transfers and simultaneously is engaged in poultry and gardening. In his farm he has 40 chickens and he also has fruit garden full of apple, persimmon and fig trees. So his farm products are poultry, eggs and his garden’s fruits, for which he has his regular customers. Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Artur asks as he wants to repair his hen-coop, to buy fodder for chickens, and also to make the pouches of young trees for his fruit garden.

loans.use: to repair his hen-coop, to buy fodder for chickens, and also to make the pouches of young trees for his fruit garden

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida has been doing a business of shoe-making for many years along with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She is an energetic person and eager to support her family. She is responsible for taking care of the basic necessities of her children, including food, health and clothing. She is also accountable for improving their standard of living. By the support of Kashf Foundation she is fulfilling her dreams and is able to manage her children’s education.

Now she requested for a 50000 PKR to buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles, etc. In this way, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence, better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for shoe manufacturing, including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives with her husband and single daughter in Artashat city of Ararat region. She has a higher pedagogical education and has worked for 34 years at the school as a teacher of elementary classes.

Thanks to several years of savings, Ruzanna’s family has been able to repair their flat, which has not been repaired for more than 10 years. Now, Ruzanna will be happy and thankful if Kiva lenders help her with a loan to buy living room and kitchen furniture for her newly repaired flat.

loans.use: to buy living room and kitchen furniture for her newly repaired flat.

loans.name: Luis Estalin

texts.es: Luis tiene 26 años está casado, tiene un hijo de tres años Joel que la mayoría de tiempo permanece bajo su cuidado,  comenzó el negocio con muy pocos productos hace más de dos años su horario de trabajo todos los días empieza desde las  cinco de la mañana limpia y ordena los productos, se esmera en brindar la mejor atención a los clientes hasta las diez de la noche. Luis necesita el dinero para surtir la tienda así satisfacer a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas el aspira tener una casa propia para poder ofrecerle a su familia..
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old, married, with a three year old son called Joel. Luis is responsible for looking after Joel the majority of the time. 

Luis started his business two years ago with very few products. He works all day every day, starting at five in the morning, cleaning and doing product orders. Luis strives to provide the best service possible to his customers, closing at 10 o'clock at night. Luis is seeking a loan to stock his store and ensure he has what his customers are looking for, and thus increase his sales. 

Luis's dream is to have his own home for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his store.

loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en: It was hard for Rashidan to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband (who is also shown in the photo). Rashidan is a 35-year-old woman. She is a mother of three children.  Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community.  Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.  Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.  Rashidan has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 47 years old, a married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring to earn income for her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yasmeen has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time. She wants to get a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on providing quality living conditions for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors so that she can stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice est une femme âgée de 31 ans qui vit à Agoè. Mère de trois enfants, Béatrice est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires qu’elle revend à domicile dans sa boutique et en parcourant les quartiers. Béatrice s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois  au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de spaghettis et de sardines.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Béatrice compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Béatrice, age 31, is a mother of three who lives in Agoè. She sells food products from her home store and in nearby districts. She stocks up five times per month at the market.

Béatrice is seeking this loan to buy cartons of spaghetti and sardines. She will use her profits to improve her sales, to help her family thrive and to ensure that her children get a good education.

loans.use: to purchase two cartons of spaghetti and two cartons of sardines.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram with his wife and elder son lives in Varser village in the Gegharkunik region. His youngest son is in the army now, fulfilling his military service.

Aram works at a gas station and also does farming. On his farm, his wife greatly helps him. Aram has cows, calves, heifers, piglets and sheep. His farm products for sale are milk, meat, macun (national dairy-products), cheese and butter.

Aram also has a vegetable garden growing potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbages and greens.

The entire farm output is sold at the city’s wholesale market during the week. Now, with this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams, Aram wants to buy a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
This lady is 22 years old and her name is Meri. She lives with her beloved husband and sweet daughter in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Meri has a vocational education and she has a specialty as an accountant. Meri has been busy with her child and family and has not had a chance to work in her profession.

Since she was unemployed, she started farming with her husband. On her farm she has cows, calves, lambs, sheep, and chickens. She mentions that she still lacks experience, but she already has regular customers for her farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy product), meat, and eggs. Meri hopes that her farm will become more productive, earning more income for her family.

With her first Kiva loan Meri would like to buy a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle. With the change of seasons, farmers are thinking about feeding their cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 51 years old, married and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales.

Shamim has been in business for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business;

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profit to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

Shamim aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profit to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz , who is 30 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store.

She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Shehnaz needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand.

She has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, and juices to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, and  juices.

loans.name: Deyner Fernando

texts.es:
Deyner Es un señor de 37 años, vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, zona perteneciente a la región costa del país, un lugar muy comercial y de mucha producción para exportación.
Deyner tanto como su esposa trabajan para mantener a su hogar, él actualmente tiene poco tiempo con la venta de queso y gallinas en mercados y ferias de la ciudad, mientras ella trabaja como cocinera en un restaurante. Su pequeño hijo está estudiando y en las tardes pasa al cuidado de su padre y de su abuelita.
El negocio de Deyner se trata de ir a fincas de Manabí donde adquiere el producto como queso de finca y gallinas criollas, luego viaja a Santo Domingo donde distribuye en los mercados ya clientes fijos, comenta que no ha sido fácil pero hasta ahora le ha ido bien, por ello con este crédito podrá fortalecer el negocio, además abrirá una nueva ruta para la sierra.
Está muy feliz porque Kiva y Fundación Alternativa ayudan a los microempresarios a seguir creciendo con sus negocios, con estos ingresos espera seguir fortaleciendo sus ganancias para que en un futuro su esposa se dedique únicamente a su pequeño y puedan pasar más tiempo juntos.
texts.en:
Deyner, aged 37, lives with his wife and young son in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, in a coastal region which is very commercial and features high export productivity.

Deyner and his wife both work to pay the household expenses, and he has very little time as he sells cheese and chickens in markets and fairs throughout the city, while his wife works as a cook in a restaurant. His young son goes to school, and is looked after in the evenings by his father and his grandmother.

Deyner's business involves visiting the farms of Manabí province to purchase products such as cheese and Creole chickens, and then traveling to Santo Domingo to sell them to markets and to regular clients. He says that it hasn't been easy, but so far things have gone well, and he will use this loan to strengthen his business and establish a new route in the mountains.

He is very happy that Kiva and Fundación Alternativa help owners of micro-enterprises grow their businesses. With this loan, he hopes to increase his earnings so that in the future his wife can dedicate herself solely to her child and they can spend more time together.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and cheese in order to increase his earnings so that his wife can stay home with their child.

loans.name: Azamatbek

texts.ru: Азаматбек, 32 года, он женат, многодетный отец 3 детей. У него высшее образование, очень ответственен, честен, трудолюбив, работает диспетчером в Районной электронной станции. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, он на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Азаматбека, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 36 овец. Также Азаматбек на земельной доле мерою 2,0 Га занимается полеводством, выращивая арбузы, дыни, капусту, помидоры. В этом году случилось непредвиденное - выпавший весной снег, разрушил заготовленную рассаду, Азаматбек вложил накопленные средства в приобретение новой рассады, однако летом на урожай напали черви, еще не созревшая продукция пострадала и сгнила на поле. Азаматбек понес убытки в размере около 300,000 сом (KGS). Азаматбек узнал о возможности получить льготный кредит "Форс Мажор" в Банке "Бай-Тушум", обратился за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на восстановление земли, закупив ядохимикаты для обработки, часть средств будет направлена на сбор пострадавшего урожая с полей и посев лука. Доходы от восстановленного бизнеса Азаматбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Azamatbek is 32 years old, married, and is father to a large family of 3 children. He has higher education and is very responsible, honest, hardworking, and works as a dispatcher in the district's electronic station. As a source of supplementary income for his family, he has been engaged in animal husbandry and agriculture for 15 years. Thanks to Azamatbek's persistent hard work, on the farm today there are six cows and 36 sheep. Azamatbek also grows crops on a land share of 2.0 hectares, cultivating watermelons, melons, cabbage, and tomatoes. 

This year, the unpredictable happened: snow fell in spring, and destroyed the prepared seedlings. Azamatbek put his savings into obtaining new seedlings; however in the summer his crops were attacked by worms, and the still unripened crops were affected, and rotted in the field. Azamatbek suffered damages of around 300,000 som (KGS). 

Azamatbek found out about the possibility of receiving a favourable loan called 'force majeure' in Bai-Tushum Bank, and has applied for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) in order to restore his land. After buying chemical pest killers for working the land with, part of the funds will be directed into collecting the affected cross from the field, and planting onions. Azamatbek plans to invest the funds from his renewed business in the further development of his business.

loans.use: to restore his business by purchasing pesticide to save the land from worms, harvest his land, as well as to cultivate onions.

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Шамигул проживает на районе Руми. Ей 27 лет. Она живет вместе с мужем и двумя детьми. Шамигул около 8 лет занимается растениеводством. Она любит свою работу и выкладывает душу в своей работе. Шамигул выполняет свои обязанности качественно и каждый раз с нетерпением ждет сбора. В этом году Шамигул решила посадить картошку, лука и морковь. Для приобретения семян овощей, она просит ее поддержать. Тогда она посеет урожай, с нетерпением будет ждать сбора, и вспоминать Вашу оказанную поддержку.
texts.en:
Shamigul lives in the Rumi district. She is 27 years old. She lives with her husband and two children. Shamigul has been growing plants for about eight years. She loves her work and puts her heart and soul into it. Shamigul fulfils her duties efficiently, and every time waits patiently for the harvest. 

This year, Shamigul has decided to plant potatoes, onions, and carrots. She is requesting to be supported so that she can purchase vegetable seeds. Then she will plant the crops, and will eagerly wait for the harvest, and think of your given support.

loans.use: to buy potato, onion, and carrot seeds.

loans.name: Las Primaveras Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
Una de las particularidades del estado de Veracruz es su música, el son jarocho es por antonomasia el sonido de la región. No obstante, existen variantes en este estilo ya que el son del sur suele tener un ritmo más contrastante pero al mismo tiempo más lento mientras que el son de la zona central tiene un ritmo definido y rápido. En una de las comunidades de dicho estado se integró un grupo llamado Las Primaveras ya que para las integrantes esta estación representa alegría y color.
   El grupo está conformado por: Nohemí quien vende comida y cocteles; Yolanda, lencería y cosméticos; María, perfumes; Rubí, artículos de plata; Perla A., bisutería y zapatos; Perla B., comida y cría de ganado; Ana, zapatos; Ventura, lencería; Zuleyma, bisutería; Eulalia, comida típica e Isidora, comida y servicio de internet.
   Perla B. es una mujer mayor que se mantiene fuerte y llena de objetivos, se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora, noble y sobre todo por tener un carácter pintoresco. Para a ella el motor principal siempre ha sido su familia, tanto a sus hijos como a sus nietos les ha inculcado el valor del trabajo desde pequeños. Se dedica a la cría de ganado, tarea que considera una actividad familiar ya que desde niña ayudaba a sus padres con el cuidado de los animales. De igual modo, aprendió de su abuela a tratar ciertos malestares de forma alternativa por lo que muchos clientes la consultan para ayudarlos; adicionalmente  vende comida típica los fines de semana. “Si no trabajas no tienes ingresos y no tienes la satisfacción de ser económicamente independiente” expresa alegremente.
   Las ganancias obtenidas durante todo este tiempo le han permitido apoyar  con los gastos del hogar, cubrir la educación de sus hijas, realizar remodelaciones a su casa y ampliar el corral para sus animales. En esta ocasión invertiría el préstamo en la compra de platos desechables, servilletas, cucharas, bolsas, gas, remodelará los corrales e invertirá en alimento para gallinas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio donde cada fin de semana son preparados los alimentos que vende doña Perla B. quien viste blusa color azul y falda morada.
texts.en:
One of the characteristics of the state of Veracruz is its music, "Son Jarocho," because of the excellence of the sound of the region. Nevertheless, variants of this style exist which are "Son del Sur," which tends to have a more contrasting rhythm but, at the same time, is slower. Meanwhile, the sound of the central zone has a defined and rapid rhythm. In one of the communities of said state, a group formed called "Las Primaveras" [The Springs] because this season represents happiness and color for the members.

The group is made up of: Nohemí, who sells food and cocktails, Yolanda, lingerie and cosmetics, María, perfumes, Rubí, silver items, Perla A., costume jewelry and shoes, Perla B., food and cattle raising, Ana, shoes, Ventura, lingerie, Zuleyma, costume jewelry, Eulalia, typical food and Isidora, food and internet service.

Perla B. is an older woman who keeps herself strong and full of goals. She is characterized by being very hardworking, noble and above all for having a picturesque character. For her, the main driver has always been her family, as well as her children and her grandchildren in whom she has instilled the value of work since they were young. She works raising cattle, a job she considers a family activity since she was a girl, she helped her parents caring for the animals. Similarly, she learned from her grandmother to treat certain ailments in an alternative manner, therefore many clients consult her for her to help them. Additionally, she sells typical food on the weekends. "If you don't work, you don't have income and you don't have the satisfaction of being economically independent," she expresses happily.

The income obtained during all of this time has permitted her to support with the expenses of the home, cover the education of her children, carry out renovations to her house and enlarge the pens for her animals. On this occasion, she will invest the loan in the purchase of disposable plates, napkins, spoons, bags, gas, to make the pens and to invest in feed for her hens and the growth of her pigs.

*The photograph was taken on the patio where, each weekend, the foods are prepared that Perla B. sells; she is dressed in a blue blouse and purple skirt.

loans.use: to buy disposable plates, napkins, spoons, bags, gas, to make the pens and to invest in feed for her hens and the growth of her pigs.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a barber shop and a beauty salon. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be small business space. 

He will use the 1200 AZN loan to buy shaving machine and beauty products for the salon. His business goal is to have more business outlets within 6 years. This is his second loan with Agroinvest. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy shaving machine and beauty products for the salon

loans.name: Ma. Belen

texts.en:
Ma. Belen is 62 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk can goods, etc.

Ma. Belen has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future Ma. Belen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk can goods, etc

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana is 46 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ana has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business.

Ana has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Ana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Marie Ann

texts.en:
Marie Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a selling purchase order cards business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers for her selling purchase order cards business.

Marie Ann has been in this business for 5 years. Marie Ann earns more income from selling purified drinking water.

Marie Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 38 years old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is Balqees’ husband who is a wholesaler by profession. He purchases different types of goods from the market and then sells them to various people of his community. He has been doing this business for many years to meet the family expenses.

In order to increase sales; Balqees has applied for a loan of 40000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. With this, her husband would be able to purchase more items such as packs of biscuits, grains, juices and sweets. Balqees is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as packs of biscuits, grains, juices and sweets

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 47 years old, a married woman, and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle.

This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Shamim gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new tires for and pay for maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Roula

texts.en:
Roula is a 23-year-old married Syrian citizen. She is the mother of one child who works hard since 2003, in running her small grocery store, to support her husband who works as a concierge in covering their small family's living needs.
She is well known in her region, and works hard to develop her business as much as she can, but her small capital forbids her from expanding her working sector.
Today, Roula is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special winter cereals and requested hot drinks with encouraging prices.
She hopes that one day she can turn her small grocery store to a wide super market, and improve her family's living.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special winter cereals and requested hot drinks with encouraging prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spraying chemicals to spray his tomatoes and mango trees.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 45 years old. She is single and a mother of five children. 

Her business is a green grocery shop. She has been in the business for 14 years. 

She earns a monthly income of forty four thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, bananas and cabbages for sale.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, bananas and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita’s sacrifices such as back pains, blurring eyes, exhaustion and hunger due to ten years of tailoring all pay off when she sees her family happy and united despite the lack of financial resources and luxury in life. She’s a loving wife to her retired husband, Restituto and a caring mother to her children. She’s able to fulfill her responsibilities to her family with the aid of her tailoring business. Now her children are already grown up, but she still feels responsible for the continuous support to her grandchildren.

This is why she keeps on and aspires to further improve her business. She wants to avail herself of PhP 10,000 loan to buy more cloth, threads, buttons, and other accessories in order to produce more clothes. This will continuously benefit her and her family.

She prays for good health, long life and spiritual growth with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more cloths, threads, buttons, and other accessories for her tailoring business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fe is 63 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Fe has a buy and sell sand and gravel business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional tons of sand and gravel to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Fe has been in this business for 20 years. Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional tons of sand and gravel to sell to her customers

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 40 years old, married and has five children, four of whom in school.

She is in the agricultural business poultry in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

Edna has been poultry for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny works hard to support her family. Jenny is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc.

Jenny has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Jenny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir is 43 years old and married. He has two kids. Zakir is IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives in the Bilesuvar region. He has been working in this job for 10 years. Zakir has experience. Also, he is a hardworking and steady person. 

Zakir is a tea maker. He needs a 1,200 AZN loan to buy some materials (sugar, new glasses, tea, etc.) and expand his business. So, Zakir wants help from Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to buy some materials (sugar, new glasses, tea, etc) and expand his business

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa, who is in her late-30s, is single with three children. Two of them are in school, and the other one is still small. She has been a food vendor for six years now. She works from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Sharifa's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase her mamalishe stock. She dreams of expanding her business to an international level.

Sharifa will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan's scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase her mamalishe stock.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce, who is in his mid-40s, is married with five children. Two of them are still in school, and three of them are grown up. He has been running a grocery business for five years now. He works from 2 p.m. to 12 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Alphonce's sixth loan form Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his drinks stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments, build his own house and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy the fast moving drinks in his grocery store. He dreams of educating his children to university level.

Alphonce will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving drinks in his grocery store.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is married and works hard to support her family. She has a  pig-raising business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Merlita has been in this business for seven years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Merlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This woman’s name is Helen and she is 54 years old. She is now married and she lives with her retired mother in Kapan, a city in the Syunik region.

Helen graduated from the Theoretical department of the Faculty of Piano at Yerevan State Conservatory. She is a pianist, and from 1983 till today, she works at the city musical college as a teacher of piano. She also gives paid courses of piano playing at her house for the pupils who are getting prepared for the Conservatory entrance exams.

Helen mentions that her piano is a very precious musical instrument to her, and she must always keep it in good working order, both for her courses and for playing it often and enjoying the music.

Now Helen asks for this loan of 200,000 AMD (Armenian drams) in order to have her piano tuned and she also wants to buy some comfortable furniture for the room where she is teaching her piano courses.

loans.use: to have her piano tuned and to buy some comfortable furniture for the room where she is teaching her piano courses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: pants, skirts, blouses, t-shirts, clothes, blankets among others to improve her business.

loans.name: Danielle

texts.en:
Danielle is married to her husband who is a disabled veteran.  She is also a mother of 5 children. She owns a business that is devoted to renting out inflatables for kids’ parties. Owning her own business has been her dream for at least 2 years. She is happy to have been able to finally start her business. 

Danielle currently runs her business on her own with the help of her husband. Her largest difficulty as a business owner has been the inability to get enough funding to get her business started. Danielle is seeking a loan that will allow her to purchase necessary equipment for a required 3 day training in her home.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment for a required three day training

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 34 years old. He is married, and has three children.

His business is farming. He has been in the business for two years.

He earns a monthly income of two thousand Kenyan shillings. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase chemicals to spray his crops.

He will use the profits from expanded business to improve standard of living of his family.

His hope and dream is to have a pick-up truck to transport his crops to the market conveniently.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals to spray his crops.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Forty-nine years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for her family. For 19 years now, she has run a general store in the Philippines.

Josephine has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, coffee, sugar, etc. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maria Wilma

texts.en:
Maria Wilma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Wilma is 27 years old, and her two children are in school.

Maria Wilma has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Maria Wilma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell. Maria Wilma has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Maria Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca works hard to support her family. Francisca is married and sells nipa roofing in the Philippines to earn a living. Francisca has been in this business for 20 years now.

Francisca is requesting a loan in the amount of 27,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more nipa roofing material to sell. Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is married and works hard to support her family. She has been selling rice in the Philippines for five years now.

Rosalie has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 43 years old. She is married and a mother of six children.

Her business is selling vegetables. She has been in the business for four years. She earns a monthly income of 13,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, onions, cabbages and kale for sale.

Juliana will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family and have all her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, onions, cabbages and kale for sale.

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en:
Gyulnara has been selling various products from her house for seven years. The products she brings from a neighbouring country have enabled her to build a good client base over the years.

Gyulnara is requesting this loan to purchase a new stock of products (food oil, home supplies, clothing) to cover customers' current orders. Demand is currently high, so she doesn't want to lose a chance to earn more income for basic living costs.

Gyulnara has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of products (food oil, home supplies, clothing) to cover customers' current orders.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 46 years old. He is married and has two children.

His business is livestock-keeping and farming. He has been in the business for 15 years.

He earns a monthly income of 35,000 Kenya shillings. This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and animal feed.

Benjamin will use the profits from his expanded business to grow the business further by buying more farm inputs.

His hopes and dreams are to uplift his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. Her business is a retail green grocery shop. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase stock of sugar, maize and wheat flour, salt, rice, cooking fat, etc. for the shop.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children and provide food for the family.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, maize and wheat flour, salt, rice, cooking fat, etc. for the shop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old. She is married and a mother of eight children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for thirteen years. She earns a monthly income of 18,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase spraying chemicals for the crops.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to purchase spraying chemicals for the crops.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 33 years old. She is married, and a mother of four children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for eight years. She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase beans to diversify her products for sale. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hope and dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase beans to diversify her products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seedlings and organic manure.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 28 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Michelle has requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF in order to purchase additional ingredients like meat, cooking oil, sugar, milk, etc.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Michelle has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Michelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, cooking oil, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives with her big family in rural Lyantonde in the western region. Married to a cattle trader, she is a mother of five.

On her farm Grace has cows, calves, bulls, sheep and chickens, and she sells her farm milk, meat, ghee and eggs to her neighbors and regular customers. The farm is also a source of fresh, tasty products for her children and the entire family.

For several years Grace sold butter, but she is getting older and no longer has the strength it takes to process it. With this loan of ugx2,000,000 she will buy baby calves that she will fatten and later sell at a profit.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Famille Bafuruma Group

texts.fr: Les résultats atteints pour le précédent crédit ont permis à Gilbert de répondre uniquement aux exigences scolaires de ses enfants surtout pour celui en phase terminal de cycle des humanités. Le crédit actuel lui permettra d'assurer la propreté de son champ et surtout d'éviter de vendre son café à bas prix avant maturité.
texts.en: The results achieved from the previous loan have enabled Gilbert to respond uniquely to the educational requirements of his children, especially for the one in his senior year in the humanities. The current loan will enable Gilbert to ensure his farm field is appropriately prepared and to avoid in particular the selling of his coffee before maturity.

loans.use: to maintain a field of coffee plants

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena, who is in her early 30's, is married with five children who are still in school. She has been running two projects, selling vegetables and water for ten years now. She works from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Zena's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her genge business, when she started selling water, and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.

She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is doing great. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments, bought a plot of land, reinvested in her business and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy the fast moving items in her genge and to increase on the water stock. She dreams of expanding her business.

Zena will make sure she pays back her loan within the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in her genge and to increase on the water stock.

loans.name: Zaitoon

texts.en:
Zaitoon is a fifty-one-year-old married woman living along with her spouse and children in an underptrviledged area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son runs a store in which he has sold shoulder bags for many years. Nowadays, the household expenses and the children's basic requirements have increased, and he needs to generate more income.

He wants to buy more stock of bags, so that he can increase his turnover, and cope with the household expenses. He wants to educate his sibling, and he wants to provide medical care to his sibling, but it seems very difficult in the absence a larger source of income. Zaitoon has requested a Kiva loan for her son's shoulder bag business so that he can increase his turnover, and can care for his sibling and old parents as well.

Zaitoon thanks Kiva and its field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy shoulder bags in large quantities for her son, so that he can increase his turnover and help his cherished sibling.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine and her husband run their small cafe in the center of Kapan town. Karine herself bakes food for the visitors and they work hard to satisfy customers.

To be able to purchase a grill making machine and refrigerator for the cafe, Karine has now applied for this loan. She is saying that enlarging the variety of dishes in their cafe will make it more profitable.

Karine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Karine and her husband hope for lenders' support to their small but sustainable business.

loans.use: to pay for a grill making machine and refrigerator for the cafe.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 38 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She works in farming and has been in this business for 14 years.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She hopes this will enable her to grow more produce to sell and support her family.

She will use the generated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her farm, generate more income, and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm.

loans.name: Husik

texts.en:
In the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region lives Husik alone, since his single son now is away for an abroad works in Russian Federation. Many years Husik used to works a mechanic, but now his only occupation is farming and agriculture. 

As he likes to say, being unemployed and living alone without harrying little by little he manages his farm work and land cultivation. In his farm, he has bulls, pigs and chickens. On his plot of land, he cultivates potato, tomato and cucumber. All his farm products (meat, eggs and vegetables) Husik takes to the city’s wholesale market and sells there during the week. 

Husik now asks for this loan of 500.000 AMD as his farm's cattle have lack of fodder, and he wants to buy fodder for all of it.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm's cattle

loans.name: Dimonti Group

texts.fr: Les revenus issus de son précédent crédit ont permis à Samuel de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et leur alimentation. Il a pu se constituer une petite épargne et engager quelques travaux de finissage de sa maison. Avec l'actuel crédit sollicité, il aspire continuer dans cet élan dans l'entretien de son champ.
texts.en: Thanks to the money provided by his previous loan, Samuel was able to feed his children and pay their school fees. He was able to set up a small savings account and take on several house finishing jobs. With this current requested loan, he hopes to continue this momentum and maintain his field.

loans.use: to maintain their field.

loans.name: Famille Bambaga Group

texts.fr: Stany souhaite prendre un deuxième crédit car le premier lui a été très utile quant aux travaux qu'il a entrepris dans son champ. Il a pu enfin de compte payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants, assurer leur alimentation, se constituer une petite épargne et acheter un filet de pêche. Stany est le représentant du groupe BAMBAGA; il est accompagné de son épouse Béatrice sur la photo.
texts.en:
Stany wishes to contract a second loan because the first one help him a lot with the work he has initiated in his field.

He can finally pay his children's school fees, guarantee them food, set aside small savings, and purchase a fishing net. Stany is the group's representative and he is pictured with his wife Beatrice.

loans.use: take care of the coffee field.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a 37-year-old single mother with three children. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She raises pigs and sells them in the community or at the market, and has been doing this for one year.

Jenny requested a loan to buy piglets, pig feeds and also timber to build a fence for her piggery business. She plans to use her profit to help cover her family's weekly expenses.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buys piglets, pig feeds and also timber to build a fence for her piggery business.

loans.name: Las 4 Cotorras Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
Durante el recorrido para poder llegar a una comunidad del estado de Veracruz se puede apreciar sembradíos repletos de caña de azúcar, maíz, frijol o sorgo; de igual manera, se observa pastar al ganado dentro de los amplios campos verdes. Una vez llegada a la comunidad se puede disfrutar del aire fresco y puro, del cantar de las aves, y los hermosos atardeceres en el horizonte.
   Las 4 Cotorras es el nombre que adquirió un grupo dedicado al mejoramiento de sus actividades. Los integrantes son: Julio y Tomas quienes se dedican a la cría de cerdos; Rosalba y Margarita, abarrotes; Antonia, Diana y Ceferina, comida; Bernardina, queso; María L. y Claudia, refresco; María P. S., cría de cerdos y venta de calzado; María P. y Juana, cosméticos y Yuleni, recipientes plásticos.
   Doña Ceferina es una persona muy alegre, empática y responsable, en el pueblo todos le llaman Cefe  de cariño. Tiene una familia muy unida integrada por su esposo Juan y sus tres hijas de las cuales una continua con sus estudios. Junto con su esposo se dedica a la venta de leche, él se encarga de alimentar y ordeñar a las vacas y ella de ofrecerla entre los clientes. Por otro lado, el gusto y la pasión por la cocina la motivaron para iniciar con la venta de comida típica desde hace tres años; su especialidad son los tradicionales tamales. 
   “Me gusta vender, obtener mi propio dinero, ayudar a mi esposo y juntos compartir la felicidad familiar” expreso con una gran sonrisa Cefe quien también se dedica a la cría de cerdos con el objetivo de enriquecer sus ingresos. 
   Este es su primer préstamo solicitado a Visión F México y lo invertirá en la compra de manteca, chiles, carne, aceite, crema, queso, verdura y refrescos para seguir complaciendo a sus comensales. Las ganancias le sirven para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar,  la educación de su hija, remodelar su casa y construir un nuevo cuarto.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de doña Cefe quien viste blusa floreada color café y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
REVISED
During the tour to reach a community in the State of Veracruz, one can appreciate fields full of sugarcane, maize, beans or sorghum. One also observes pasture for the cattle in the same green countryside. Upon arriving at the community, one can enjoy the fresh, pure air, the song of birds, and the beautiful afternoon dusk on the horizon. 

Las 4 Cotorras (Parrots) is the name taken by a group dedicated to the improvement of their activities. The group members are: Julio and Tomas who raise pigs; Rosalba and Margarita, groceries; Antonia, Diana and Ceferina, food; Bernardina, cheese; Maria L. and Claudia, soft drinks; Maria P.S., raises pigs and sells shoes; Maria P. and Juana, cosmetics; and Yuleni, plastic containers. 

Ms. Ceferina is a very happy, empathetic, and responsible person. In the town, everyone calls her caring Cefe. She has a close family made up of her husband, Juan, and their three daughters. One of them is continuing her studies. Together with her husband she devotes herself to the sale of milk. He is in charge of feeding and caring for the cows and she sells milk to the clients. On another side, her taste and passion for cooking motivated her to begin to sell typical foods three years ago. Her specialty is traditional tamales. "I like to sell, to get my own money, to help my husband, and together, to share family happiness" she says with a big smile. Cefe also devotes herself to raising pigs with the objective of enriching her earnings. 

This is her first loan request to Vision F Mexico. She will invest it in the purchase of lard, chiles, meat, cooking oil, cream, cheese, vegetables and soft drinks to continue to please her customers. The earnings will help her support her husband with the household expenses, the education of her daughter, remodeling her house and building a new room. 

*The photograph was taken on the patio of Ms. Cefe who is seen in the brown, flowered blouse and black pants.

loans.use: To purchase lard, chiles, meat, cooking oil, cream, cheese, vegetables and soft drinks.

location.town: Localidad San Jose Del Cacao, Tierra Blanca Veracr

loans.name: Ujasiliamali Group

texts.en:
TATU, who is in her mid 30s, is single with two children who are still in school. She has been running two projects, making and selling bites and selling soft drinks. She works from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be TATU's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to make and sell more bites and to increase on the soft drinks stock. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Tatu will share this loan with her loan group, Ujasiliamali, which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to make and sell more  bites and to increase on  the soft drinks stock.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is originally from a small town in North Carolina. He grew up on a farm and moved to Cedar Rapids to start his business about a year ago. James is a painting contractor who does exterior. interior, residential, and commercial painting. He also provides repair and gutter cleaning services.

James started painting as a teenager when he worked for his high school. Since then he has continued painting. He has always enjoyed it and has been very good at it. Although James suffers from a bleeding disorder, he has managed to successfully run his business on a part-time schedule.

Currently James is seeking a loan to access working capital and purchase equipment such as a paint sprayer. He would also like to invest in advertising for his company. His vision for the future is to subcontract larger jobs and continue to grow his business.

loans.use: to pay for a paint sprayer, get access to working capital, and invest in advertisement for his business.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna lives in Kapan town with her parents. She is a hairdresser with three years of working experience in a local beauty salon. She likes her profession as a hairdresser and works hard to satisfy her customers.

She asks for this loan to purchase cosmetic equipment for providing cosmetics services to her clients. Syuzanna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international.

The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. She hopes to receive lenders' support and develop her work as a cosmetologist.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetic equipment for providing cosmetics service to her clients

loans.name: Hrayr

texts.en:
Hrayr has been involved in providing marketing, designing, advertising and printing services for local companies and individuals in Kapan town.

Hrayr lives with his wife and two little kids. He works hard to provide high quality service to the customers who apply for his service, and over hardworking years was able to gain his reputation of a professional work provider.

Hrayr now asks for this loan to be able to purchase a laptop needed for providing marketing, advertising and printing services.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products

loans.use: to pay for a laptop needed for providing marketing, advertising and printing services.

loans.name: Elkin Enrique

texts.es: Elkin es un microempresario que reside en un sector del municipio de Soledad y desde joven trabajo con un tío que tenía un taller de marroquinería y calzado en donde aprendió este arte, sin embargo consideró que debía profesionalizarse e ingresó a una institución del estado, formación que le permitió realizar trabajos de mejor calidad y empezar con su propio negocio.  En el año 2011, inició su primera producción ofertándole a sus amigos, familiares y conocidos una amplia gama de productos de diferentes materiales; bolsos, canguros, morrales, chalecos para motociclistas y sandalias, hoy en día cuenta con un catálogo de productos que exhibe a sus clientes y le solicitan sus encargos, diariamente labora doce horas para sacar adelante su producción y en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en materias primas que le permitirán incrementar su producción. Su meta a futuro es tener un taller más grande y continuar apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elkin is a micro-entrepreneur who lives in a section of the municipality of Soledad and, since he was young, he has worked with an uncle who has a leather goods and footwear workshop where he learned this art. Regardless of this, he thought he should professionalize himself and enrolled in a state institution, a move that permitted him to produce work of better quality and to start his own business. In 2011, he started his initial production, offering his friends, family and acquaintances an ample array of products of different materials; bags, fanny packs, shoulder bags, vests for motorcyclists, and sandals.

Nowadays, he has a catalog of products that he shows to his customers and requests their orders. Every day, he works twelve hours in order to move his production along and right now he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing he has requested from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, in order to invest in raw materials which will allow him to increase his production.

His future goal is to have a bigger workshop and continue supporting his children.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Mrs. Irma is the mother of one child and lives in Dampit, Malang Regency on the island of Java, the main island of Indonesia.

In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water, and most people don't even have access to piped water. Unsurprisingly, most Indonesians boil the water before they drink it. Some people also buy water from refill stations, which is not always safe.  

At a community gathering, where the outreach team from Nazava was invited, Mrs. Irma learned about an easier and better way of getting safe drinking water. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Mrs. Irma, who fulfills a leading function in her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This is the second time Mrs. Irma has applied for a loan. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans.

This loan will allow Mrs. Irma to buy 10 filters and sell them on consignment to her community, making safe drinking water available to 50 people.

loans.use: to obtain 10 water purifiers to sell to her community members, providing them with safe drinking water

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna, 30, lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three daughters and is very hard working and honest. She has to do a lot of hard work to pay for her household expenses.

She has recently set up a small beauty parlor at home and her husband is working a small job in a firm. Both contribute their full income for household expenses. With the passage of time, her beauty products will soon be gone and she wants to buy more cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

Lubna has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use it to buy cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors and a comb for her salon.

She hopes that through this loan she will be able to enhance her businesses.

She is very thankful to the Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and instruments for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corrugated tin, windows and doors to install and offer security to her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corrugated metal, wood, nails, and wire to change the roof and avoid respiratory illnesses in his family.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos Group

texts.es:
El campo dorado que circunda el cuartel principal donde se ostenta el nombre de la ciudad que simboliza la bondad de su suelo cuyos productos agrícolas se convierten en la riqueza y bienestar de sus habitantes. El capacete (casco) y el caduceo (emblema) resaltan en la parte superior del escudo de esta ciudad veracruzana ya que representan la paz, el arte, el comercio y la ciencia. Por ello sus habitantes tienen como meta destacar en cada actividad que realizan.  
   Unidos Venceremos lleva por nombre un grupo formado en dicha comunidad, el nombre hace referencia al famoso dicho de: “la unión hace la fuerza”. Ellos son: Severiana y Norma quienes vende ropa, zapatos y colchas; Guadalupe, carne y cristales; Rosa, bisutería y comida; Miguel, ropa; Luis, abarrotes y miel; Concepción M., bisutería; Ernestina, comida; Nati, pescado; Leticia, abarrotes; Anahí, productos naturistas y Concepción S. comida.
   Doña Severiana es mejor conocida como doña Seve quien tiene 2 hijos, una niña de 8 años quien estudia la educación primaria y de un joven que trabaja de lunes a viernes y estudia los fines de semana. Ellos, sus hijos, son su mayor orgullo pues destacan en los estudios además de ayudar con los ingresos en su tiempo libre.
   Gracias a su primer préstamo otorgado por VF México pudo iniciar con su negocio al invertir en la compra de ornamentos utilizados en la  elaboración de coronas y arreglos con motivo de los fieles difuntos y la celebración de la Virgen de Juquila y la Virgen de Guadalupe. Las ganancias obtenidas la motivaron a comenzar con la venta de ropa para dama y posteriormente logró implementar la venta de cosméticos por cátalo y zapatos; “soy feliz con mis actividades pues si no trabajo no gano y así obtengo ingresos de tres diferentes actividades” comenta entusiasmada.
   El préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa variada que sus clientes le habían solicitado y en esta ocasión invertirá en la compra de pegamento, suelas, forros, pedrería, pantalones y blusas para aumentar su producción.
*La fotografía fue tomada en “la novia del sol”, doña Seve viste blusa color verde limón.
texts.en:
The golden field that surrounds the main area where the name of the city is displayed symbolizes the bounty of the soil, whose products are converted into wealth and well-being for its inhabitants. The helmet and staff that stand out on the upper part of the coat of arms of this city in Veracruz represent peace, art, commerce and science. This is why its inhabitants have a goal of distinguishing themselves in all activities that they carry out.

Unidos Venceremos is the name of a group formed in this community, a name that makes reference to the famous saying "Unity makes strength". They are: Severiana and Norma, who sell clothing, shoes and bedspreads; Guadalupe, meat and crystal; Rosa, jewelry and food; Miguel, clothing; Luis, groceries and honey; Concepcion M., jewelry; Ernestina, food; Nati, fish; Leticia, groceries; Anahi, naturopathic products; and Concepcion S., food.

Severiana, who is better known as Seve, has 2 children. Her daughter is 8 years old and in primary school, and her son works from Monday from Friday and studies on the weekends. Her children are her greatest source of pride, because they excel in their studies as well as helping her earn income in their free time.

Thanks to her first loan granted by VF Mexico, she was able to start her business by buying ornaments used for making crowns and decorations to honor the faithful departed and the celebration of the Virgin of Juquila and the Virgin of Guadalupe. The money that she earned motivated her to start selling women's clothing and then start selling cosmetics and shoes from a catalogue. "I am happy with my work because if I don't work I don't earn money, and this way I earn income from three different activities", she says with enthusiasm.

Her last loan was used to buy a variety of clothing that her customers had requested, and this one will be used to buy glue, soles, linings, jewelry, pants and blouses, to increase her production.

The photograph was taken in "la novia del sol". Seve is wearing a lime green blouse.

loans.use: to buy glue, soles, linings, precious stones, pants and blouses.

loans.name: Anashe Group

texts.en:
Nanja is a 43-year-old woman who has been blessed with 4 children and is married. Her husband is a self-employed carpenter. Before she became a cross border trader, Nanja sold second hand clothes that she bought from cross border traders who would have imported them in ‘bales’ from Mozambique.

This trade was thriving, but it was at the expense of the formal clothing industry, so the government has put more stringent conditions on the sale of second hand clothing. This has made it difficult for many traders to stay in business.

Nanja has since ventured into cross border trading herself and she is doing well. She travels to South Africa monthly to buy gas stoves, solar panels and other household appliances. She tries to curb the risk of marketing myopia by procuring strictly on order, so she is assured that everything she imports is sold.

However, her main challenge is liquidity since she mostly sells on credit. Nanja is part of the Anashe group, and her group mates also run various small businesses. Nanja and her friends need a loan to boost their working capital.

Nanja will use the loan to procure household appliances in a manner that will keep her flow of revenue uniform and guaranteed. The group needs a $1,600 loan from KIVA.

loans.use: To buy household appliances, gas stoves and solar panels for her customers.

loans.name: Avatar Group

texts.es:
En cierta comunidad de Oaxaca hay tradiciones que han perdurado durante cientos de años, por ejemplo, durante los días de la Semana Santa un grupo de hombres se disfrazan con vestuarios vistosos, máscaras de payaso, fantasmas, monstruos, entre otras, asimismo usan bastones forrados y adornados con papel. Sin embargo, los personajes más importantes y de mayor jerarquía son los “demonios” quienes portan vestimenta roja o negra, usan máscaras con grandes cuernos y en lugar de bastones usan cuerdas largas y gruesas, conocidas como “chicotes”.
   En uno de los barrios de la población se formó un grupo llamado Avatar el cual está integrado por: María quien vende tortillas y bordados artesanales; Celerina, abarrotes; Nohemí y Xochitl, comida típica; Angélica, ropa y zapatos; Aurora, comida y ropa; Leidy, piezas de cerámica; Janet, ropa, calzado y cosméticos; Sonia, ropa; Martha, tortillas y Gloria, cosméticos y costuras.
   Doña Celerina es conocida como la abuela Cele o Doña Cele debido al respeto y cariño que le tienen sus conocidos. Es madre de 10 hijos quienes se han encargado de hacer crecer la familia, lo que le resulta sumamente satisfactorio. 
   La necesidad de brindar lo mejor a sus hijos la motivó para iniciar con una tienda de abarrotes dentro de su comunidad. En un inicio colocó sobre troncos un par de tablas y encima de éstas dispuso la mercancía que era muy poca en ese momento. “Pedí mucho para que mi tienda creciera y prometí que construiría una pequeña capilla para agradecer las bendiciones” comenta contenta.  Tiempo después su negocio consiguió llenarse de clientes y ahora no sólo logró instalar anaqueles en donde exhibir los productos sino que pudo ampliar el espacio dentro de dos cuartos a lado de su hogar.
   El buen trato al cliente y los precios accesibles que brinda a sus clientes han sido la clave de su éxito. Sus ganancias cubren perfectamente los gastos de su hogar y cubren también el cuidado de una hija enferma. Con el préstamo podrá invertir en huevos, aceite, sopa, detergente  y queso continuando con el amplio surtido que satisface a sus clientes.
*Ellas son las integrantes de Avatar, la fotografía fue tomada en el patio de doña María, doña Cele viste una bata color rosa con flores bordadas.
texts.en:
In a certain community of Oaxaca, there are traditions that have lasted hundreds of years; for example, during the days of Holy Week, a group of men disguise themselves in colorful, bright clothing, clown masks, as ghosts and monsters among others. At the same time, they use canes lined and adorned with paper. Nevertheless, the most important characters, those highest on the hierarchy, are the demons, who wear red and black clothing, masks with big horns, and in place of canes, use long, thick cords, known as "chicotes". 
  
 In one of the neighborhoods, group called Avatar was formed.
