It is made up of: Maria who sells tortillas and embroidered crafts; Celerina, groceries; Nohemi and Xochitil, typical food; Angelica, clothing and shoes: Aurora, food and clothing; Leidy, ceramic works; Janet, clothing, shoes, and cosmetics; Sonia, clothing; Martha, tortillas, and Gloria, cosmetics and mends seams. 
  
 Ms. Celerina is known as grandmother Cele or Mrs. Cele owing the respect and kindness that those who know her feel for her. She is the mother of ten children who have taken responsibility for  the family's growth, which has been very satisfying. The need to offer the best to her children motivated her to start a grocery store in the community. 

 As a beginning, she placed a pair of boards on tree trunks and on top of those she displayed the little merchandise she had at the time. "I asked a lot in order for my store to grow and I promised that I would construct a small chapel to show my gratitude for the blessings" she notes happily. Some time later, her business was filled with customers and now she has succeeded not only to install shelves where she displays the products but also she was able to expand the space in the two rooms at the side of her home. Her good treatment of her customers and the reasonable prices that she offers her customers have been key to her success. 

Her earnings perfectly cover the costs of her household and also cover the care of her sick daughter. With the loan, she will be able to invest in eggs, cooking oil, soup, detergents, and cheese, continuing with the ample variety that satisfies her customers. 

*They are the members of Avatar. The photograph was taken on the patio of Ms. Maria. Ms. Cele wears a pink shift with a border of flowers.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, cooking oil, soup, detergent, and cheese.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Simfex Academy was opened in January 2011 by Felix and his wife. Felix is a physically disabled small income entrepreneur with a desire to also make a difference in children’s lives through education.

Simfex is located in the Foxdale area of Lusaka and caters to children and adults from the surrounding communities. Simfex offers regular daytime teaching for its children in lower school and it also offers afternoon for middle school to high school and evening classes for adult learners.

Felix strives to be a role model and sets out to show the children at Simfex and the community at large that with a positive attitude, ingenuity, perseverance and affirmative action one can achieve results far beyond those expected from persons with disabilities and others.

In their provision of education, Simfex strives for excellence in everything they do and offer including providing a clean, conducive and accommodating environment, and infrastructure and ensuring differentiation in their lessons to cater for all types of learners.

Felix would like to purchase ICT educational resources which will help the children and adult learners receive quality education using modern education technology in the form of the ZEduPad, a revolutionary e-learning educational tablet designed for children with preloaded content mapped to the Zambian Primary School curriculum. This educational tablet is now being used in schools throughout Zambia and many parts of Africa.

loans.use: to purchase ZEduPads which will help Felix bring the modern quality education to the children and adult learners in his school.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.fr: Lucia, âgée de 27 ans, vit en union libre et a 2 enfants. Cela fait 5 ans qu’elle commercialise des boissons gazeuses et alcoolisées sur une plage publique de la zone. Une activité qui lui permet de prendre soin de sa famille. Il s'agit du deuxième crédit dont bénéficie Lucia. Elle désire agrandir son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Elle demande un microcrédit afin d’augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Lucia is 27 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage and she has two children.  She has been selling sodas and alcoholic drinks on a nearby public beach for the past five years.  Thanks to this activity, she is able to take care of her family.  This is Lucia's second loan.  Lucia would like to expand her retail business and improve her living conditions.  She is taking a micro-loan in order to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: to buy crates of drinks.

loans.name: Siriporn

texts.en:
Siriporn is an artisan from Thailand who specializes in hand-knotted gemstone bracelets. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather cords and gemstones for her designs.

Siriporn has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I had a simple childhood but my dreams were wonderful. When I moved to Chiang Mai, I took the first step toward working with beads. In 2003, I associated with another friend to open a small shop. We sold necklaces, bracelets, earrings and other small decorations. Most of them were one-of-a-kind pieces. When they were sold, we would make a new design. My designs used a very wide range of materials – glass, stones, soil and gemstones. I couldn't take many orders because only the two of us crafted the designs, and we were afraid that we might not be able to deliver them on time. Sometimes, I'd take an entire week or two to finish a piece. I'd even forget to sleep!"

"My stock of raw materials is very low. The stones are always different from lot to lot, so when I purchase, I need to buy in large quantities. The problem is that this requires a large amount of capital. I would like to thank you for this micro credit, which helps me a lot."

Use the link below to view Siriporn's hand-knotted gemstone bracelets on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/8066

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of leather cords and gemstones for her designs

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es:
Jaqueline es una mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene  2 hijos de 1 y 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de lana.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en ferias de la ciudad.
Jaqueline es de tez trigueña, cabello negro y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran ene dad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos lo servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de lana, ella recorre largas distancias en el altiplano buscando a productores de lana, está la limpia he hilvana para comercializarla, “trabajo con todo tipo de lana, vendo lana de oveja que yo misma hilvano y también lana de empresas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que ya cuenta con rutas específicas para la venta y compra de lana, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de lana natural y procesada. Su sueño es comprar un lote de tierra para construir su casa, ella desea comprar lana de diferentes tipos para hilvanarla y venderla. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Jaqueline solicita un préstamo para comprar lana de diferentes tipos para hilvanarla y venderla.
texts.en:
Jaqueline, 33, is a woman who lives with her husband. She has two children, 1 and 5, and her business is the sale of wool.

She is a good mother, independent and very hard-working. She does her work itinerantly in the markets of the city.

Jaqueline is brown-skinned with black hair and of short stature. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband who works and her children who are not of school age yet.

They live in a rented house constructed of brick which has all the basic services.

Her business is selling wool. She covers long distances in the high country searching for wool producers. This she cleans it and spins it in order to sell it. "I work with all kinds of wool, I sell sheep's wool which I spin myself and also wool from the factories," she says. The advantage of her business is that she already has specific routes for the sale and purchase of wool. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy the natural and processed wool.

Her dream is to buy a plot of land on which to construct her house. She wants to buy wool of different types to spin and sell. This is the first sequence of loans from the institution in the three years she has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Jaqueline in requesting a loan to buy wool of different types to spin and sell.

loans.use: to buy wool of different types in order to spin it and sell it.

loans.name: Marie Pierre

texts.fr: Marie, âgée de 47 ans, est mère de trois enfants. Elle est divorcée et habite seule avec ses enfants dans la ville de Cabaret. Elle fait le commerce de vêtements devant sa maison, pour pouvoir gagner de quoi prendre soin de sa famille. A l’avenir, elle espère avoir suffisamment de revenus pour alimenter son compte d’épargne.
texts.en: Marie is 47 years old and the mother of three children.  She is divorced and she lives alone with her children in the city of Cabaret.  She sells women's clothes in front of her house, and this activity allows her to financially take care of her family.  In the future, she is hoping to make enough money to put some of her earnings into her savings account.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo existe una comunidad llamada Comuna Los Naranjos, en ella habita su etnia Tsáchila, todos ellos dedicados a la producción agrícola, son personas muy trabajadoras, siembran cacao, plátano, yuca, pimienta y además crían pollos y chanchos.
Ahí vive María junto a su esposo y tres hijos, todos ellos Tsáchilas, viven en casa propia;  juntos trabajan en su finca donde se dedican a la producción de cacao y plátano. Desde muy temprano ellos se dedican a limpiar sus tierras y a cosechar sus productos, además cuando no hay cosecha su esposo compra frutas en el  sector y viaja a la sierra a venderlas; ellos ven la manera de salir adelante y apoyar a sus hijos con la educación.
María es clienta nueva para la institución, con este crédito va a sembrar pimienta en un terreno que tiene preparado pero le hace falta capital para comprar las plantas, las estacas y los abonos; además va a comprar fertilizantes para mantener a su otra producción. Se siente muy agradecida con KIVA ya que aprovechará su terreno y en un par de años comenzará a ver la producción fruto de su esfuerzo. Con esto espera seguir apoyando a sus hijos como hasta ahora.
texts.en:
In the city of Santo Domingo there is a community called Comuna Los Naranjos (Commune of Orange Trees), where the ethnic Tsáchlia live. All of them devote themselves to agricultural production. They are hardworking people; they cultivate cocoa, bananas, yucca, pepper and raise chickens and pigs. Maria lives there with her husband and three children, who are all Tsáchilas. They live in their own house and work together on their farm where they produce cocoa and bananas. 

 From very early in the morning, they clean their lands and harvest their products. In addition, when there is no harvest, her husband buys fruits in the area and travels to the mountains to sell them. They see the means of moving forward and supporting their children with education.

 Maria is a new client at the institution. With this loan, she is going to plant pepper in a patch of land that she has prepared but for which she lacks capital to buy the plants, the stakes, and the fertilizer. In addition, she is going to buy fertilizer to maintain her other production. She is very grateful to KIVA as she will benefit from her land in a couple of years when she will begin to see the fruit of her her effort. With this, she hopes to continue supporting her children as she has up until now.

loans.use: To purchase plants, stakes, fertilizers, and to continue supporting her children with a good education.

loans.name: Alexandra Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Alexandra una señora de 31 años, habita en casa arrendada junto a su hijo, a quien le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para  sacarlo adelante ya que hace un año su esposo los abandonó.
Alexandra a pesar de las dificultades de no contar con ese apoyo fundamental ella ha visto la forma de  salir adelante, hace varios años cuenta con su propio negocio todos los días en el Mercado de Mariscos de la ciudad vende cd´s y pequeños juguetes, ya por la tarde se dirige a casa junto a su hijo.
Alexandra es clienta fiel de la institución, es una clienta muy responsable en sus pagos, ahora nuevamente necesita de dinero para capital de trabajo, con este crédito ella podrá fortalecer y comprar más mercadería para seguir con sus ventas, necesita surtir el negocio para dar mejor variedad a los clientes.
Está feliz por la ayuda brindada y agradece a KIVA y la Fundación porque además de dar créditos dan servicios de brigadas médicas que son un gran apoyo para los clientes.
texts.en:
Alexandra, a 31-year-old woman, lives in the city of Santo Domingo. She lives in a rented house together with her son, who works very hard to get ahead because her husband abandoned them a year earlier.

Alexandra, in spite of the difficulties of being unable to count on this fundamental support, has seen the way to get ahead. For several years she has had her own business every day in the Mercado de Mariscos ("Seafood Market") selling CDs and small toys. Now she walks home in the afternoon with her son.

Alexandra is a loyal client who is very responsible in her payments. She is now newly in need of money for work capital. With this loan, she will be able to reinforce and buy more merchendise to continue with her sales. She needs to stock the business to give her clients a better variety.

She is happy for the help provided and thanks KIVA and the Foundation because, more than giving loans, they provide the services of medical teams that are a great support to the clients.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and to stock the business and give her clients variety.

loans.name: Marie Sultane

texts.fr: Sultane a 46 ans. Elle vit seule et n’a pas d’enfants. Son activité pour générer des revenus, c’est une petite boutique où elle vend des produits alimentaires et quelques produits cosmétiques. Cette activité lui permet de gagner de quoi répondre à ses besoins et faire un peu d’épargne.
texts.en: Sultane is 46 years old. She lives alone and has no children. Her activity for generating income is a small shop, where she sells grocery items and a few cosmetic products. This business enables her to earn something to support herself and to save a bit of money.

loans.use: to purchase cases of butter and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase containers of chips and some grains.

loans.name: Sol Y Mar Group

texts.en:
The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that includes education and small loans, makes a positive impact on the lives of over 22,000 clients, their families and their communities mostly in rural Guatemala. The program creates a dependable cash flow and empowers the women. The vision of the organization is a world in which empowered women eliminate poverty. These clients are mostly in rural areas where the rate of poverty is the highest.

Olintepeque is a suburb of the bustling city of Quetzaltenango in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. Nine women anxiously want to invest money in their weaving and produce businesses. Elfa is the 21-year-old president of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Sol y Mar” (Sun and Sea). She is happy to be receiving a loan that she will invest in her produce business. She plans to use the money to buy a larger quantity and variety of produce seeds. With a larger yield from her crops, she will be able to generate more income that will help both her and her husband support their family.

The facilitator, through diagrams, photos, drawings and role-playing, helps the members of “Sol y Mar” learn about business administration, women’s health, women’s rights, family planning and medicinal plants. All the topics help the women become empowered and better small business entrepreneurs.

The women of “Sol y Mar” are extremely grateful to Kiva investors for having faith in them and in the development of their businesses. Thank you to all the Kiva investors from around the world!

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and variety of produce seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de d’un enfant, Abla est une femme âgée de 44 ans résidant à Tokoin. Abla est une revendeuse de fruits qui s’approvisionnent deux fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route et à domicile. Abla sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de bananes et des sacs d’oranges en vue de bien vendre afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en: A widow and a mother of one child, Abla is 44 years old and resides in Tokoin. She is a retailer of fruits, which are supplied to her twice a month from the market. She resells on the roadside and at her home. Abla is requesting this loan to order baskets of bananas and sacks of oranges with the aim of doing well in her sales, so as to help her children with their education and to cover the proven day-to-day expenses of the family.

loans.use: to purchase 6 baskets of bananas and 4 sacks of oranges.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Ameyo est une femme mariée avec trois enfants à charge. Ameyo est âgée de 44 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice  de la pâte bandée « kom » faite à base du maïs. Ameyo s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Ameyo sollicite ce crédit pour commander le sac de maïs et des tas de condiments en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de la famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Ameyo is a married woman and has three children to support. She is 44 years old and lives in Tokoin, where she operates her restaurant selling a sort of polenta called “kom” made from cornmeal. She gets the supplies necessary for making kom four times a month at the market. And she sells her product in front of her home.

Ameyo is requesting this loan to order a sack of corn and tubs of condiments with the aim of doing well in her sales, thus to earn more profit and help out her husband in meeting family needs, as well as to improve her children’s day-to-day living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of corn and 2 tubs of condiments.

loans.name: Maria Gladis

texts.es:
La señora María quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cervezas y refrescos al por mayor, también necesita surtido de productos de la canasta familiar y snacks para abastecer su estadero. 
María ha batallado muchos años para consolidar su negocio, empezó de 0 y con mucho empuje y verraquera ha logrado llegar donde está, pero esto sabe que no lo ha logrado sola, han estado muchas personas ayudándole, y hoy necesita un empujón para mantener bien surtido su negocio. 
Ella trabaja persiguiendo un objetivo el cual es, comprar una vivienda propia, pues quiere vivir tranquila junto con su hija y dejarle una buena herencia.
texts.en:
María wants to request a loan to buy beer and soft drinks wholesale. She also needs a variety of basic food items and snacks to stock her store. María has battled for many years to consolidate her business. She started from scratch and through much effort and pluck she has manged to get to where she is.

But she knows she didn't make it herself. She had many people help her and today she needs a boost to keep her business well stocked. She works pursuing an objective which is to buy her own house as she wants to live quietly with her daughter and leave her a good inheritance.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks wholesale and also basic food items and snacks to stock her restaurant.

loans.name: La Trampa Grande Group

texts.es:
Los miembros del grupo “La Trampa Grande” se sienten muy orgullosos de pertenecer a una comunidad donde aún conservan tradiciones de sus antepasados, del grupo indígena mazahua. La mayoría de las personas aún habla su lengua materna, organiza fiestas patronales y se dedica a cultivar maíz, haba y papa. La comunidad es muy famosa en los alrededores debido a este último producto. 
Don Francisco es muy querido en su comunidad, mejor conocido como don Panchito, tiene 52 años y está casado con doña Macedonia. La pareja tiene nueve hijos aunque actualmente ya sólo dos pequeños dependen de ellos y se encuentran estudiando la primaria y la secundaria respectivamente.
Desde hace 28 años, don Panchito se dedica a la creación de zarapes, gabanes y cobijas. Recuerda que desde niño veía a los demás habitantes elaborando estas artesanías, al igual que sus padres, razón por la que él también emprendió su negocio. Para comenzar, elaboró su propio telar y actualmente ya tiene un pequeño taller con dos maquinarias en el cuál trabajan algunos de sus hijos. Todas las piezas llevan impresas figuras como caballos, flores, colobríes, otro tipo de aves y grecas mazahuas. 
Durante un periodo de ventas bajas, Panchito se vio obligado a trabajar en la construcción de casas en la capital del país, alejado de su familia. Para regresar pronto a su población, decidió dar una segunda oportunidad a las artesanías, pero también comenzó a manejar un taxi para obtener más ingresos. “La artesanía se vende bien sólo a fin de año o cuando me hacen algún pedido especial”. 
Con el préstamo, comprará materia prima como hilos y estambres y le dará mantenimiento a su vehículo para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Panchito agradece la oportunidad del préstamo para invertir mayor capital y obtener mejores precios ahora que la época de invierno se acerca y comenzar a incrementar la producción.
A pesar de la gran competencia que enfrenta Panchito, sueña con mantener su negocio y la tradición de conservar viva su artesanía. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Juliana y Mauricio quienes invertirán en su taxi; Daniel y Ricardo, en cerdos y Angélica y Esperanza, en borregos.
 *Don Panchito es quien viste la chamarra blanca, la fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras de la plaza central del municipio donde hay una fuente, un quiosco, una iglesia católica y el palacio de gobierno.
texts.en:
The members of the group La Trampa Grande feel very proud to belong to a community where they still preserve the traditions of their ancestors from the Mazahua indigenous group. The majority of the people still speak their native language, organize patronage festivals, and work cultivating corn, beans, and potatoes. The community is famous in the surrounding area for this last product.

Francisco is beloved in his community. Best known as Panchito, he is 52 years old and is marries to Macedonia. The couple has nine children although actually just two small children depend on them and are found studying in primary and secondary school respectively.
Since he was 28 years old, Panchito has worked to create ponchos, coats, and blankets. Remembering seeing others producing these since he was a child, including his parents, was reason for him to also start a business. To begin, he made his own loom and actually already has a small workshop with two machines on which a few of his children work. Tall the pieces carry impressive designs such as horses, flowers, hummingbirds, and other types of birds and Mazahua borders.

During a period of low sales, Panchito had to work in home construction in the country’s capital, away from his family. In order to return to his town, he decided to give the arts a second chance, but also worked driving a taxi to yield more income. “The arts sell well only at the end of the year or when a special order is made.”

With the loan, he will buy raw material like thread and wool and it will maintain his vehicle to continue offering a good service. Panchito is grateful for the opportunity of the loan to invest more capital and get better prices now that the winter season is getting close, and to boost production.

In spite of the great competition that Panchito faces, he dreams of maintaining his business and the tradition of keeping his art alive.

The other group members are Juliana and Mauricio, who will invest in their taxi; Daniel and Ricardo, in pigs; and Angélica and Esperanza, in sheep.

Panchito is seen in the white coat. The photograph was taken on the steps of the town’s central plaza where there is a fountain, a kiosk, a Catholic church, and the government office building.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as thread and wool.

location.town: Trampa Grande, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalen Santa Group

texts.en:
Kiva's field partner Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Nueva Jerusalem Santa” was formed in the community of Santa Lucia La Reforma in the western highlands of Guatemala by nine enterprising ladies. These women are committed to maintaining and expanding their small businesses. For all but three of the members, this is their very first experience with Friendship Bridge. The ladies have various businesses such as the sale of beans and corn as well as the sale of chickens, turkeys and pigs. One woman has a “tortilleria” where she makes tortillas by hand three times a day. Others have convenience stores where they sell staples needed for daily use. Finally, there are women in the group who embroider and weave traditional blouses called “huipiles” as shown in the photograph.

Marina is a 40-year-old member of the Trust Bank who is married and has five children. She is so pleased that all five have been able to attend school. She is also the leader of this loan group of nine members.

Marina helps her husband who is a bricklayer meet the expenses of the family. Some time ago she joined the Trust Bank in order to get a loan to purchase items for her convenience store. She was so successful that she opened a second store. She is now requesting a 28,500 GTQ loan to be apportioned among the nine members. She will use her share to buy inventory for both of her stores in order to meet customer demand.

These nine women look forward to their monthly meetings where they make payments on their loans. A Friendship Bridge facilitator is in attendance and conducts educational trainings using games, role playing and drawings. Many if not most of the ladies do not read and write. They learn about all kinds of essential subjects like effective business management techniques (planning, budgeting, pricing, marketing, customer service), nutrition, hygiene and health as well as empowerment and self-esteem. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and small loans “Microcredit Plus” and it works!

The ladies share that they are honored that people from all parts of the world learn about them and their small businesses and then fund their loans. They are taking small steps toward a more prosperous and successful future and Kiva investors are such valuable partners in this effort. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy inventory for both of her grocery stores in order to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for truck maintenance and to be able to access necessary working capital for her business.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.en:
San Antonio Ilotenango is located in the department of Quiché in the western highlands of Guatemala. The region is heavily forested but also has areas where there are fields of corn, beans and coffee plants.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Nueva Esperanza” or “New Hope” was formed by eight local women ranging in age from nineteen to 55 who work hard with their husbands to actualize a better future. They have various businesses including the sale of used clothing as well as animals such as chickens, turkeys, pigs and cattle. Some members of the community are very involved in the creation of beautiful traditional textiles as shown in the above photograph.

María is the leader of the Trust Bank and is married with nine children. This dedicated mother works with great effort so that her children can go to school. Since she was quite small, Maria has been making and selling traditional skirts called “cortes,” or colorful skirts intricately woven and proudly worn by the women, sometimes with beautiful aprons. She also sells undergarments.

Maria is requesting a 26,268 GTQ loan to be apportioned among her group members. She will use her share of the loan to invest in more kinds and colors of thread for her textile business. She wants to have plenty of inventory available for her local market as well as those outside her town. Maria also wants to invest more funds in undergarments.

Friendship Bridge espouses “Microcredit Plus,” a program that believes it is essential to combine loans with education. Most if not all women were unable to attend school and cannot read and write. Therefore, the monthly education and training conducted by a Friendship Bridge facilitator are essential for the women.

Kiva investors and Friendship Bridge bring real hope to the women in the Trust Bank. Armed with their new tools, the women are poised to step into a brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to invest in more kinds and colors of thread for her textile business as well as in undergarments that she sells.

loans.name: Pheach

texts.en:
Pheach is 23 years old and single.  He is a college freshman, and he is also a singer, earning around $6 per day. He resides in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. 

Pheach is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in finance and banking at a university in the province. Currently, he lacks the money to pay all his university fees for the first year, so he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to cover his university fees. 

For his future dreams, he wants to work in a financial institution with a reasonable salary, so he will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees for his first year

loans.name: Silvia Marina

texts.es: Silvia de 32 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y de sus hijos, un hijo de 13 años y un par de mellizos de 17 años de edad. Silvia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trabaja ejerciendo la labor de servicios domésticos en una finca que se encuentra en las cercanías a su comunidad, labor que ha venido realizando desde hace 14 años y lo cual le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos y poco a poco ir mejorando su calidad de vida, con el apoyo de su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con la economía del hogar. Silvia en busca de mejorar su vida y la de su familia solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: puertas, ventanas, láminas, cemento, ladrillo, arena y hierro para terminar de construir su vivienda y cumplir su sueño de una vivienda digna para su familia, ya que no cuenta con la liquidez económica, para realizar esta construcción y es por ello que solicita este crédito.
texts.en: Silvia is 32 years old. She lives with her life partner and her children: a 13 year old son and 17 month old twins. With much effort and dedication, Silvia works rendering domestic services at a farm located close to her community. She has been working in this job for 14 years and it allows her to support her children and improve her quality of life little by little, with the support of her life partner who helps her with household finances. In order to improve her life and that of her family, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: doors, windows, metal sheets, cement, bricks, sand and iron to finish building her house and to fulfill her dream of a decent house for her family, because she does not have financial liquidity to build. For this she is requesting this loan.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, bricks, sand and iron to finish building her house and to fulfill her dream of a decent house.

loans.name: I Will Survive - N02Mbằng08Nngạn Group

texts.en:
Thu is 49 years old, and she is married.  She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has had a manufacturing business sewing clothes for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, the market demand is low in this region. And this business is very competitive, so her income is unstable.

The main hardship that Thu faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines and hire helpers for making more clothes to sell
.
In 2011, Thu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Since then, her income increased significantly. Thu has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of "I will survive - N02MBằng08NNgạn," which consists of five members.

In the future, Thu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase machines and hire helpers for making more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is a farmer who cultivates his own land with his wife. His goal is to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for his four children and his family. Jaime needs to pay for school fees of his children and also cover their household expenses.

Jaime is requesting a loan to pay labor costs for his coconut plantation to improve his production and in order to produce good-quality products for their local customers. He is striving for a better life through farming and is grateful for this opportunity.

Jaime hopes to have a better life with his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for his coconut plantation.

loans.name: Sindy Paola

texts.es: Sindy es una ama de casa que con la finalidad de apoyar en los gastos del hogar y continuar con la crianza de sus hijos, emprendió su venta de almuerzos desde la comodidad de su vivienda; anteriormente ella laboraba en empresas pero encontró en el comercio de mercancías una opción para estar más cerca de su familia y financiada por entidades logró mantenerse en esta actividad. Diariamente su horario laboral inicia a partir de las 5:30 p.m. con la preparación de sus almuerzos corrientes que comercializa a sus vecinos hasta la 1 p.m., y en cuanto tiene espacio promueve su negocio alterno de comercialización de carnes frías.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará víveres para la preparación de los almuerzos, esta inversión agilizará su proceso productivo porque contará con todos los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus recetas.  Sindy es madre de dos hijas menores de edad y en conjunto con su cónyuge desean ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sindy is a housewife whose aim is to pay household expenses and continuing to raise her children. She began selling lunch from the comfort of her home. Previously, she worked in business, but found selling goods was a way of being closer to her family and, financed by entities, she managed to stay in this trade.

Daily working hours start from 5:30 p.m. to prepare her hot lunches, which she sells until 1 p.m., and when she has space, she promotes her other business selling frozen meats.

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ['Mario Santo Domingo Foundation'], with which she will purchase supplies for preparing lunches. This investment will streamline the production process because she will have all the ingredients necessary for the preparation of the recipes.

Sindy is the mother of two younger daughters and together with her spouse want to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making lunches.

loans.name: Mark Joseph

texts.en:
Mark Joseph is a 31 years old and married. He lives in the rural area of Barili, Cebu  with his wife and three children.

He has been running a tricycle (rickshaw). People in his area like to ride, and they hire his transportation services.
,
Mark Joseph hopes to increase his current business, but the main concern is insufficient funds to support his daily living. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, CEVI, to buy motorcycle parts like tires; fuel, and lubricating oil.   

In this way he would be able to meet demands for his service. He can use the profit as savings to fulfill his future needs as well. 

Mark Joseph is very thankful to Kiva and CEVI.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts, fuel, and lubricating oil

loans.name: Carmen Ines

texts.es: Carmen de 64 años de edad estado civil soltera actualmente vive sola,  es una  persona de carácter fuerte a pesar de su problema al corazón, durante 10 años Carmen se levanta todos los días a la 6 de la mañana para atender a sus clientes, con los ingresos de esta ha podido sustentar la casa y poder comprar sus medicamentos, con el préstamo  desea  incrementar sus ventas para poder comprarse una casita y mejorar así su calidad de vida
texts.en: Carmen, 64 years old, is single and currently lives alone. She is a strong willed person despite a problem with her heart. For the past 10 years, Carmen has woken up every day at 6 in the morning to take care of customers. With this income she has been able to maintain her home and buy her medication. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales in order to buy herself a small home and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products for supplying her business.

loans.name: Piseth

texts.en:
Piseth is a 21-year-old, single, professional cook. He lives in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Currently, he is studying for a law major and is in his first year at a university in the province. He has also worked for a restaurant, making a daily income of USD 8 each day.

Piseth is short of the finances to pay his first-year tuition fee and to buy study materials during the academic year, so he would like to apply for a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI. This loan will help Piseth to have enough finances to go through his first year successfully.

In the future, he hopes to have a better job with a reasonable salary to improve his living standards, and he also wants to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay his first-year tuition fee and to buy study materials.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA VICTORIA.
La socia Vilma continua con su negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo lo que son dulces, galletas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo  de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de galletas entre otros.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the Nueva Victoria (New Victory) communal bank.

The associate, Vilma, continues with her business selling sweets. The associate is thankful for the loan granted and is committed to making the established payments. The associate continues selling candies and cookies, etc. to all of the customers who request them. It is in this way that the associate gets her family ahead.

The associate requests the loan to buy cookies, etc.

loans.use: to buy cookies, etc.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 45 years old and married, with five children.  She resides  in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City with her family. 

She owns and operates a motorcycle transportation service to earn a living. For over 15 years, she had sustained it and was able to provide the educational needs of her children. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for buying spare parts and tires for her motorcycle.  

She took a new loan recently to buy new tires and pay repair costs for her motorcycle. Her future plan is to buy a four-wheeled vehicle for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy new tires and maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman and has one grown child. She owns a farm and grows crops. Her husband is a farmer.

Aside from farming, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells basic commodities like sugar, coffee, powdered milk, seasonings, canned goods, eggs, soap, toothpaste and condiments. Her monthly expenses go to food, farm supplies, water, fertilizers and merchandise for the store. For the past three years, she has owned the sari-sari (variety) business, serving neighbors and locals in the place where she lives.

Corazon decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. With the 8,000 PHP she requested, she wants to purchase water for the farm and supplies for the store. She is thankful for your support and looks forward to making her business productive in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase water for the farm and supplies for the store.

loans.name: Lyndie

texts.en:
Lyndie is a mother of her child; she's married and currently residing at D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is an overseas worker, while Lyndie manages their mango plantation.

For over three years, she has been earning well in selling mangoes in the market. It covers the cost of their household expenses, considering also the income of her husband, which she considered as their main source of income.

She gained access to GDMPC, and she recently took a loan for the purpose of buying organic fertilizer for her mango plantation in order to have a more productive harvest. She wants to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her mango plantation.

loans.name: Ricolino Group

texts.es:
En Veracruz hay un municipio donde el clima predominante la mayor parte del año es el cálido, mientras que en el verano y en el invierno es el húmedo tropical con abundantes lluvias. En verano se han llegado a registrar temperaturas de hasta los cincuenta grados a la sombra, por ello, esta región es llamada por los poetas de la localidad como “la novia del sol”.
   El grupo Ricolino es originario de dicha localidad y sus integrantes se caracterizan por su gran sentido del humor, el nombre del grupo obedece a esta cualidad. Los miembros y sus actividades son: Guadalupe y Sara quienes venden comida; Ramón, frutas y verduras; Ana e Itzel, zapatos; Luz, servicios de estética; Cándido, servicio de taxi; Adriana, artículos de plata y Beatriz quien vende perfumes además de brindar servicio de quiropráctica y de banquetes.
   Desde niño Don Ramón se ha dedicado al comercio de frutas y verduras, acompañaba a sus padres a vender de manera ambulante y, al alcanzar la mayoría de edad, decidió formar su propia familia y por ende tener su propio negocio. Así, desde hace cuarenta años ha mantenido su actividad de manera ambulante como sus padres. Hoy en día tiene un lugar establecido dentro de su comunidad donde coloca una gran tarima sobre la cual exhibe los canastos con las frutas y verduras de temporada; “me gusta vender en la banqueta, exhibir la mercancía en mis canastos y estar al aire libre” comenta entusiasmado.Cabe mencionar que es ayudado por uno de sus nietos el cual comenta “no me gusta otra cosa, yo quiero ser un comerciante como mi abuelo” cosa que le causa alegría a Ramón. 
   Al igual que con los préstamos anteriores, el nuevo le será de utilidad para comprar tomate, cebolla, chiles, ajo, papa, pepinos, cilantro, melón, naranja, piña, sandía, melón y uvas. Las ganancias le han permitido brindar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, realizar remodelaciones en casa y comprar una camioneta más amplia.
*La fotografía fue tomada en negocio de don Ramón quien viste playera blanca y gorra roja.
texts.en:
In Veracruz, there is a municipality where the predominant climate for the greater part of the year is hot, while in the summer and the winter it is tropically humid with abundant rain. In the summer, temperatures of up to 50 degrees in the shade have been recorded. For this reason, this region has been called by the local poets "the bride of the sun".

The Ricolino group originated in this locality and its members are characterized by their great sense of humor. The name of the group corresponds to this quality. The members and their activities are: Guadalupe and Sara who sell food; Ramon, fruits and vegetables; Ana and Itzel, shoes; Luz, beauty services; Candido, taxi service; Adriana, articles of silver; and Beatriz who sells perfume as well as offering chiropractic and banquet services.

Since he was a child, Ramon has made a living selling fruits and vegetables. He used to accompany his parents to sell itinerantly, and upon coming of majority age, he decided to start his own family and consequently have his own business. So, for 40 years he continued his itinerant work like his parents.

Nowadays, he has an established spot in his community where he put up a big scaffold upon which he shows his baskets of seasonal fruits and vegetables. "I like to sell on the sidewalk, to exhibit the merchandise in my baskets and be in the open air," he says enthusiastically. It needs to be mentioned that he is helped by one of his grandsons, who says, "I don't like anything else, I want to be a salesman like my grandfather," a thing which brings joy to Ramon.

Similar to the previous loans, the new one will serve to buy tomatoes, onions, chiles, garlic, cucumbers, melons, oranges, pineapples, watermelons, and grapes, The earnings have allowed him to offer a good quality of life to his children, make renovations to the house, and to buy a bigger pickup truck.

*The photograph was taken at Ramon's business. He is dressed in a white T-shirt and red cap.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, chiles, garlic, potatoes, cucumbers, melons, oranges, pineapples, watermelons, and grapes.

loans.name: Daysi Yolanda

texts.es: La Sra. Daysi tiene 32 años de edad, desarrolla su actividad hace más de 10 años se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, la señora solo curso hasta el bachillerato no pudo estudiar una carrera ya que no tubo apoyo económico por parte de sus padres y desde muy joven se dedicó a la agricultura ya que sus padres le inculcaron este oficio, de estado civil casada con el Señor Sandro con el cual tiene dos hijos la señora solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas, abono y fertilizantes y así poder seguir recibiendo ingresos por medio de la agricultura ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Afirman que tienen mucha necesidad. Su principal sueño  a un futuro es  poder contar con un medio transporte que les pueda facilitar la comercialización de sus productos ya que con mucho sacrificio los logra traer a la comunidad y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daysi is 32 years old. For more than 10 years she has developed her work in agriculture. She only went to school until high school. She couldn't study for a degree because she didn't have economic support from her parents. From a very young age she has worked in agriculture, a job that was instilled in her by her parents. She is in a common law marriage with Sandro, with whom she has two children.

She seeks this loan for the purchase of seeds, manure and fertilizers, in order to continue earning income through agriculture, which is her principal source of income. She confirms that these are much needed. Her primary dream for the future is to be able to have a means of transportation that would help with the sale of their products. Currently it takes much effort to bring them to the community, so this would improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers, to increase her production in order to improve her family's income and living conditions.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es: Carmen es una confeccionista que desde muy joven estuvo consiente que su vocación era la costura y el haberse dedicado a otros oficios en empresas, permitió que con sus salarios, lograra ahorrar los recursos para sacar adelante su sueño de prosperidad.  Ella es una madre de cuatro hijos y no contó con el apoyo de su cónyuge, sin embargo con su negocio ha logrado ofrecerle bienestar a su familia y es muy reconocida en el sector donde residente en un barrio al sur del municipio.  Ella cuenta con 26 años de funcionamiento y confecciona todo tipo de prenda de vestir para damas y caballeros, ella realiza todo el proceso productivo y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar al por mayor telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos necesarios. Su meta es fortalecer su capital de trabajo y continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is a seamstress who has known from a young age that sewing was her calling. By working in other businesses, she was able to use her earnings to save enough to make her dream a reality. She is a mother of four children, and she never had the support of their father. However, through her business, she has been able to provide for her family's wellbeing, and she is now very well known for her work in her neighborhood.

She has 26 years of experience and she makes all types of outfits for men and women, and she does all of the work herself. She is seeking a loan, her first through La Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons and other supplies in bulk. Her goals are to strengthen her business and continue providing for her family.

loans.use: purchase fabrics, thread, buttons and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Roxana Margarita

texts.es: Roxana es una joven comerciante de 24 años que decidió seguir los pasos de su madre quien toda su vida se ha dedicado a esta actividad obteniendo multiplex beneficios, ella reside en compañía de su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de tres años de edad en Malambo un municipio del Atlántico en donde se consolida su clientela a quienes les ofrece prendas de vestir, perfumes, cosméticos y todo artículo de la oferta del catálogo.  Roxana está incorporada a esta masiva forma de comercialización, hace dos años y ha logrado trabajar con su capital, sin embargo su base de clientes está mucho más amplia y no le es suficiente su capital para cumplir con todos sus pedidos, es por ello que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para responder a los encargos de su clientela; prendas de vestir, cosméticos y accesorios.  Su meta es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia mediante su labor.
texts.en:
Roxana is a young, 24 year old businesswoman who decided to follow in her mother's footsteps who has worked her whole life in this field. Roxana lives with her partner and their three-year-old daughter in Malambo, a city on the Atlantic. Most of the customers that she sells clothing, perfumes, cosmetics and other catalog items live in this area.

Roxana has been involved in this business for two years and has been able to work with the capital that she has. However, her customer base has grown considerably and she no longer has the working capital to fill their orders. For this reason, she is seeking a loan, her first with la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to fill her customers' orders by purchasing clothing, cosmetics and accessories. Her goal is to improve her family's living condition through her work.

loans.use: fulfill her customers' orders by purchasing outfits, cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Her name is Josephine, aged 46 years, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines.   She is happily married to Amando, a butcher, and they have four children, one married and one in college. The couple faces difficult challenges in a developing economy, but they strive hard to make a living. 

To augment their income, Josephine started a general store, which has helped support her family's needs for ten years already. She is seeking your help in the amount of PHP 19,000 to expand her small store with essential food items, such as bread, biscuits, canned goods, instant noodles, eggs, oil, and toiletries. Although there are times when she has difficulty getting some of her customers to pay their bills, she still maintains a positive and understanding attitude towards them.

Josephine dreams of having a vehicle to easily transport her items from wholesalers. She wants her child to finish her college education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es: Dalila de 35 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia en la cual vive al lado de su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 17, 15 y 9 años de edad y un bebé de 1 mes de edad. Dalila es una persona muy trabajadora quien en busca de cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar mantiene un negocio de venta de ropa para dama y para niño, negocio que se encuentra ubicado en las cercanías a su localidad con el fin de sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles una buena educación, además su compañero de vida le ayuda con la economía del hogar. La vivienda de Dalila es pequeña y muy humilde, se ha construido con pedazos de plásticos, el sueño de ella es poder vivir en una casa con materiales de mejor calidad y de esta forma brindarles una mejor forma de vida a sus hijos, y así poder dormir sin preocupación los días de lluvias, ya que por los materiales con los que está construida su vivienda hay una filtración de agua los días en los que llueve y para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, madera y pago de mano de obra para construir su vivienda. La cual desea hacer con lámina nueva y de buena calidad, de esta manera vivir mejor y de una forma más segura, sin temor a que por las lluvias alguno de sus hijos se enferme.
texts.en: Dalila is 35 years old. She lives in her own house with her life partner and her children, ages 17, 15 and 9, and a one month old baby. Dalila is a very hardworking person who, in order to cover her basic household needs, has a business selling women and children's clothes. Her business is located near her community.  The goal of her business is to support her children and give them a good education; also her life partner helps her with household finances. Dalila's house is small and very humble and it has been built with plastic pieces. Her dream is to live in a house with better quality materials, give her children a better way of life and be able to sleep without worries during rainy days, since the materials with which her house is built let water leak those days when it rains. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: sheets and wood, and to pay for hand labor to build her house. She wants to build it with new sheets of good quality, to live better and safer without fears of having her children get sick due to the rain.

loans.use: to invest in: sheets, wood, nails and wire to build her house with sheets.

loans.name: Merizon

texts.en:
Merizon is 52 years old, married, and has 2 children. She sells vegetables to the people in her village. She makes her sales using her bicycle.

Merizon wants to sell more merchandise, so she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more vegetables to sell. She will buy tomatoes, eggplants, and beans.

In the future, Merizon hopes to keep improving her sales and earnings for emergency funds.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Las Princesitas Group

texts.es:
Cecilia es una mujer de 36 años de edad, soltera, tienen 4 hijos de 10, 12, 15 y 19 años de edad, y su negocio es la peluquería.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ área que alberga a migrantes campesinos de todo el país. 
Cecilia es morena de baja estatura y cabello negro (sentada al centro, viste blusa celeste), su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio para pagar los gastos familiares la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de limpieza, venta de ropa de segunda mano, confección de tejidos, sastrería, taller de llaves, venta de comida y venta de refrescos. Su negocio es la peluquería, ella trabaja ambulantemente realizando el servicio de peluquería a domicilio, “inicie mi oficio trabajando en un salón de belleza, pero los horarios eran muy difíciles y me tuve que independizar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de material de trabajo como; tijeras, champú, secadora, peines, cepillos y otros. Su sueño es tener un salón de belleza, ella desea comprar material de peluquería para ofrecer su servicio ambulantemente. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que lleva con esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Cecilia solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de peluquería para cortar el cabello ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 36 and single, with four children ages 10, 12, 15 and 19. Her business is hairdressing.

She is a good mother, independent, and very responsible. She does business in the ‘plan 3000’ neighborhood, home to rural migrants from around the country.

Cecilia is petite with a dark complexion and black hair (in the photo she is seated in the center, wearing a light blue blouse.) Her native language is Guaraní and she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her children, who are in school. They live in their own house, which is made of wood and equipped with all basic utilities.

The need to improve her business to pay for family expenses led her to form a communal bank made up of people with businesses such as: cleaning service, secondhand clothing sales, fabric making, tailoring, key making, food sales, and beverage sales.

Cecilia's business is hairdressing. She is a mobile in-home hairdresser. “I began my occupation working in a beauty salon, but the schedule was very difficult, and I had to become independent," she says. The advantage of her business is that she has regular clients. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy supplies such as: scissors, shampoo, hairdryers, combs, brushes, and other items. Her dream is to have a beauty salon. She wants to buy hairdressing supplies in order to offer her services as a mobile hairdresser. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the two years she has been in this business.

For these reasons, Cecilia is requesting a loan to buy hairdressing supplies in order to be a mobile hairstylist.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies in order to work as a mobile hairstylist.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.es: Ilda de 45 años de edad, habita en casa propia, vive felizmente junto a su compañero de vida y su grupo familiar. Ilda para sacar adelante a su familia presta sus servicios domésticos, labor que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo, así también con el aporte que realiza su esposo logran cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar. Ilda desea mejorar su vivienda, ya que es humilde y debido al pasar de los años hay partes que necesitan reparación y para lo cual decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para  encementar el piso de su vivienda y de esta manera ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Ilda is 45 years old. She lives in her own house, happily with her life partner and their family. Ilda, in order to help her family get ahead, works as a domestic servant. She has been doing this work for a long time. Along with her husband's earnings, she is able to cover her family's basic household expenses. Ilda wishes to improve her home because it is humble and, due to the passage of time, there are many parts that need repair. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and paid labor to cement the floor of her home. This will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and paid labor to cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia Asunta continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo mantas y telares, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telares entre otros.
texts.en:
Asunta continues dedicating herself to her handicraft business. She has been working in this way for a long time and things have gone well for her thanks to the determination that she brings to it each day. Asunta is grateful for this loan and pledges to make her repayments as scheduled.

Asunta is still selling blankets and weaved fabrics. She hopes to continue working in this way and support her family.

Asunta is requesting this loan to buy fabrics and other items.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other items.

loans.name: We Are Happy - N08Chợđbiên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga is 47 years old, and she is married. She has had a retail business selling porcelain products such as bowls, plates, and cups for more than 10 years.

Nga lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Her family lives in a low-income household in their village. As well, the market need is low in this region, and the income from this business is unstable because the customers can easily find these items in many stores with competitive prices.

The main hardship that Nga faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more porcelain products to resell. In 2011, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business.

Nga has successfully repaid many loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of "We are happy - N08ChợĐBiên", which consists of 3 members.

In the future, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more porcelain products to resell.

loans.name: Jimson

texts.en:
Jimson has owned and operated his farm for many years. The farm is earning well. In fact, he was able to repay his previous loan and provide for the daily needs of his family.

Jimson used his previous loans for farm inputs and improvement. He is a successful farmer who works tirelessly to improve his family's living standards. He is able to cultivate the adjacent farm land, and he needs money for fertilizer such as manure. He took a loan recently, and has made his plan a reality.

In the future Jimson hopes to be able to expand his business and continue improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is married and a mother of one child. She is now living with her child because her husband has already passed away. In order for them to survive and provide the needs of her child, Teofila engages in selling seaweed in the market. She is earning financially from this activity. She joined and gained access to GDMPC and recently took a loan to buy more seaweed to sell.

Teofila's plan for the future is to save more money and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda owns and operates a food selling business in her local community to earn her living. She has been running her business for 10 years and earns well enough to sustain her family.

Rosalinda used for previous loan for her business and was successfully repaid with the revenue she earned. Improving the business becomes easier with her access to Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative.

Recently, Rosalinda took a new loan to purchase meat such as pork, beef, and chicken and assorted drinks. She plans to accept catering jobs in order to gain more revenue. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for making meals.

loans.name: Repay In Time - N03Ydoãn1Đyênđsơn Group

texts.en:
Liên is 40 years old, and she is married with two children. Mrs. Liên has been working in agriculture as a farmer for six years. She lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the income from this business is not high enough to cover the life costs and save money.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for vegetables and trees.

In 2013, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Liên is the group leader of the "Repay in time - N03YDoãn1ĐYênĐSơn" Group, which consists of three members.

In the future, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for vegetables and trees.

loans.name: Carmen Del Rocio

texts.es:
Carmen es una señora de 47 años, no tiene hijos y vive en casa de su madre en la ciudad de Santo Domingo. 
Carmen es muy trabajadora, ella desde hace años atrás se dedica a la venta de ropa, comenzó recorriendo de casa en casa hasta ganar clientela, ya al ver que le iba bien con los ahorros generados por las ganancias pudo arrendar un local en una avenida muy importante de la ciudad llamada 3 de Julio, en esta zona existe mucho comercio, cuenta con su pequeño local donde ya es conocida, trabaja todos los días de la semana.
Carmen es clienta nueva de la Fundación, vino referida por un muy buen cliente que la recomendó, con este crédito ella podrá surtir en ropa ya que se avecinan las fiestas de la provincia. Está muy agradecida con KIVA porque podrá seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y dando mejor variedad a sus clientes. En un futuro tiene planificado abrir otro local para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 47 year old woman. She has no children and lives in her mother's house in Santo Domingo city.

Carmen is very hardworking, for years she has made a living selling clothes. She began walking from house to house until she won customers. It is already going well, and with the savings generated from her gains, she was able to rent a place in very important avenue of the city called July 3rd. In this zone there is a lot of commerce. She has a small shop that is already well known, and she works all the days of the week.

Carmen is a new client of the Foundation. She came referred by a very good client that recommended her. With this loan she will be able to supply clothing at the upcoming province festivals. She is very thankful to Kiva because she will be able to continue strengthening her business and provide greater variety to her customers. In the future, she has planned to open another location in order to continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise and to stock her business so as to be able to offer variety to her customers.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.en:
Heriberto is a single 27-year-old man. He has no children and lives at his parents' house. He doesn't plan to stay there for long. He is now looking for a new place to live, but he is not in a rush to move out, because he doesn't want to leave without knowing who will take care of his parents.

Heriberto works at a fabric as a laborer. He has been working at this place for two years and enjoys his work because this allows him to provide a little support for his parents. He also enjoys relaxing while hearing some music. He like to keep things simple.

He is not certain about when to leave his parents house, yet when he does, he wants to leave it in good condition, and now the house has some leaks on the bathroom's ceiling. Heriberto would like to see this fixed as soon as possible, so he is looking for a 5,264 MXN loan that will allow him to fix it.

Heriberto is pictured outside his parents' place. He has had credit from department stores, and paid for them with out problems, yet this is a bigger deal for him because he knows his parents' house is at stake.It is not only a simple electronic device.

loans.use: to fix the ceiling of his bathroom

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn has been running a general store for many long years. She's earning well from this activity. She has sustained her business and, with the income she generated, she was able to repay her previous loan.

Improving Evelyn's business has been made easier with her access to Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative. Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to resell.

Evelyn plans to use the additional profit she generates from her business to further improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to resell.

loans.name: Eduar Jaime

texts.es:
Eduar Jaime con 36 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y tres hijos,vive en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de dicha localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Eduar Jaime se dedica a la actividad del cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 has,de la variedad de catimor; plantación tiene 4 años de edad en su segundo año de producción, cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro ya que anteriormente cultivaba café tradicional variedad nacional.Ahora por cuestiones de enfermedades y plagas a renovado plantación variedad catimor que es mucho más resistente a enfermedades.Cultivo de café lo realiza en terreno propio. Así mismo cultiva maíz amarillo criollo duro,cuenta con amplia experiencia en actividad. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca). El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento de parcela agrícola 1 has de café variedad catimor de 4 años de edad, asegurando campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Socio recurrente en nuestra institución, Edpyme Alternativa. Eduar Jaime firma con cónyuge.
texts.en:
Eduar Jaime is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children. They live in their own house made of rustic material in the district of Santo Tomás, in the province of Cutervo, in the departament of Cajamarca. Eduar Jaime has great personal and professional references from other residents of the region. The residents of this locale mostly earn a living from farming and raising livestock.

Eduar Jaime earns a living growing coffee. His Catimor coffee crop is four years old and is in its second year of production. Eduar Jaime has much experience in this area because previously he grew coffee of the nation's traditional variety. Now, due to problems with plagues among the crops, he has renovated his land to grow the Catimor variety, which is much more resistant to pests. Eduar Jaime grows his coffee on land that he owns. He also cultivates some corn varieties, for which he also has much experience. Additionally, Eduar Jaime earns a living by raising small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) as well as produces food to go (yuca, plantains, and vituca).

This loan will be used to maintain his farmland on which his 4-year-old Catimore coffee grows to assure the success of the 2016 harvest. This will increase his volume of sales and his profits so that he will be able to improve his family's quality of life.

Eduar Jaime is a returning member of the institution, Edpyme Alternativa. Eduar Jaime signed with his wife.

loans.use: to maintain the farmland on which he has grown Catimor coffee for the last four years, assuring the success of the 2016 crop.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is married and has four children. He has his own business. Vasil grows cucumbers and flowers in three greenhouses. He also works as an operator. Vasil is an active and hardworking person.

Vasil is asking for a loan of 30,000 UAH to install the new front door and warm up the walls inside the house. The loan will help to improve the living conditions of his family and save money during the heating season in winter.

loans.use: to install the new front door and warm up the walls inside of the house.

loans.name: Gregoria Gricelda

texts.es: Gregoria de 28 años de edad, es una persona quien vive de manera humilde junto a su compañero de vida, Gregoria es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora, ella ofrece sus servicios domésticos en la cual lleva varios años laborando, además los días que tiene libres los utiliza para vender comida típica como lo son las pupusas y de esta manera puede satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, también su compañero de vida le colabora en la economía del hogar. La casa en la que habita es humilde y bastante pequeña. En busca de mejorar su forma de vida, Gregoria solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y pagar la mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida y evitar las enfermedades respiratorias que se hacen frecuentes porque su piso es de tierra.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 28 years old, is a person who lives in a humble manner with her life partner. Gregoria is young, very responsible, and hardworking. She works offering domestic services, which she has labored in many years. She also uses her free days to sell typical food like pupusas, and in this way can satisfy the basic needs of her family. Her life partner also contributes to the economy of the home.

The house where she lives is humble and very small. In search of improving her way of life, Gregoria is seeking a FUSAI loan to invest in cement, sand, and gravel and to pay for the labor to cement the floor of her house. In this way she will improve her quality of life and avoid respiratory illnesses that she gets frequently because her floor is dirt.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and gravel, and to pay for the labor to cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 45-year-old married mother with 2 children to provide for. To earn her living, she is engaged in a piggery business. She raises pigs and sells them at the market.

Mary Jane aims to earn a greater income, so she decided to take a loan to buy feed for the pigs. She will be able to both produce good quality meat and deliver it to the market to supply her customer demand, resulting in greater income.

Mary Jane's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
La socia Marlene pertenece al banco comunal “EL PACIFICO DE SAN SALVADOR” ,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Salvador ,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La Simeona tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de agricultura y venta de adornos artesanía para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de adornos entre otros.
La socia Marlene agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Marlene belongs to the communal bank group called "El Pacifico de San Salvador," located in the district of San Salvador, in the province of Calca, in the departament of Cusco.

Marlene has a son and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily activities, dedicating herself to her farming business and her business selling decorative handicrafts for clients who order them from her. She has been working like this for a long time and things have gone well for her, thanks to the dedication she shows each day at her business. Marlene wishes to continue working like this to support her family.

Marlene is requesting this loan in order to buy decorations and other items. She is grateful for and values this loan and she pledges to make all of her scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to buy decorations and other items.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a 42-year-old married mother of 4 children, 3 of whom are attending school.

Getrude deals and trades timber as her main source of income, and she has been doing this business for over 15 years. However, she has been affected by limited capital. So, to overcome this challenge, she decided to join Ugafode for the financial assistance needed to start a tea growing business.

Getrude has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy seedlings for her tea project. She wants to increase her income to both meet all her financial needs, especially school fees, and sustain her business.

Getrude hopes to expand her agriculture business using the financial assistance acquired from Ugafode.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde de 58 años de edad, quien luego de la pérdida de su compañero de vida, se esfuerza por mantener la economía del hogar. Matilde es una persona muy trabajadora y se gana la vida con la venta de un plato típico como lo es la sopa de patas, además con la venta de tamales de carne. Actividad que le ayuda a cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia. Matilde tiene una visión, y es lograr tener una mejor vida y más tranquila, y es que el techo de su vivienda no está en perfectas condiciones por lo que en los días de lluvia surge la intranquilidad por la filtración de agua que se da por el techo. Para solventar este problema se necesita reparar el techo de su vivienda y es por esto que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, clavos, madera y pago de mano de obra para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Matilde is 58 years old. After the loss of her life partner, she has fought to financially maintain her family's household. Matilde is a hardworking person and earns her living selling traditional foods such as soups and tamales with meat. This work helps her to pay for her family's basic needs. Matilde has a vision to succeed and have a better, calmer life. The roof over her home is not in good condition, so on rainy days, water surges through the roof disrupting things in her home. In order to solve this problem, she needs to repair the roof of her house, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI.
