Matilde will invest in sheet metal, nails, wood, as well as pay laborers to fix the roof of her home.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, nails, wood, and to pay for labor to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is an old client known to the institution. He is married with 5 children who all attend school.

Denis is a farmer and he deals in both matooke production and piggery as his major sources of income. Denis has been taking loans from Ugafode which he claims has enabled him to build his first house and educate his children.

Denis has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, manure, and mulching materials to boost his agricultural production.

Denis praises Ugafode for its financial support which has enabled him to meet all of his family's financial obligations especially school fees.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mary Esther

texts.es:
Mary es una señora con 30 años de edad, debido a que no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre de sus hijos, se ve en la necesidad de buscar un trabajo y empezar a mantener totalmente a sus pequeños.
Quiere dedicarse a la cría de aves, un negocio que probablemente le generará los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
Es por esto que solicita un crédito con el cual adecuará los galpones, colocará piso y comprara pollos de engorde.
Su meta es continuar trabajando y cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y más adelante poder ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios profesionales.

La actividad que realiza esta mujer para sobrevivir con los suyos son dignas de aplausos y la hacen merecedora del apoyo que necesita.
texts.en:
Mary is a 30 year old woman. Seeing as she does not have the economic backing of the father of her children, she had to find work and start to completely support her young ones.

She wants to work raising chickens, a business that will probably generate sufficient income to cover the basic necessities of her household.

So she is requesting a loan which she will use to adapt the coops, lay a floor and buy broilers (chickens).

Her goal is to continue to work and fulfill her dream of improving the condition of her house and later on be able to help her children with their professional studies.

The business that this woman is doing to survive with her offspring is worthy of applause and makes her worthy of the help she needs.

loans.use: to adapt her coops, lay a floor and buy broilers (chickens).

loans.name: Guillermo Rafael

texts.es:
Guillermo es un señor con 67 años de edad, dedicado desde hace más de 10 años a la cría y venta de aves, con esto ha logrado salir adelante con su familia conformada por dos hijos mayores de edad y su actual pareja.
Guillermo es un hombre trabajador, humilde y lleno de vida, a su edad sus esfuerzos no disminuyen, su propósito es continuar trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y poder ayudar a sus hijos a pagar su educación.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de pollos y alimento para los mismos en gran cantidad.
Sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los colaboradores del Portal Kiva sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a man of 67, who has been raising and selling poultry for more than 10 years. In this way has managed to support his family, made up of two adult children and his current partner.

Guillermo is a modest, hard-working man, and full of life. At his age, his strength is not lessening.

His aim is to continue working in order to improve his dwelling and to be able to help his children pay for their education.

He is requesting a loan, which he will invest in the purchase of chickens and feed for them in large quantity.

He knows that with a helping hand from Interactuar and the Kiva lenders, his dreams will become a reality.

loans.use: to buy chickens and the feed for them in large quantity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her children's dental surgery, which is very expensive, and end the dental suffering of which her children complain.

loans.name: Cristino José

texts.es: Cristino es habitante del municipio de Barranquilla y su familia por tradición se ha dedicado a elaborar productos para la decoración de hogares, negocio que optó para su sustento y en el que lleva veinte años con excelentes resultados.  Él elabora espejos decorativos, cuadros y adornos en ceramica que distribuye a municios del caribe, entre ellos Cartagena de Indias en donde cuenta con un equipo de vendedores, así mismo en Barranquilla posee el mismo esquema de comercialización.  Él se encuentra separado de su conyuge y es padre de dos hijas menores de edad, sin embargo es muy responsable con sus deberes y vela por el bienestar de sus hijos.   En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en materiales como yeso y pinturas, con las que realizará su próxima colección.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su cobertura y en lo personal conseguir los recursos pertinentes para educar a sus hijas en buenos colegios.
texts.en:
Cristino is a resident of the municipality of Barranquilla. His family by tradition has worked by creating home-decoration products. It is the business he chose in order to sustain himself and in which he has 20 years' experience with excellent results.

He creates decorative mirrors, paintings, and decorations in ceramic that he distributes to municipalities in the Caribbean, including Cartagena de Indias where he has a team of vendors. And in the same way in Barranquilla he has the same business layout.

He is separated from his spouse and is a father to two younger girls; however, he is very responsible with his duties and takes care for the well-being of his children. Through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he currently is applying to his first loan that will allow him to invest in materials such as plaster and paints, with which he will complete his next collection. 

His future goal is to grow his market presence, and his personal goals include gaining the necessary resources to put his daughters in good schools.

loans.use: to invest in materials such as plaster and paints.

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es:
José es  un hombre humilde, trabajador, entusiasta, una persona que dedica cuerpo y alma al trabajo, se desempeña como podador, una actividad que nació de la necesidad económica y gracias a su negocio ha logrado generar los recursos para sostener su hogar.
José no tiene hijos, no tiene pareja, se preocupa mucho de sí mismo y de sus demás familiares, su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su familia y tener trabajo por mucho más años. 
José se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para completar el dinero con el que comprara una podadora nueva, más potente que agilice su trabajo. 
Apoya a un empresario independiente que mantiene a sus familiares, una persona que busco por todos los medios generar ingresos y no solo quedarse en una silla quejándose.
texts.en:
José is a humble, hard-working, enthusiastic man, a person who dedicates his heart and soul to his work. He works as a groundskeeper, an activity that was born out of economic need. Thanks to his business he has be able to attain the resources to sustain his household. 

José does not have children or a partner; he spends much of his time taking care of himself and the rest of his relatives. His dream is to improve the conditions of his family and have work for many more years.

José is seeking a loan to have the remaining money for a new trimmer, one that is more powerful and that will speed up his work.

Support an independent businessman who takes care for his relatives--someone who looks to generate income through all means possible and not simply stay sitting in a chair complaining.

loans.use: to reach the amount of money needed to buy a new, more powerful trimmer that will accelerate his work.

loans.name: Roselily

texts.en:
Roselily is 59 years old, widowed, and has 4 children. 2 of her children are already married while the others live with her.

Roselily is thankful for her small business where she earns a profit to sustain herself. She wanted to improve her sales but had insufficient funds needed to buy more goods to sell.

Roselily is now asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy vegetables, fruit, and fish to resell. She will continue selling good products. She hopes to achieve economic stability someday.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, and fish to resell.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina was able to sustain her store through the untiring support of Kiva and its lenders. This has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and she is forever thankful for your help.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of PHP 17000 to refill her store with more grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income which has sustained her family's basic needs. She is hopeful for your positive response.

Merlina dreams of becoming a wholesaler. She prays for God to abundantly bless her children's families. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia es una ama de casa que aprovecho la tradición de su familia; ellos son pescadores de diferentes especies y con la facilidad de comprarles a excelentes precios, inició su negocio desde su vivienda en donde los conserva en su refrigerador.  Ella inició muy cautelosamente con pequeñas cantidades que ofrecía a sus amigos y conocidos, con el pasar del tiempo se hizo muy popular en el barrio donde reside en Soledad y así amplió su variedad de productos, ella actualmente comercializa mariscos, pescados de mar y de rio, actividad que realiza diariamente según los encargos que sus clientes le soliciten.  Claudia está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en surtido de pescado e invertirá en un congelador que le permita almacenar mayor cantidad de productos.  Su meta a futuro es ser propietaria de una pescadería y continuar apoyando a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Claudia is a housewife who enjoys the tradition of her family; they are fishermen of different species. With the ease of buying at excellent prices, she started her business from her home where she saves [the fish] in her refrigerator. She began very cautiously with small quantities that she offered to her friends and acquaintances. With the passing of time it made her very popular in the neighborhood where she lives in Soledad, and so she increased her variety of products. Currently she sells shellfish and fish from the sea and river, a job that she does daily according to the orders that her clients ask for.

Claudia is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to invest in an assortment of fish and to invest in a freezer that will allow her to stock a greater quantity of products. Her future goal is to be the owner of a fish market and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to invest in an assortment of fish and to invest in a freezer that allows her to stock a larger quantity of products.

loans.name: Porchara

texts.en:
Porchara, who goes by the nickname Kong, is an artisan from Thailand who specializes in men's bracelets. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials for his designs including silver and leather cords.

Kong has been selling through NOVICA since 2014, and this is his story:

"Hi, my name is Porchara, better known as Kong. I was born in the northern provinces of Thailand. I started crafting jewelry by making designs for my personal use. Then my sister encouraged me to make some more to sell. When my work started to sell, I was very happy. It seems others like my ideas as well, so I began designing seriously and making jewelry with my sister's advice.

"Thank you for your support. I try to get the best price for all raw materials, which means I need to buy in bulk."

Use the link below to view Kong's men's bracelets on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/9523

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials for his designs including silver and leather cords.

loans.name: Tech

texts.en:
Tech, 53, lives in Santuk District, Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. She has two unmarried children and three married children. To make a living, she works as a farmer in a small potato field which is located near her house. So far, it is more than seven years that she has been involved in this farming business, which can earn a net profit of USD 5 per day.

Because her farmland is so small, it provides little income. For more profit, Tech wants to add capital to buy more farmland to operate her farming business. Now she is borrowing a loan from HKL to pay for farmland. She would like to thank lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to operate her farming business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married and has eight children, two of whom attend school. She engages in raising domesticated animals like pigs and goats. She is 52 years old and a resident of the town of Barili, Cebu.

She has been engaged in animal husbandry for ten years. The business faces challenges: the lack of liquidity which limits the ability to expand, and the seasonality of the livestock trade.

Estrella decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. She requested a loan to buy additional pigs, a goat and feed.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, a goat and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for his home like rice, sugar, and milk, among other things.

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Thắng is 36 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She has operated a service business laying bricks for more than 10 years.

Thắng lives in Bim Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family lives in a low income household in their village. As well, the market need is low in this region, and the income from her business is not high enough to provide what she really needs for a comfortable life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a new toilet.

This is Thắng first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. In the future, Thắng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a carver from Ghana who specializes in wood sculptures and masks. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, and aluminum plates.

Ali has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is his story:

"My story began at a tender age when my parents had to move to Nigeria to seek greener pastures. I was left in the care of a relative and initially my parents sent money but, after some time, the money was not forthcoming due to economic hardships. I dropped out of school and had to take care of myself. I would go to the bush to gather sticks for firewood, which I'd sell. I started carving thanks to a friend, and now I consider myself more as a designer and I teach my assistants to carve my designs."

"This is my first microcredit and I believe that it will help me a great deal and enable me to craft more items for the high season. May Allah bless you all."

Use the link below to view Ali's wood sculptures and masks on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/8888

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, and aluminum plates

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
This is Mary Rose, a hardworking entrepreneur from Santa Barbara, Iloilo. She is married to Roberto, a carpenter-driver and they have children who are studying in college. Mary Rose owns a tricycle that her neighbors rent from her. They pay her the rental fee on a daily basis. In times that her husband has no work as a carpenter, he himself drives the tricycle for income. Simultaneously, Mary Rose raises hogs in their backyard as additional livelihood. It’s impressive how they work together to support the needs of their children and how they strive to save for their future.

However, there are times when the tricycle breaks down and their income also stops. Mary Rose has to buy some spare parts and pay for its repair. She implores your heartfelt generosity to lend her an amount of PHP 13,000 for this purpose. She knows that continuous income from her tricycle can help sustain their daily expenses, because their hogs are not yet ready for selling at this time.

Mary Rose dreams to have a more stable business by acquiring several units of tricycles and a profitable piggery someday. She prays for good health and complete college education for her children. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for the repair of her tricycle

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark owns and operates a farm, raising crops to earn a living. For many years in farming, he has been provide the needs of his family and was able to send his children to school. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, used for buying fertilizer. Recently, he took out a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. Improving their farm is his plan because it is their main source of income and he wants to ensure a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Jee-Ann

texts.en: Jee-ann owns and operates an agriculture business growing coconut for sale. Jee-ann has been engaged in her business for many years and she earns well from these activities.  Her farm is still doing well and yet, she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC to pay the labor cost for harvesting the coconut farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To pay labor cost for harvesting the coconut farm.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina de 63 de edad, reside en vivienda propia en la cual ha vivido toda su vida, habita con su compañero de vida quien le apoya y acompaña en el diario vivir. Marina es una persona emprendedora quien quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello se ha esforzado y dedicado mucho tiempo para poder instalar una tienda, la cual poco a poco ha ido mejorando. Ella hace todo lo posible por lograr satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia y así vivir de una mejor manera con su compañero de vida. Su vivienda es humilde y en algunos aspectos se siente insegura más que todo por estos días de lluvia, es por ello que Marina solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un muro alrededor de su vivienda y de esta manera estar más tranquilos en su vivienda, sin temor al agua que corre cerca de su hogar.
texts.en:
Marina, 63 years old, resides in her own home in which she has lived all her life. She lives with her life partner who supports her and accompanies her in daily life. Marina is an enterprising person who wants to improve her quality of life, and for this she has made an effort and dedicated much time to be able to install a shop which, little by little, has been improving. She does everything possible to manage to satisfy the basic needs of her family and thus live in a better manner with her life partner.

Her home is humble and in some aspects she feels insecure, more than anything because of this rainy season. It is for this reason that Marina is seeking a FUSAI loan to invest in bricks, sand, and cement, and to pay the labor for the construction of a wall around her house. In this way she will be calmer in her home, without fear of the water that runs close to her house.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, sand, and cement, and to pay the labor for the construction of a wall around her house.

loans.name: Homer

texts.en: Homer manages and operates his farm land, planting and harvesting vegetables and fruits for sale to earn a living. He has been in this business for many years. He joined Gata Daku MPC to have access to financial services that can help him and be used to improve his business. Recently, he requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to cover the cost of farm cultivation and fertilization. In the future, Homer wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of farm cultivation and fertilization

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin has received a number of loans in the past which he has faithfully paid. He is thankful to Kiva and its supporters for their continuous support of his livelihood. He is focused on his recycling business to fully support his child's education.

He trusts that he could again avail of a 50,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Others may see his business as literally dirty but he is proud that he can support his family. This will help sustain and grow his sales and enable him to support his child in college. He continues to be diligent so he can give his family a better life.

Erwin hopes to acquire a truck to easily transport his scrap materials. He prays for guidance and protection for his family. Each week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business where he also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Melvin Alexis

texts.es: Melvin de 28 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador quien tiene 23 años de residir en su vivienda junto a su familia. Melvin se dedica a la confección de ropa, labor que ha realizado durante varios años y la cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia. Así también ha notado que hay varias necesidades en su hogar, es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, bloque, arena y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un muro de bloque al contorno de su vivienda. Melvin busca la manera en la cual él y su familia puedan tener una mejor forma de vida y estar más seguros en su hogar.
texts.en:
Melvin, 28 years old, is a very responsible and hardworking man who has lived in his home with his family for 23 years. Melvin works making clothes, work that he has done for many years and which allows him to cover his basic needs and those of his family.

He has also noted that there are various needs in his home, and it is for this reason that he has sought a FUSAI loan to invest in cement, blocks, and sand, and to pay the labor for the construction of a block wall around the edge of his home. Melvin seeks the manner in which he and his family can have a better way of life and be more secure in their home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, blocks, and sand, and to pay the labor for the construction of a block wall around the edge of his home.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Being a taxi driver, Vy, who is a 47 years old and a married man with four children, can only make $5 USD per day to support his family. Vy resides in a rural area of Rolea Bier District, Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in this career for nearly 4 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Vy would like to get a low-interest loan from Kiva in order to build a hygienic latrine for his house. He is very happy with this loan since it will promote his health, environment, and living standards. He would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like him.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs Hà is 53 years old and she is married.
She has had a retail business selling dry food for more than 10 years.Hà lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Hà first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.
In the future, Hà hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Phượng is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry and cattle for more than 10 years. She lives in Bim Son district, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low income household in her village; moreover, the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to have comfort in her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a new toilet.

This is Phượng's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true. In the future, Phượng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 55 years old, married, and lives with her family. She has a retail store serving several customers; she sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income while her husband works as a pastor. Esther has 30 years' experience in this field. She is working hard every day in order to provide income for the family and to show customers her responsibility and reliability to serve them.

Esther requested this loan to buy additional goods and bottled products to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may open a bigger place and continue assisting her family with the additional income.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria owns and operates an agricultural farm, growing coconut, banana and other crops for a living. Gloria has been engaged in this business for many  years helping with her husband working on it and earns well from these activities. Her  farm is  doing well and yet she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently,she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Verma

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Verma engages in weaving native products like hand bags made of palm. She is married and has seven children, two of whom attend school. Aside from weaving, she also raises and sells hogs to be able to cater to the needs of her family. Her husband has an income from conducting domestic work like being a for-hire painter.

It has been almost 4 years now that Verma has engaged in this kind of living. She decided to avail herself of the funds to improve her two sources of income. Verma has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feed. These will boost her resources and improve the way of living.
She is hoping that she could expand her two livelihoods to be productive and successful.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is deeply grateful for CCT's and KIVA's continuous support of her livelihood. She has received a number of loans in the past that have helped pay for the regular maintenance of her tricycle and for her fruit/vegetable stand. It has ensured a steady income to support her family.

She trusts that you can again lend her funds in the amount of PHP 30,000 to pay for various kinds of fruits and veggies such as bananas, cabbage, eggplant, bitter gourd, beans, onions, garlic, etc. to sell at her store. She already has gained loyal customers in her community for her fresh produce. Her requested amount will surely help grow her vegetable/fruit sales.

Ivy dreams of having her own place in a nearby commercial area to attract more customers. She desires for her children to finish college to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for bananas, cabbage, eggplant, bitter gourd, beans, onions, garlic, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sepoima

texts.en: Sepoima is a 41 year old mother with 3 children, she runs a business of cattle farm in her village to earn a living. Sepoima requested for a loan to buy chemicals, backpack sprayer, chainsaw, water tank, to help her the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, backpack sprayer, chainsaw, water tank,

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “ 8 de diciembre”   está trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Anatalia.
Ella se destaca en este grupo por ser una persona muy luchadora, se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida, ella tiene una despensa, que monto con mucho esfuerzo, y poco a poco la ha ido mejorando y ofrece una mejor calidad cada vez más a sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de productos para su despensa, como ser: yerba, panificados, azúcar, lácteos, carnes, y otros, y así seguir dando a su familia una vida digna y si privaciones, a la vez que cumple con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named “8 de Diciembre” (December 8th) is working with the poverty elimination program. One of the members is Sra. Anatalia. She is known in this group for being a very determined individual who strives to help her family and provide them a better quality of life. Anatalia has a food pantry that she established with a great amount of effort. Little by little, she has been able to improve and provide better quality to her customers each time.

Anatalia is requesting a loan in order to buy products for her food pantry such as herbs, baked goods, sugar, dairy products, meats, and other items. This will allow her to continue providing a decent life for her family without any hardships. At the same time, she will be able to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy herbs, baked goods, sugar, dairy products, meats, and other items.

loans.name: Boeurn

texts.en:
At the age of 26 years old, Boeurn works as a farmer at a rice field that is located not very close to his house. Boeurn is able to earn USD 4 a day to support his family. He is single. So far, he has been a farmer for about seven years.

Due to his work place being a little bit far from home, Boeurn would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy a motorbike to ride to his work place. In fact, he is an old client of HKL because he has already received one loan from HKL, but this time he would like to get a loan from Kiva since it has a lower interest rate than the usual loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to ride to his work place

loans.name: Sokkhom

texts.en:
Sokkhom, 56 years old, is a fisherman who lives in Baray district, Kampong Thom Province. He is a hard-working father of two children. His wife is also a fish seller and this couple can make a net profit approximately USD 7.5 a day.
During this time, Sokkhom is facing with a financial issue in his family. He needs some money to buy a boat for fishing where is so far from his house but yet he can’t afford.  After getting to know that HKL provides KIVA loan with the lower interest rate than its normal loan, he has decided to apply for a KIVA loan to help them. He would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy a boat for fishing so that he may increase the amount of fish caught to support his family

loans.name: Jose Adolfo

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad habita en  vivienda propia en la cual ha vivido durante toda su vida, vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 3, 11 y 13 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que labora como albañil independiente y de esta forma se gana la vida para poder cubrir las necesidades de su esposa y sus hijos, José y su familia viven en una casa muy humilde, y a causa del tiempo que ha transcurrido se puede dar cuenta de la necesidad que hay de reparar partes de la vivienda, principalmente el techo y es por ello que desea cambiarlo ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado, mostrando como parte más afectada la parte de la cocina y es de vital importancia repararlo lo más pronto posible. Pero en vista que José no cuenta con los fondos necesarios solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su cocina y de esta forma poder tener mayor tranquilidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
José, 41 years old, lives in his own home in which he has lived all his life. He lives with his life partner and their three children, ages 3, 11, and 13. He is a hardworking man who works as an independent construction worker. In this way he earns a living to be able to cover the needs of his wife and children.

José and his family live in a very humble house. Because of the time that has passed he can realize the need that exists to repair parts of it, primarily the ceiling, and he wants to change it. Currently it is deteriorating, showing that the most affected part is the kitchen, and it is of vital importance to repair it as soon as possible.

In light of not having enough funds, José is seeking a FUSAI loan to invest in metal sheets, wood, and nails to change the ceiling of his kitchen and in this way be able to have more tranquility in his home.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, wood, and nails to change the ceiling of his kitchen.

loans.name: Evernadeth

texts.en: Evernadeth, 51 years old, is married with two children. She has been selling fish in the villages to make a living. She owns and manages a fishing business and sells the fish in the market. She borrowed a loan to buy new fishing nets to improve the fishing activity. She was able to help and support her parents' needs with her business. She is hoping to make more income to build a house so she will have a comfortable and safe life with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her fishing activities.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 53 years old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years.

She is a mother of 5 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings

loans.name: Root

texts.en:
It was hard for Root to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. She is 30 years old, a married woman, with 4 children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Root has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Jesielle

texts.en:
Jesielle is a 35-year-old married woman. She settled to earn his living in Malibangcao, together with her two children. Over ten years, Jesielle was able to managed her farm that absolutely met the needs of her family. Until now, the farm is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With her generated revenue,she was able to save for their future needs.

Recently, She took a new loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer to improve her farm. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Alexander expects an increase in sales, so as to expand his farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her mango farm.

loans.name: Leudys Rebeca

texts.es: Leudys es una microempresaria residente en el municipio de Galapa, oriunda del vecino país de Venezuela que decidió radicarse en una población del departamento del Atlántico para buscar nuevos horizontes e iniciar su negocio de comidas desde su vivienda.  Ella todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. inicia la preparación de sus comidas y termina su producción a las 3 p.m., y sus vecinos degustan de deliciosos platos típicos.  Ella es madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad a quienes les ofrece bienestar con su negocio, así mismo su cónyuge la apoya en sus ideas de negocio. Leudys  está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para realizar adecuaciones a su lugar de trabajo con la finalidad de ofrecer más comodidad a sus clientes. Su meta es tener un local y poder contratar colaboradores, así mismo poder comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Leudys is a micro-entrepreneur who lives in the municipality of Galapa and is a native of neighboring country Venezuela. She decided to make her home somewhere in the department of the Atlantic to find new horizons and start a food business from her home. 

Every day, she starts preparing her meals at 8 am and finishes her work at 3 pm, and her neighbors enjoy every bit of her delicious typical dishes.

She is a mother to 4 younger children to whom she provides her care through her business. Likewise, her spouse supports her with business ideas. Leudys is applying for a loan through Kiva, and it is the first financing she is making with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan she wants to make renovations to the place of her work for the purpose of offering a more comfortable environment for her clients.

Her goal is to have a store and to be able to hire co-workers so that she can buy a home.

loans.use: to make renovations to her place of work.

loans.name: Sreyoun's Group

texts.en:
Sreyoun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreyoun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chhen's Group

texts.en:
Chhen’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chhen makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vuthey's Group

texts.en:
Vuthey’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vuthey works as a farmer and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bakhtawar

texts.en:
Bakhtawar is 54 years old, a married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Bakhtawar makes enough to provide for her family.

To keep her store fully stocked she requested for a loan of 50000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Bakhtawar wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers

loans.name: Seineang's Group

texts.en:
Seineang’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Seineang works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

texts.en:
Sokhea’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokhea makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
