Vin’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Savan's Group

texts.en:
Savan’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Savan makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and this woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en:
Sarim’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sarim works as farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer​ and hairdresser to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and this woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
Sokchea’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokchea works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chamroeun's Group

texts.en: Chamroeun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chamroeun works as farmer and he also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.fr: Marie Rose a acheté un nouvel arrivage de médicaments pour sa pharmacie. Cela lui a permis d'augmenter légèrement ses chiffres d'affaires. Ses enfants viennent de reprendre le chemin de l'école. Elle a pu couvrir en partie les dépenses de scolarisation grâce à de l'argent épargné sur les bénéfices de son activité. Elle demande un nouveau crédit pour acheter d'autres produits pour la pharmacie.
texts.en: Marie Rose has restocked medications in her pharmacy. This has allowed her to slightly increase her sales volume. Her children just started a new school year. She was able to cover the school fees thanks to money she was managed to put aside from her earnings. She is requesting a new loan in order to buy new products for her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy new medicines.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Being a farmer on the rice field, Ry, who is a 27 years old and married woman with two children who are enrolled in the local primary school, can only make $5 USD per day to support her family. Ry resides in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been involving in this career for nearly 8 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, RY would like to get a low-interest loan from Kiva in order to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan since it will promote her health, environment, and living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Utuagiagi

texts.en:
Utuagiagi is a 62-year-old mother with 2 children. She runs a business of selling fish in her community to earn a living.

Utuagiagi requested a loan to buy a fishing boat, ice bag, torch, container, and fishing net to help her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, ice bag, torch, container, and fishing net.

loans.name: Fua

texts.en: Fua is a 61 year old mother with 4 children. She had a small business of sewing clothes and selling  them in her community to earn a living.  Fua requested for a loan to buy a roll of material, needles, sewing machine, tape measurement, to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a roll of material, needles, sewing machine, tape measurement

loans.name: Lourdes Celia

texts.es:
La socia Lourdes Celia pertenece al banco comunal BUENA ESPERANZA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue  trabajando en una empresa privada, la socia continua trabajando en el área de cocina, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres como arroz, aceite, leche y menestras.
texts.en:
Lourdes Celia is a member of "Good Hope" Communal Bank, located in the district and department of Cusco. She continues to work in a private enterprise; she continues to work in the culinary field. She is enjoying her time with her business, which is going well because of the effort she puts in each day into her work.

She feels thankful for the past loan she received and promises to repay her set dues.

Lourdes Celia desires to keep working so that in this way she can keep supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase groceries such as rice, cooking oil, milk, and vegetable soups.

loans.use: para la compra de víveres como arroz, aceite, leche y menestras.

loans.name: Iris Agustina

texts.es:
La socia Iris Agustina pertenece al banco comunal BUENA ESPERANZA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue con su negocio de venta de productos de  belleza, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas.
texts.en:
Iris Agustina belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" communal bank, located in Cusco district, Cusco department.

The borrower is continuing with her business selling beauty products. She has had her business for some time, and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it each day.

She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her instalment payments. She wishes to continue working, to in this way continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase women's perfumes.

loans.use: to buy women's perfumes

loans.name: Dolores Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto, de 36 años de edad, está casado, vive con su esposa que actualmente está embarazada de su primer bebe.

Gilberto, se dedica a la pesca artesanal, esta actividad es muy común en la zona donde residen, porque está muy cerca el rio, la mayoría de las personas sobreviven de esta actividad. Pero aparte de eso también se dedica a la agricultura, para tener granos básicos para el consumo de su familia. 

Gilberto, necesita el préstamo para comprar los insumos agrícolas para la siembra de frijoles, ya que hoy han comenzado las lluvias y la tierra es buena par la siembra. 

Los planes de Gilberto, son seguir trabajando para poder darle lo mejor a su hijo y a su esposa.
texts.en:
Gilberto, 36 years old, is married and lives with his wife who is currently pregnant with their first child. He makes a living in small-scale fishing. This occupation is very common in the area where they live because it's very close to the river. Most people subsist on this occupation. But apart from that, he also works in agriculture to have staple grains for the family consumption.

Gilberto needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies for planting beans, since now the rains have begun and the land is good for planting.

Gilberto's plans are to keep working to be able to give the best to his son and to his wife.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for planting beans.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a 53-year-old married woman. She lives in the rural area of Dumanjug, Cebu with her husband and three grown children. She raises hogs to earn for a living. Her husband is a farmer. Her income goes for food and supplies for the pigs.

Emelia has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy pigs and feed. These are vital in augmenting her livelihood. She now raises quality hogs that slowly keep her going to the road of progress.

In the future, Emelia is hoping that she could expand her source of earnings by increasing the numbers of hogs to become sustainable and financially stable.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokun works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 49-year-old married woman who has six children. She lives in a populated area, and her son knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruit from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers.

Zubaida's son chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruit every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruit. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he could sell the maximum amount of fruits till evening and get maximum reward for his efforts.

Zubaida applied for a loan so her son can purchase more fruit and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fruit for her son's fruit selling business. .

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing this for the past four years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. She sews garments for the nearest factories; her husband brings cloth from the factories. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has became out of order due to continuous work.

Uzma thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring services.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en:
Asima, 32, is the mother of two daughters and two sons, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She is very hardworking, gracious and honest. Her husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers different types of delicious food two times a day. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earning a good profit from the restaurant business. She helps her husband by cooking various foods at home and her husband sells it at his restaurant. He offers tea to his customers also. Now he wants to establish his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron etc. Due to the household expenses, his savings are not enough to buy the desired things.

Therefore, Asima requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron etc. Asima thanks Kiva and appreciates the warmth support of her.

loans.use: to buy furniture, utensils,  a cauldron, and spices for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Claudie

texts.fr: Claudie, 29 ans, vit avec son enfant à Bon Repos. Divorcée, elle s’occupe seule des besoins de l’enfant. Elle vend  des produits alimentaires pour pouvoir générer un peu de revenus. Elle veut faire un prêt pour investir  dans l’achat de nouveaux produits afin de capter plus de clients durant la rentrée des classes. Elle souhaite un grand changement dans sa situation économique.
texts.en: Claudie, 29 years old, lives with her child in Bon Repos. Divorced, she takes care of her child's needs alone. She sells food products in order to be able to generate a little income. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of new products so that she can attract more clients at the start of the school year. She wishes for a great change in her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy cases of oil.

loans.name: Marie Michelle H.

texts.fr: Marie, âgée de 53 ans, est une femme mariée et la mère de deux enfants qui ont déjà fondé leurs propres familles. Elle est propriétaire d’une épicerie. Marie demande un crédit pour augmenter son stock de boissons énergisante. Elle espère accroître ses ventes pour en tirer plus de revenus.
texts.en: Marie, 53 years old, is a married woman and the mother of two children, who have already started their own families. She is the owner of a grocery store. Marie is requesting a loan to increase her stock of energy drinks. She hopes to increase her sales in order to make a greater revenue.

loans.use: to buy energy drinks.

loans.name: Sapani

texts.en: Sapani is a 40-year-old mother with seven children. She has a small business sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living. She has had this experience for more than two years. Sapani requested a loan to buy a container, rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measure, paint color, and paint brush to help her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a container, rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measure, paint color, and paint brush

loans.name: Tasesa

texts.en:
Tasesa is 60 years old with 2 children. She is still fit and strong to run her business of selling taro and banana at the market with the help of her children.

Tasesa requested for a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run her business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2010. She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Liva

texts.en:
Liva is a 25-year-old mother with 1 child. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living.

Liva requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, a printing machine, and a tape measure to assist her run the business.

She has been doing this for more than a year. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She joined SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, a printing machine, and a tape measure.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is a widow. She has an adult daughter. She owns a business.

Natalya has been selling and sewing curtains for 6 years. She owns a sales spot at the central market. Natalya faced a challenging time during local currency devaluation earlier this year, but being a hardworking person she made it through. Natalya is an open and friendly person.

Natalya is asking for a loan of 31 000 UAH to purchase curtains for sale. The loan will help to increase her assortment of goods and attract new clients.

loans.use: to purchase curtains for sale

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 38-year-old married father of three children, who has been working in a printing company since 2010 to support his family.

Ibrahim is the sole breadwinner since his wife prefers to take care of her beloved children in a well-managed way.

Since Ibrahim is employed with a limited monthly income, he is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children school tuition fees. He hopes that in the future, he can be promoted in his job, and insure a steady financial situation for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Kaeng's Group

texts.en: Kaeng’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Kaeng works as famrer and he also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is a hard-working woman who lives in the town of Barili, Cebu. She is also seeking ways to improve her quality of life so she wants to begin offering a sound system for rent. She is 33-year-old married woman with no dependents.

Razel has had her own home, and so she is happy to have her own, welcoming place in which to live. She has decided to avail herself of the loan to buy accessories for the sound system and its maintenance. In this way she hopes to improve her financial income.

With her previous loan, Razel managed to invest in buying various accessories for the sound system, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy accessories for a sound system and its maintenance.

loans.name: Fontaine

texts.fr: Fontaine, 30  ans, vit en union libre. Il a un fils. Pour trouver de quoi répondre aux besoins de tous les jours, il a entrepris de démarrer une petite activité de revente d’articles divers. Il revend des lunettes, des télécommandes pour téléviseurs, des radios, des multiprises électriques, etc. Il a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Fontaine, 30 years old, lives with his partner and has a son. In order to meet everyday needs, he has started a small business selling various second-hand items. He resales glasses, TV remotes, radios, power strips, etc. He needs a loan to increase his inventory.

loans.use: to buy sunglasses.

loans.name: Fale

texts.en:
Fale is a 28-year-old mother with 1 child. She runs a business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living.

Fale requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, hand gloves, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, and chemicals to help her run the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, hand gloves, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, and chemicals.

loans.name: Sine

texts.en:
Sine is 48 years old with 5 children. She runs a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Sine requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, banana tubes (seedlings), and a backpack sprayer to assist her to run the business.

She joined SPBD in 2014, and she will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, banana tubes (seedlings), and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 45 years old. She is a widow and a mother of six children. 

Her business is a green grocery shop. She has been in the business for 20 years. 

She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase oranges, avocados, tomatoes, onions, bananas and cabbages for sale.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, avocados, tomatoes, onions, bananas and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Being a farmer on the rice field, Yorn, who is a 46 years old and a married woman with two children, can only make $5 USD per day to support her family. Yorn resides in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been involving in this career for nearly 22 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Yorn would like to get a low-interest loan from Kiva in order to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan since it will promote her health, environment, and living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 23 years old. She is married and a mother of one child.

Her business is a retail shop. She has been in the business for 2 years. She earns a monthly income of eighteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. for the shop.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children and increase her savings.

Her hopes and dreams are to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Beriter

texts.en:
Beriter is 48 years old. She is married and has six children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES (Kenya shillings).

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
Hen, aged 56 years, is a married mother of six children, four of whom rely on her. Residing in a rural area of Kampong Thom province, Hen makes a living by growing rice and cassava for her main income and she has been involved in this business for years. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Her businesses earn her about USD4 per day and she can manage to save about USD2 each day for future needs. Flood and diseases are the obstacles to her farming business.

This is the first loan for her with VisionFund and Hen, the leader of a group of two members, wants to provide her family with healthy lives. She will use her loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes that this loan can make her life become healthier and protect all family members from infectious diseases.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine to protect all family members from infectious diseases.

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
In a very nice village Syunik of the same Syunik region lives Mkhitar with his wife and three sons. Here Mkhitar is busy with poultry (he has 70 chickens and he manages to sell a lot of eggs) and also fruit and vegetable production (he has apple, apricot, nuts, persimmon and fig trees). He has a small greenhouse where all year long he cultivates greens for sale.

Now Mkhitar has a lot work connected with his greenhouse, as he must prepare the soil for new season works and he also needs to do some repairing works in his greenhouse. So this loan of 650.000 Armenian drams he needs to repair the roof of the greenhouse, buy fertilizer and he also must make the purchase of fodder for his chickens.

loans.use: to repair the roof of the greenhouse, buy fertilizer and purchase fodder for his chickens.

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon is 52 years old and he lives with his wife and school-aged son in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Levon has a specialty of chemist but he never work of his profession instead for 15 years he is engaged in the clothes trading business.

In a rented stall at the city’s wholesale market Levon sells men clothes; these are coats, vests, suits, trousers, shirts, jackets and etc. Levon mentions that he has a lot of regular customers, who has become already his friends, whose tastes and sizes he already knows and he always has the clothes of their preferred one. This is the only source of income for his family and Levon does his best to develop it. His wife greatly helps him in this work and it has become like a small family business.

Now this loan of 600.000 Armenian drams Levon asks as he needs to refresh his autumn-winter clothes collection with new models as now these season clothes are already in great demand.

loans.use: to refresh his autumn-winter clothes collection with new models, as now this season's clothes are already in great demand.

loans.name: Manelia

texts.fr: Manelia, 54 ans, est revendeuse de produits alimentaires depuis déjà 20 ans. Veuve et mère de deux enfants, elle travaille sans relâche pour améliorer sa situation financière. Elle veut avoir prêt pour  acheter de nouveaux produits pour agrandir son commerce. Elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: Manelia, 54 years old, has already been selling food products for 20 years. Widow and mother of two children, she works relentlessly to improve her financial situation. She want to have a loan to buy new products to increase her business. She wishes to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Roseny

texts.fr: Roseny est âgée de 29 ans. Elle vit en union libre. Elle a un enfant à charge. Elle vend des produits alimentaires au marché public de son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de gagner des revenus pour nourrir sa famille et faire un peu d’épargne.
texts.en: Roseny is 29 years old. She lives with her partner and has one child in her care. She sells food products at the public market in her neighborhood. This business allows her to make an income to feed her family and to save some money.

loans.use: to buy corn meal.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Financial constraints alongside the want for a better life and good quality education for her 4 children are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged Basheeran to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.

Basheeran is 56 years old; she is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en:
Fetu is a 31-year-old mother with 3 children. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Fetu requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, canned tuna, plastic bags, butter, mayonnaise, and containers to assist with the business.

She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, canned tuna, plastic bags, butter, mayonnaise, and containers.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Angela de 23 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia en la cual vive al lado de su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 3 y 7 años y una hija de 2 años de edad. Angela es una persona muy trabajadora quien labora en la agricultura con el fin de sacar adelante a sus tres hijos y darles una buena educación, además su compañero de vida le ayuda con la economía del hogar. La vivienda de Angela es pequeña y muy humilde, se ha construido con lámina la cual con el pasar del tiempo se ha deteriorado, el sueño de ella es poder vivir en una casa con materiales de mejor calidad y de esta forma brindarles una mejor forma de vida a sus hijos y así poder dormir sin preocupación los días de lluvias y para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos y pago de mano de obra para mejorar su vivienda. La cual desea hacer colocando lámina nueva y de buena calidad, de esta manera vivir mejor y de una forma más segura, sin temor a alguna tragedia por los cambios climáticos.
texts.en: Angela, 23 years old, lives in her own home with her life partner and their sons, ages 3 and 7, and their 2-year-old daughter. Angela is a very hardworking person who works in agriculture to get her three children ahead and give them a good education. Her life partner also helps her with the economy of the home. Angela's home is small and humble. It is built of metal sheeting, which with time has deteriorated. Her dream is to be able to live in a house with materials of better quality and in this way give her children a better way of life and be able to sleep without worrying about rainy days. That is why she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: metal sheeting, nails, and labor costs to improve her home. She would like to do so by putting up new metal sheeting of good quality, and in this way live better and more securely, without fear of tragedy from weather changes.

loans.use: to invest in: metal sheeting, nails, and labor costs to improve her home.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, 34 years old, is a fish seller who lives in Santuk district, Kampong Thom Province. She is a hard-working mother of two children who are enrolled in the primary school. Her husband is also a fisherman. This couple can make a net profit approximately USD 15 a day.

During this time, Sophea is facing with a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy a boat to fishing for her husband which is so far from their house but yet she can’t afford. After getting to know that HKL provides Kiva loan with the lower interest rate than its normal loan, she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help them. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new boat to fishing to help the family business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La socia Eugenia pertenece al banco comunal BUENA ESPERANZA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 61 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando como enfermera, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar,leche entre otros.
texts.en:
Eugenia belongs to the community bank BUENA ESPERANZA (GOOD HOPE). The bank is located in the district of Cusco and department of Cusco.

She is 61 years old, has 2 children and is single. She alternates her days working as a nurse. She has a good time with her work. It is going well because of the effort she puts in every day. Eugenia is grateful for the loan and agrees to comply with the established quotas. She wants to continue working to be able to continue to support her family.

Eugenia requests a loan to buy food for her household such as rice, sugar, milk and others.

loans.use: to buy food for her household such as rice, sugar, milk and others.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a 49-year-old married woman with five children. Three of them are still attending school and they are aged 8-15 years old.

Three years ago she started running a sari-sari (variety) store from her house to help her husband to cover the needs and expenses of their children. In addition to that, she also raises and sells pigs.

Saturnina is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children.

She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI in order to purchase grocery items, piglets and feed.

Saturnina hopes to expand her business more in the future by increasing the number of pigs and maintain the inventory of merchandise of her store in order to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase grocery item, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Leyus

texts.fr: Leyus est un jeune entrepreneur âgé de 25 ans. Il vit en union libre et a un enfant. Il mène une activité de revente de képis et des écouteurs. Il cherche un prêt pour pourvoir agrandir davantage son activité et augmenter ses revenus pour mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Leyus is a young entrepreneur of 25 years old. She lives with her partner and has a child. He leads a retail business for hats and headphones. He is seeking a loan to be able to grow his business even more and increase his revenue in order to better respond to the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of hats.

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en:
Chhorn, who is 23 years old, is married. She earns a living through growing rice and cassava in her local area of Kampong Cham province. Having been involved in the farming business for years, Chhorn earns about USD11 per day and can save about USD7 each day. The challenge to her farming business is getting lower yields from her rice farm while the cost of inputs such as fuel and organic fertilizer is high.

She decided to form a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund to support her farming business by purchasing organic fertilizer to boost crop yields and purchasing fuel for a pumping machine with the loan portion left. She hopes to gain more yields so as to meet her family’s needs and upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to boost crop yields so that she can earn more income to save for future needs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 38 years old and a Samoan citizen. She is a mother of eight children and she runs a convenience store in her village to earn a living.

She is hoping to expand her business and provide good services to her customers by satisfying their needs from her store. But in order to do this, Dorothy requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of twistiest, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage, etc. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of twisties , box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage, etc.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El socio Hernan pertenece al banco comunal BUENA ESPERANZA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio sigue  trabajando en una agencia de viajes, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de paquetes turísticos, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio  se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos y entradas turísticas.
texts.en:
Hernan belongs to the community bank BUENA ESPERANZA (GOOD HOPE). The bank is located in the district of Cusco and department of Cusco.

He continues to work in a travel agency. He has a good time with his work. It is going well because of the effort he puts it every day. Hernan continues to sell different types of tour packages. He wants to continue working so that he can continue to support his family.

Hernan is grateful for the loan and agrees to meet the payments. He requests a loan to buy tickets and tourist admissions.

loans.use: to buy tickets and tourist admissions.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Maria Angelica pertenece al banco comunal BUENA ESPERANZA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de desayunos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche, quinua entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, Maria Angelica, belongs to the communal bank BUENA ESPERANZA [Good Hope]. The bank is located in the Cusco district in the department of Cusco.

Maria Angelica alternates her daily activities with her business of breakfast sales. She has done this work for a good amount of time, which is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work each day. Maria Angelica feels grateful for the granted loan and promises to fulfill the established payments. She wants to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

Maria Angelica requests the loan to buy sugar, milk, and quinoa, among other things.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, and quinoa, among other things.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 60 years old. He is married and has three children. He has a farming business, and has been doing it for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 18,000 Kenyan Shillings.

This is Peter's third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. He will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his children and increase his savings. His hope and dream is to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Maragrit lives with her son and husband in Areni village of Vayots Dzor region. By keeping a cow, a calf and 20 colonies of bees, Margarit has been involved in farming for many years.

She gets high quality and tasty products from her farm and sells them in local markets. Margarit has now applied for this loan to purchase two oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. This will help her to develop her farming business and gather more income for her family.

As this is Margarit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

Additional income would greatly assist Margarit's family to cover their costs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 44-year-old married mother of one child. Five years ago, she started selling clothes from her house to help her husband (who traveled abroad seeking a better salary) to cover the needs and expenses of their family. She is well-known in her region and has a good reputation among her customers.

Amal is trying hard to develop her business. Thus, today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of fashionable clothes for the upcoming winter season.

Amal hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own clothing shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of fashionable clothes for the upcoming winter season.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en:
Akif is 52 years old and married. He has two kids. Akif is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives in Bilesuvar region.

Akif is a car repair man. He has been working at this job for 20 years. He has experience, and he is also a hardworking and steady person. Akif is insistent and diligent.

He doesn’t earn a good income. Akif needs a 1,200 AZN loan to buy new machine tools, so his family can have good living conditions. So, Akif needs help from Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to buy new machine tools, so his family can have good living conditions.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 56 years old. She is married and a mother of four children.

Monica is in the business of poultry keeping and farming. She has been in the business for one year. She earns a monthly income of 24,000 Kenyan Shillings.

This is Monica's second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm, and chicken for rearing and selling later.

Monica will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm, and chicken for rearing and selling later.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old. He is married with one child.

He has had a butchery business for ten years, and it has been profitable.

He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will be using to purchase goats to slaughter. He hopes this will help him educate his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to grow his business and become the biggest in the region.

loans.use: to purchase goats to slaughter; he hopes this will help him educate his children.

loans.name: Ana Cleotilde

texts.es: Ana de 50 años de edad, tiene quince años de residir en vivienda propia al lado de un nieto de 5 años, un hijo y una hija, ambos mayores de edad. Ana posee un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa interior para dama, para caballero y blusas, negocio con el cual ha podido mantener la economía del hogar. Este negocio la ha manejado por varios años, lo que le permite que para este tiempo ya posea un número de clientes bastante grande y lo que le permite que este negocio le sea bastante fructífero, pero Ana desea poder mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello quiere aumentar las ventas de sus productos para poder aumentar las ganancias y para ello es necesario hacer una inversión, pero no cuenta con los fondos necesarios. Por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa interior para dama, para caballero y blusas. De esta manera aumentar la mercadería y así aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
For the past 15 years, 50-year-old Ana has been living in a house she owns, along with a 5-year-old grandson and a son and daughter, both adults.

Ana owns a small business selling men's and women's underwear and blouses, a business with which she has been able to support the household budget. She has managed this business for many years, which means that by this time, she has a very large number of customers and the business is quite successful.

But Ana wants to be able to improve her quality of life, and to do this, she wants to increase sales of her products in order to increase her earnings. For this, it is necessary to make an investment, but she doesn't have the required funds.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in men's and women's undergarments, and blouses. This way she will expand her merchandise and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to invest in men's and women's undergarments, and blouses, to increase sales

loans.name: Roeun's Group

texts.en:
Roeun is a 47-year-old married woman and resides in the Kampong Cham province. She is blessed with two dependent children. In order to make a living, she grows rice and raises chickens. She has been involved in her farming business for 29 years. The obstacle she faces in this business is the lack of working capital to afford rice and fuel, which are high in price.

Roeun is leading a group of three members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland and protect her farm from being destroyed by insects. Moreover, some portion of her loan will be used to buy fuel for a pumping machine. She hopes that her crop will produce more yields so that she can upgrade her standard of living and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide to protect her farm from being destroyed by insects.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Thom province, Lim is a married farmer who has a dependent daughter to take care of.

Lim, together with her husband, has been growing rice and traveling to sell dessert form place to place. She has been involved in her farming business for 35 years. Earning about USD 13 per day, Lim can save about USD 8 per day after daily expenses. Lack of working capital is the main challenge to her farming business.

Leading a group of two members to request a loan from VisionFund, Lim will use her loan to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to see all of her family members live healthily and hopes to reduce cost of health care service.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to improve her family's living and health as well as reduce the cost of health care service.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Nicole

texts.fr: Nicole a 40 ans. Elle est mariée et a deux enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle vend des produits alimentaires dans une petite épicerie qu’elle a ouverte avec l’aide de son mari. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. À l’avenir, elle espère ainsi augmenter les revenus liés à son activité.
texts.en: Nicole is 40 years old, married, and has two children. To meet his family's needs, she sells food products in a little grocery that she opened with the help of her husband. She is requesting a microloan to increase her inventory. This way, she hopes to increase her business-related revenue in the future.

loans.use: to buy boxes of salmon.

loans.name: Jose Maximiliano

texts.es: José de 63 años de edad, es una persona quien vive de manera humilde en vivienda propia en la cual tienen 32 años de residir. José es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, él se dedica a cultivar fruta principalmente plátano, luego de la cosecha los lleva para venderlos en los mercados cercanos a su comunidad, negocio que lleva ya varios años manejando y de esta manera puede satisfacer sus necesidades básicas. La vivienda de José es pequeña y muy humilde, se ha construido con lámina la cual muestra un desgaste por el tiempo transcurrido, además la lámina que ahorita posee está sostenida con madera y la cual también necesita ser cambiada. Para ello José solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, polines y el pago de la mano de obra para mejorar el techo de la vivienda y así tener unas noches más tranquilas sin la preocupación del frío y sin miedo a alguna tragedia por las constantes lluvias.
texts.en:
Jose is 63 years old. He lives humbly in his own home of 32 years. Jose is very responsible and hardworking. He cultivates fruit, mainly banana. After harvest, he takes them to sell in the markets near the community. He has been in this business for several years and it allows him to meet basic needs .

Jose’s house is small and very humble. It was built with sheets of material which is showing the wear over time. In addition, sheets is supported with wood which also needs to be changed. Jose requests a loan with FUSAI to invest in sheets, poles and payment of labor to improve the roof. This will provide peaceful nights without worrying about being cold and fear of continuous rains.

loans.use: to invest in sheets, poles and payment of labor to improve the roof of his house.

loans.name: Shatha

texts.en:
Shatha is a young, talented and clever woman. She is married and only 25 years old. She lives in Jenin city, and is responsible of her beloved two children. They are small: four and two years old.

Shatha has her own business sewing clothes and loves working in this line of business. She earns a daily income and has regular clients. Shatha is a very determined and goal-oriented person. She wants to expand her sewing business as way to increase her daily income, so she needs a certain sum of money.

Shatha decided to purchase a sewing machine and other sewing materials such as fabric. She intends to develop her life as well as keep educating her children for life. She requested a loan of $1,500 from Kiva's partner, Alibdaa, to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase an extra sewing machine and some fabric

loans.name: Sillianie

texts.fr: Sillanie est âgée de 35 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a 3 enfants qui sont régulièrement scolarisés. Elle vend des produits alimentaires sous une tente chez elle, depuis plus de 5 ans. Sa boutique est très fréquentée dans la zone. Grâce à cette activité, elle arrive à contribuer aux nombreuses responsabilités de sa famille. Sillianie veut agrandir son commerce et pouvoir épargner pour les études de ses enfants. Voulant profiter des opportunités qu’elle a dans sa zone, elle a demandé un microcrédit pour pouvoir augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Sillanie is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and has 3 children, who are in school regularly. She has been selling food products for five years under a tent in her home. Her boutique is very busy in her area. Thanks to this business, she manages to contribute to the numerous responsibilities of her family. Sillanie wants to grow her business and to be able to save up for her children's studies. Desiring to profit from the opportunities that she has in her neighborhood, she has requested a microloan in order to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy some egg cartons and sacks of beans.

loans.name: Pierre Joseph

texts.fr:
41 ans, marié, Pierre Joseph est un brave père de trois enfants de 9 à 21 ans, dont les deux derniers vont actuellement à l'école. L'ainé l'aide dans l'exercice de son activité. 
Sa femme travaille dans une entreprise de zone franche et lui, il dirige un petit commerce de détail dont les marchandises proposées varient selon les circonstances et les demandes des consommateurs. En ce période de préparation à la rentrée scolaire des cartables et des fournitures scolaires sont les tendances. Il débutait en 2005, et il est débrouillard. De 2001 à 2005, il travaillait dans l'Entreprise COLAS et son salaire ne lui satisfaisait pas donc il démissionnait et choisissait de changer de filière. Il rêve de construire sa propre maison pour éviter de louer.
texts.en:
Pierre Joseph is 41 years old. He is a determined person and the father of three children ranging from 9 to 21 years of age. The two youngest children attend school. The eldest helps his father in the business. Pierre Joseph's wife works for a company in the tax-free zone. As to Pierre Joseph, he runs a small store in which he sells various merchandise in accordance with changing customer demand. During the time preceding a new school year, backpacks and school supplies are in great demand. 

Pierre Joseph launched this business in 2005. He is very resourceful. From 2001 to 2005 he  used to work for the COLAS company, but his salary was insufficient, so he resigned and decided to change his career path. His dream is to build his own house and  no longer have to rent.

loans.use: to buy backpacks,  school supplies etc.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
La socia   Yobana pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche,arroz,aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
Yobana is a partner of the communal bank "San Bartolome de Tambo Real". She continues working in a shop selling groceries.

She feels thankful for the loan given to her and is committed to comply with her payments. The member continues selling merchandise like rice, sugar, and milk, among others. This way, the member carries her family forward. 

The member will use the credit to buy rice, sugar, and milk, among others.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, and oil among, others

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Susana, la socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia continua dedicándose a  la Ganadería, principalmente  la venta de leche de vaca, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicito el crédito para arreglar su establo.
texts.en:
Susana belongs to the community bank SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL. She continues to work with livestock, mainly sales of cow's milk. She has a good time with her work. It is going well because of the efforts she puts in every day. She wants to continue working so that she can continue to support her family.

Susana is grateful for the loan and agrees to meet the payments. She requests a loan to fix her barn.

loans.use: to fix her barn.

loans.name: Union Fait La Force Group

texts.fr: En 2011, l'esprit d'entrepreneuriat m'est venu en tête et m'a poussé à créer une activité commerciale" nous déclare Martine. Elle nous confie qu'elle aime cette indépendance et affirme qu'elle est soutenue par son époux. Le seul obstacle de son activité est l'insuffisance de fonds mais elle rêve d'avoir un grand magasin rempli de marchandises. Elle est présidente du groupe composé exclusivement de femmes nommé UNION FAIT LA FORCE. Sur photo, Martine est au centre des autres membres du groupe et s'appuie sur un de ses articles (couverture).
texts.en: "In 2011, an entrepreneurial spirit inspired and pushed me to start a commercial business," Martine told us. She revealed that she like that independence and affirms that she is supported by her husband. The only obstacle for her business is insufficient funding, but she dreams of having a big store full of merchandise. She is the president of a group made up exclusively of women called 'Union Fait La Force' (Unity Makes Strength). In the photo, Martine is in between the other members of the group and is leaning on one of her products (covers).

loans.use: to buy bedding sheets, covers, and men's shoes.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is 45 years old. She is married and a mother of four children. Her business is a retail shop, which she has had for two years. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan Shillings.

This is Celestine's second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. for her shop. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.fr: Les idées de créer une activité dont les revenus seront orientés dans la scolarisation des enfants ont poussé Rita à se lancer dans la vente de produits vivriers. Pour ce crédit, elle compte s'approvisionner suffisamment dans la farine de maïs. Pour elle, le problème actuel de cette activité est la mévente de produits. Toutefois, Rita ne désespère pas car elle rêve avoir un dépôt de référence dans la ville. Présidente du groupe RAFIKI, elle est habillé en pagne beige et foulard mauve.
texts.en: The idea to start a business whose revenue will be used for her children's education encouraged Rita to delve into selling food products. With this loan, she plans to sufficiently supply herself with corn flour. For her, the current problem in her business is a slump in products sales. Nevertheless, Rita is not giving up, as she dreams of having a kiosk in the city.  President of the group RAFIKI, she is dressed in beige cloths with a mauve headscarf.

loans.use: to buy corn flower to sell.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Rim, who is 41, comes from Kampong Thom Province. She is a farmer and mother of three children. Her husband is also a farmer on the cassava farmland. To make a living, Rim manages and operates a farming business, growing cassava to sell. She earns on average $9.00 (USD) a day. So far, she has been in this career for 15 years.

To ensure that her harvest is good, Rim requires some workers to assist her to weed the cassava fields, yet she doesn’t have sufficient money to do so. Therefore, she would like to apply for a Kiva loan to hire workers to weed her cassava fields and pay land rental to grow on this land. She would like to thank all lenders for her financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to hire workers to weed her cassava fields
